original: @178a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @178a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra m'a na bi ni shtsa ya t'i k'a /
analyzed: pra m'a na bi ni shtsa ya t'i k'a /
translated: Pramana-vini≈õcaya-tƒ´kƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad /
translated: Explanation of the Ascertainment of Valid Cognition

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One!

original: blo bzang gang gis phyi rol don ni zhal bzhes pa dang de bzhin rnam rig cam //
analyzed: blo bzang gang gis phyi rol don ni zhal bzhes pa dang de bzhin rnam rig cam //
translated: Those with good intellects assert external objects and also consciousness,

original: bden ba gnyis bsgrub pa dang lta ba gzhan gzhig pa dang lam kun mdzad pa yi //
analyzed: bden ba gnyis bsgrub pa dang lta ba gzhan gzhig pa dang lam kun mdzad pa yi //
translated: And establish the two truths, refute other views, and create the path.

original: sgrub byed nyid ni yang dag shes pa mngon sum de bzhen rjes dpag de rnam gnyis //
analyzed: sgrub byed nyid ni yang dag shes pa mngon sum de bzhen rjes dpag de rnam gnyis //
translated: The proof is right knowledge, which is direct perception, and inference, which is of two kinds.üîΩMay the glory of Dharmakƒ´rti, who accomplishes all reasonings, reign long!

original: rigs pa kun tu sgrub mdzad chos kyi grags pa dpal de yun ring rgyal gyur cig / de ni dpal ldan zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i yul can gyi rigs pa rab tu byed
analyzed: rigs pa kun tu sgrub mdzad chos kyi grags pa dpal de yun ring rgyal gyur cig / de ni dpal ldan zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i yul can gyi rigs pa rab tu byed
translated: By this verse beginning with glory, it is shown that the right knowledge with a real object explained by DignƒÅga

original: pa 'dis gsal bar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: pa 'dis gsal bar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: should be clarified by this treatise.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel du ni bstan bcos tshad ma kun las bsdus pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gyi cha gtsor rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel du ni bstan bcos tshad ma kun las bsdus pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gyi cha gtsor rtogs par byed do //
translated: In the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, the main point of the meaning of the words of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å asamuccaya is realized.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma rnam 'grel ni rnam 'grel zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma rnam 'grel ni rnam 'grel zhes bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika is called the ‚Äúcommentary.‚Äù

original: / bstan bcos 'di ni rigs pa'i cha gtsor ston pa'i phyir rigs pa'i bstan bcos yin gyi rnam 'grel ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / bstan bcos 'di ni rigs pa'i cha gtsor ston pa'i phyir rigs pa'i bstan bcos yin gyi rnam 'grel ni ma yin no //
translated: This treatise is a treatise of reasoning because it mainly teaches the aspect of reasoning. It is not a commentary.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos 'di zlos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos 'di zlos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this treatise is not a repetition.

original: kha cig 'di la rnam 'grel du 'chad par byed pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig 'di la rnam 'grel du 'chad par byed pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Some explain this as a commentary. That is not correct.

original: zlos bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it is a repetition.

original: @178b de nyid kyi phyir rigs pa'i cha yang dag pa'i shes pa mthar phyin bar ston pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsam mo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: @178b de nyid kyi phyir rigs pa'i cha yang dag pa'i shes pa mthar phyin bar ston pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsam mo zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that this treatise was composed in order to teach the correct cognition that is the culmination of the aspect of reasoning.

original: rigs pa dang bcas pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ma gtogs pas mi mkhas pa rnams la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang bcas pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ma gtogs pas mi mkhas pa rnams la zhes bya'o //
translated: The word ignorant refers to those who are not skilled in the means of right knowledge along with logic.

original: de dag kyang gzhan gyi sde pa mtha' dag dang / rang gi sde pa kha cig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan gyi sde pa mtha' dag dang / rang gi sde pa kha cig go //
translated: And these are all the schools of other sects and some of our own schools.

original: de zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas te /
translated: The word his refers to Dignaga.

original: de'i lugs ni gsal bar bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i lugs ni gsal bar bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The word system is connected with should be clarified.

original: de ji lta bu zhig gi zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig gi zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dpal ldan ni sbyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi bar bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan ni sbyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi bar bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word glorious refers to the accumulation of merit from generosity up to meditative concentration.

original: dri med blo mnga' ni nag nog med pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: dri med blo mnga' ni nag nog med pa'i blo ste /
translated: The word stainless refers to the stainless mind.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa dang ldan pas bsod nams kyi tshogs phun sum tshogs par ldan pa'o //üîΩde nyid ni 'bras bu las rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa dang ldan pas bsod nams kyi tshogs phun sum tshogs par ldan pa'o // de nyid ni 'bras bu las rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Since he possesses the pure accumulation of wisdom through the perfection of wisdom, he possesses the perfect accumulation of merit.

original: 'phags pa rang nyid bsnyen pas rjes su gzung gang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rang nyid bsnyen pas rjes su gzung gang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: That very [accumulation] should be understood from the result, as stated in the verse He who is accepted by the Noble Ones themselves.üîΩThe word accepted means accepted by the Noble Ones.

original: de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rje btsun 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rje btsun 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang 'brel to //
translated: Here, noble is connected with the venerable noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the bodhisattva without beginning.

original: de yang 'di skad grags te /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad grags te /
translated: And this is the well-known story:

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po bstan bcos mtha' dag chub par mdzad nas dgon pa'i phyogs shig tu nyan thos kyi lam gyis bdag nyid dul ba na zhi ba'i phyir brtson ba na ;
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po bstan bcos mtha' dag chub par mdzad nas dgon pa'i phyogs shig tu nyan thos kyi lam gyis bdag nyid dul ba na zhi ba'i phyir brtson ba na ;
translated: When the master DignƒÅga, having mastered all the treatises, was taming himself by the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas in a certain solitary place, striving for peace,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal nyid kyis drung du gshegs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal nyid kyis drung du gshegs nas /
translated: the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ himself came before him

original: rigs kyi bu khyod ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar bzod pa yin na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar bzod pa yin na /
translated: and said, Son of noble family, you are patient in working for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir bdag nyid kyi don byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag nyid kyi don byed /
translated: Why do you work for your own welfare?

original: 'di thong la sems can gyi don la spro bar gyis shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di thong la sems can gyi don la spro bar gyis shig ces gsungs so //
translated: Abandon this and delight in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis gsol pa /
translated: Then the master said,

original: 'phags pa bdag gi sems g-yo ba 'di rngo mi thogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gi sems g-yo ba 'di rngo mi thogs so //
translated: Noble one, this wavering of my mind is not possible.

original: 'phags bas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags bas gsungs pa /
translated: The noble one said,

original: khyod sangs rgyas kyi sar ma phyin pa'i bar du ngas yongs su gzung gis dogs par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyod sangs rgyas kyi sar ma phyin pa'i bar du ngas yongs su gzung gis dogs par ma byed cig /
translated: Until you reach the stage of Buddhahood, do not be afraid that I will not hold you.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis rab tu byed pa mang po brtsams pa la sogs pa 'jig rten la phan par mdzad do zhes mkhas pa rnams brgyud de grags pa yod do //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis rab tu byed pa mang po brtsams pa la sogs pa 'jig rten la phan par mdzad do zhes mkhas pa rnams brgyud de grags pa yod do //
translated: Then the Acarya composed many treatises and so on, and it is well known through the learned that he benefited the world.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba chung du ni blo ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba chung du ni blo ma btang ba'o //
translated: The own is the lesser acceptance, which is not giving up the mind.

original: 'bring ni sprul pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni sprul pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The middle is the teaching of the emanation.

original: mchog ni rang nyid kyis rjes su bzung pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni rang nyid kyis rjes su bzung pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the acceptance by oneself.

original: de nas slob dpon ni tshogs bsags pa ste /üîΩde lta ma yin na rjes @179a * //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon ni tshogs bsags pa ste / de lta ma yin na rjes @179a * //
translated: Then the Acarya is the accumulation of the assembly.

original: su bzung ba mchog ga la srid de /
analyzed: su bzung ba mchog ga la srid de /
translated: If it were not so, how could the supreme acceptance be possible?

original: gang zhes bya ba ni de'i dpal ldan skyon bral blo mnga' 'phags pa rang nyid bsnyen pas rjes su gzung gang zhes dang / gang de'i tshig lci ba zhes dang / gang de'i lugs ni zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni de'i dpal ldan skyon bral blo mnga' 'phags pa rang nyid bsnyen pas rjes su gzung gang zhes dang / gang de'i tshig lci ba zhes dang / gang de'i lugs ni zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The whoever is the glorious and faultless one, the noble one who is accepted by himself, and the whoever is connected with the heavy words of that one and the system of that one.

original: gang yang 'jig rten nye bar bsten bas rgyas par byed de la zhes dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten nye bar bsten bas rgyas par byed de la zhes dang 'brel to //
translated: And that which is expanded by the world's close attention is connected with that which is expanded by the world's close attention.

original: yang ci'i phyir de'i lugs dgrol bar gus she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de'i lugs dgrol bar gus she na /
translated: Again, why is it that he is revered for unraveling that system?

original: snying rjes so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rjes so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is due to compassion, he says

original: de'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that statement of his.

original: de ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga'o //
analyzed: de ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga'o //
translated: That refers to Dignaga.

original: tshig lci ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tshig lci ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gi rnam pa'o //
translated: Heavy words refers to the form of words.

original: nges bar rtogs pa med bar zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges bar rtogs pa med bar zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: Without definite understanding refers to not clearly understanding.

original: de'i tshig lci ba ni phyi'i byed ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshig lci ba ni phyi'i byed ba'o //
translated: His heavy words refers to the external action.

original: 'jig rten blo gros blun pa ni shes rab mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten blo gros blun pa ni shes rab mi gsal ba ste /
translated: The world's foolish intellect refers to unclear wisdom.

original: de ni nang gi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nang gi byed pa'o //
translated: That refers to the internal action.

original: de dag gis slob dpon la smod pa byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis slob dpon la smod pa byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: They will criticize the master.

original: slob dpon ni skyon med pa nyid do //
analyzed: slob dpon ni skyon med pa nyid do //
translated: The master is faultless.

original: ji lta bu zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig la zhe na /
translated: What kind of thing?

original: 'jig rten nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The world's close attention.

original: 'gro ba la zang zing gi bsnyen bkur gyis mgu ba byas pas snod du gyur ba rnams la chos bstan pas rgyas par byed ba la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la zang zing gi bsnyen bkur gyis mgu ba byas pas snod du gyur ba rnams la chos bstan pas rgyas par byed ba la'o //
translated: And by teaching them the Dharma, they are filled.

original: ji ltar smod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar smod ce na /
translated: How do they disparage?

original: rmongs pas te /
analyzed: rmongs pas te /
translated: Out of ignorance,

original: de kho na nyid legs par ma bsams so zhes bdag nyid mi shes pa slob dpon la sgro 'dogs pas so ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid legs par ma bsams so zhes bdag nyid mi shes pa slob dpon la sgro 'dogs pas so ;
translated: they do not properly consider reality, and so they falsely impute to the teacher that he does not know.

original: / de ltar yon tan mchog dang ldan pa la cung zad smod byed pa'ang /
analyzed: / de ltar yon tan mchog dang ldan pa la cung zad smod byed pa'ang /
translated: Thus, even a slight disparagement of one who has the highest qualities

original: don ma yin pa ni don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: don ma yin pa ni don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: is a great misfortune, which is the opposite of the goal.

original: ngan 'gro la sogs ba mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro la sogs ba mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is an undesirable state, such as rebirth in an unfortunate realm.

original: de lta bu chen po skyed byed de sbyin par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta bu chen po skyed byed de sbyin par byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is a great producer of such a misfortune,

original: mang du snod pa lta ci smos pa'o //
analyzed: mang du snod pa lta ci smos pa'o //
translated: what need is there to mention much disparagement?

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i 'jig rten la snying brtse ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i 'jig rten la snying brtse ba ste /
translated: Thus, the world, which is the cause of suffering, is the object of his compassion.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang bral bar 'dod bas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang bral bar 'dod bas so //
translated: He wishes to free it from the cause of suffering.

original: de'i lugs ci lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de'i lugs ci lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is his method?

original: sngar rigs pa'i bstan bcos so zhes smras te /
analyzed: sngar rigs pa'i bstan bcos so zhes smras te /
translated: He said in the treatise on logic above.

original: de'i phyir phan pa dang mi phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gnyis pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan pa dang mi phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gnyis pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says for the sake of benefit and non-detriment, etc. in the second line.

original: 'dis ni yang dag ba'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rigs ba dgos pa dang bcas par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag ba'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rigs ba dgos pa dang bcas par ston to //
translated: This shows that the treatise has the nature of correct knowledge and is purposeful.

original: snga ma'i tshigs su bcad pa stag rnam par rtsen pas ni /
analyzed: snga ma'i tshigs su bcad pa stag rnam par rtsen pas ni /
translated: The first verse, with the simile of the playful tiger,

original: zlos pa'i skyon sbang ba dang / rtsom pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: zlos pa'i skyon sbang ba dang / rtsom pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: removes the fault of repetition and shows the reason for composing the treatise.

original: gal te yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dgos pa bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dgos pa bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is asked what is the purpose of showing the purpose of correct knowledge,

original: las rtsom pa thams cad la @179b dgos pa bstan pa ni las de las gzhan dag 'jug par bya ba'i don to zhes bdag dang gzhan gyi sde pa kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: las rtsom pa thams cad la @179b dgos pa bstan pa ni las de las gzhan dag 'jug par bya ba'i don to zhes bdag dang gzhan gyi sde pa kha cig zer ro //
translated: some of our own and other schools say that showing the purpose of all actions is for the sake of engaging in those actions.

original: de la kha cig na re dgos pa ston pa'i ngag ni tshig yin la de dang don du 'brel bas nges pa med la /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re dgos pa ston pa'i ngag ni tshig yin la de dang don du 'brel bas nges pa med la /
translated: To that, some say that statements showing the purpose are words, and since they are related to the meaning, they are not definite.

original: tshig kha cig don la skyes pa yod kyang de'i bye brag rtogs dka' bas na rtog pa dang ldan pa dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhe'o //
analyzed: tshig kha cig don la skyes pa yod kyang de'i bye brag rtogs dka' bas na rtog pa dang ldan pa dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhe'o //
translated: Some words, although they are born from the meaning, are difficult to understand because of their particularities, and so those who are rational will not grasp them. Therefore, the words are a cause for the engagement of those who are rational.

original: de la kha cig na re rtog pa dang ldan pa nges pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re rtog pa dang ldan pa nges pa ma yin yang /
translated: To this, someone might say, ‚ÄúEven though it is not certain that those who are rational will engage,

original: gnod byed ma mthong bas don la the tshom skye la de las 'jug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnod byed ma mthong bas don la the tshom skye la de las 'jug go zhes zer ro //
translated: still, because one does not see any refutation, doubt arises with regard to the meaning, and from that one engages.‚Äù

original: de la snga ma na re ngag de ma brjod kyang sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod par byed ba ma mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis the tshom du gnas pas ngag dgos pa med la /
analyzed: de la snga ma na re ngag de ma brjod kyang sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod par byed ba ma mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis the tshom du gnas pas ngag dgos pa med la /
translated: To this, the first one might say, ‚ÄúEven though those words are not spoken, because one does not see any proof or refutation, one naturally abides in doubt, and so the words are purposeless.

original: the tshom ni tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir des 'jug pa yang rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid nyams so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: the tshom ni tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir des 'jug pa yang rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid nyams so zhes zer ro //
translated: And because doubt is not suitable as a valid cognition, the engagement by that also loses its being rational.‚Äù

original: the tshom las mi 'jug na ngag dang bo ci dgos she na /
analyzed: the tshom las mi 'jug na ngag dang bo ci dgos she na /
translated: If one does not engage because of doubt, what is the point of the first statement?

original: gzhan dag khyod kyis rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag khyod kyis rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam bar mi bya ste /
translated: Others say that you should not compose this treatise,üîΩbecause it has no purpose.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'gog ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub bar bstan pa'i don du'o zhe'o //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'gog ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub bar bstan pa'i don du'o zhe'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that the reason for the refutation is not established.

original: kho bo ni 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni 'di skad smra ste /
translated: We say this:

original: gzhan gyi gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci /
translated: What is the purpose of teaching that the reason of others is not established?

original: dgos pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it has a purpose,

original: ngag dang bo dgos pa yod bar nges pas rtog pa dang ldan par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag dang bo dgos pa yod bar nges pas rtog pa dang ldan par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the first statement, which is certain to have a purpose, would be engaged in by the intelligent.

original: dgos pa la the tshom skyes pas gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub par byed na ni dag dag gi dgos pa the tshom skyed pa yin no zhes smra ba'i phyogs nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa la the tshom skyes pas gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub par byed na ni dag dag gi dgos pa the tshom skyed pa yin no zhes smra ba'i phyogs nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: If the reason is made uncertain by the arising of doubt about the purpose, then the purpose of the statement is to generate doubt.

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, this should be understood:

original: gang dag bstan bcos mdzad pa la yid ches pa de dag bstan bcos kyis dgos pa la sogs pa la yang dag gi sgo nas yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag bstan bcos mdzad pa la yid ches pa de dag bstan bcos kyis dgos pa la sogs pa la yang dag gi sgo nas yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who have confidence in the author of the treatise will have confidence in the purpose, etc. of the treatise,

original: yid ches pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words of the treatise are trustworthy.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa la yid ches pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa la yid ches pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there confidence in the author of the treatise?

original: bstan bcos gzhan du ji ltar ngag dang bos dam bcas pa ltar /
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan du ji ltar ngag dang bos dam bcas pa ltar /
translated: Just as in other treatises, the words and expressions are as they are stated,

original: gzhung gi don dmigs pas na mi slu bar grub pas /
analyzed: gzhung gi don dmigs pas na mi slu bar grub pas /
translated: and the meaning of the text is established as non-deceptive by observation.

original: 'dir yang de nyid kyi bstan bcos rtsom pa'i skabs kyi ngag yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dir yang de nyid kyi bstan bcos rtsom pa'i skabs kyi ngag yin pas so //
translated: Here, it is the same, because it is the words of the occasion of composing the treatise on that very subject.

original: des na ngag gi bye brag ni don dang 'brel bar skabs la sogs pas gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na ngag gi bye brag ni don dang 'brel bar skabs la sogs pas gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the particular words are to be grasped by context, etc., in connection with the meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na skyes bu'i 'jug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skyes bu'i 'jug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that there would be no engagement of persons.

original: phan pa ni blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa ni blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Benefit is what is to be adopted.

original: @180a * // mi phan pa ni dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: @180a * // mi phan pa ni dor bar bya'o //
translated: Harm is what is to be abandoned.

original: phan pa dang mi phan pa ni phan pa dang mi phan ba dag go //
analyzed: phan pa dang mi phan pa ni phan pa dang mi phan ba dag go //
translated: Benefit and harm are benefit and harm.

original: 'thob pa dang sbong pa ni 'thob pa dang spong bdag ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang sbong pa ni 'thob pa dang spong bdag ste /
translated: Obtaining and abandoning are the obtainment and abandonment of the three times.üîΩ

original: phan ba la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phan ba la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Attainment and relinquishment are the attainment and relinquishment of the benefit, etc.üîΩThey are in the order in which they are mentioned.

original: de la phan pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas gnyis so //
analyzed: de la phan pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas gnyis so //
translated: The benefit is twofold, mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten pa yang tshe 'di ba tsan dan dang / me tog phreng ba la sogs pa'i don dang / tshe gzhan pa bde 'gro dang / longs spyod la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang tshe 'di ba tsan dan dang / me tog phreng ba la sogs pa'i don dang / tshe gzhan pa bde 'gro dang / longs spyod la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The mundane is the benefit of this life, such as health, flowers, garlands, etc., and the benefit of other lives, such as heaven, wealth, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang thar pa tsam dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyi bye brag gis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang thar pa tsam dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyi bye brag gis te /
translated: The supramundane is the benefit of mere liberation, the benefit of the bodhisattva stage, and the benefit of buddhahood.

original: de ltar na rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: Thus there are five kinds of benefit.

original: yang de dag gi rgyu lnga ste bcu'o //
analyzed: yang de dag gi rgyu lnga ste bcu'o //
translated: There are five causes of these benefits, making ten.

original: dor bar bya ba yang bcu ste /
analyzed: dor bar bya ba yang bcu ste /
translated: There are ten things to be relinquished,

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: because of the distinction between mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i tshe 'di nyid dug dang sbrul la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i tshe 'di nyid dug dang sbrul la sogs ba'o //
translated: The mundane is the relinquishment of poison, snakes, etc., in this very life.

original: tshe gzhan pa ni ngan 'gro la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: tshe gzhan pa ni ngan 'gro la sogs ba'o //
translated: The other life is the unfortunate planes of existence, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dor bar bya ba ni ;
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dor bar bya ba ni ;
translated: The supramundane things to be rejected are:üîΩsamsara, which is the opposite of liberation; the disciples, etc., which are the opposite of the bodhisattva;

original: thar ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'khor ba nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi nyan thos la sogs pa dang / srid ba dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: thar ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'khor ba nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi nyan thos la sogs pa dang / srid ba dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyis ni /
translated: existence, which is the opposite of Buddhahood;

original: sangs rgyas nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: and non-Buddhahood, which is the opposite of Buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du de'i rgyud la ste bcu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rgyud la ste bcu'o //
translated: In the same way, there are ten things to be attained in the continuum of the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar rnam pa nyi shu ni phan pa dang mi phan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa nyi shu ni phan pa dang mi phan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the twenty kinds of things are called beneficial and non-beneficial.

original: de dag thob pa dang spong ba dag ni nges par yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de dag thob pa dang spong ba dag ni nges par yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The attainment and rejection of these are preceded by right knowledge.

original: log pa'i shes ba las ni don dang phrad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: log pa'i shes ba las ni don dang phrad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is no attainment of the object whatsoever from wrong knowledge.

original: bstan pa dang phrad na yang dag ba'i shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa dang phrad na yang dag ba'i shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when one encounters the teaching, it is right knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is this right knowledge?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes grangs nges par gzung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes grangs nges par gzung bar mdzad do //
translated: Right knowledge is of two kinds.

original: 'di'i rgyun ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyun ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The continuity of this will be shown later.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?üîΩDirect perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang rjes dpag ces gsungs te zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa gnyis nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes dpag ces gsungs te zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa gnyis nyid yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is that there are just two kinds of knowledge, as stated,

original: sgra dang don gyi go ba la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra dang don gyi go ba la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and not any other, such as knowledge by verbal testimony, knowledge by analogy, and so on.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag go //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag go //
translated: Direct perception and inference are direct perception and inference.

original: de la dbang po la brten pa'i phyir mngon sum ste sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang po la brten pa'i phyir mngon sum ste sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Direct perception is so called because it is based on the sense faculties.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don mngon sum du byed ba ste /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don mngon sum du byed ba ste /
translated: The reason for the use of the term is that it makes the object directly perceived.

original: don rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it appears in the aspect of the object's own characteristic.

original: rjes @180b su mthun pa'i tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: rjes @180b su mthun pa'i tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference is so called because it is a valid means of knowledge that conforms to its object.

original: 'dir 'jal bar byad pas tshad ma ste mngon sum mo //
analyzed: 'dir 'jal bar byad pas tshad ma ste mngon sum mo //
translated: Here, it is a valid means of knowledge because it measures, that is, it is direct perception.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'jal bar byed ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i tshad ma ste rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'jal bar byed ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i tshad ma ste rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The corresponding valid cognition is called inference.

original: rjes su mthun pa yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the corresponding object?

original: don dang 'brel ba'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: don dang 'brel ba'o zhes ston to //
translated: It is the object that is related to the corresponding cognition.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: These two are direct perception and inference.

original: mi slu'o zhes bya ba ni slu ba med do zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i phyir mi slu ba can yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pas shes pa'i gsal ba gnyig gang yod pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: mi slu'o zhes bya ba ni slu ba med do zhes bya ba'o // de'i phyir mi slu ba can yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pas shes pa'i gsal ba gnyig gang yod pa nyid du ston to //
translated: They are non-deceptive.üîΩThus, the definition of valid cognition is given in general terms as ‚Äúnon-deceptive cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i shes pa spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i shes pa spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, the definition of valid cognition is given in general terms as ‚Äúnon-deceptive cognition.‚Äù

original: gang zhig tshad ma yin pa de ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa 'dir 'dus te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa grags pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tshad ma yin pa de ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa 'dir 'dus te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa grags pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever is a valid cognition is included in either direct perception or inference, like the well-known direct perception and inference.

original: gzhan dag gis 'dod pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'dod pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is intrinsic, because the assertions of others are valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma nyid tsam dang 'brel pa ni 'dir 'dus pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid tsam dang 'brel pa ni 'dir 'dus pa nyid do //
translated: The mere connection with valid cognition is included here.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma rnam gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma rnam gnyis kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, there are only two types of valid cognition.

original: don dang 'brel par 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dang 'brel par 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are similar in being connected to objects.

original: don las dngos su skyes pa mngon sum don dang 'brel ba ltar mngon sum min pa rjes su dpag pa yang don dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis don rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don las dngos su skyes pa mngon sum don dang 'brel ba ltar mngon sum min pa rjes su dpag pa yang don dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis don rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as direct perception is connected to an object because it is directly produced from an object, so too non-direct perception, inference, fully comprehends an object through a reason that is the nature of the object.

original: tshad ma nyid la 'dir 'dus pas khyab pa sgrub pa'i phyir don ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid la 'dir 'dus pas khyab pa sgrub pa'i phyir don ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the inclusion of valid cognition is established here, it is said that there are only two types of objects.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba dag phan tshun spangs te gnas ba nyid kyi phyir phung po gsum pa med do //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba dag phan tshun spangs te gnas ba nyid kyi phyir phung po gsum pa med do //
translated: Because direct perception and non-direct perception are mutually exclusive, there is no third category.

original: gal te gnas gsum pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa don gsum pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas gsum pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa don gsum pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a third possibility, namely, that which is extremely obscure?

original: de ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: That is not a direct perception.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya zhes bshad pas don gnyis ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya zhes bshad pas don gnyis ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a second possibility, namely, that which is to be known?

original: de ltar ni tshad ma yang gcig nyid du 'dod pa yin te mi slu pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni tshad ma yang gcig nyid du 'dod pa yin te mi slu pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In that case, a valid cognition would be only one, because it is called non-deceptive.

original: de ltar na mngon sum pa shes pa'i tshad ma yin na ni mngon sum nyid du 'dus la /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum pa shes pa'i tshad ma yin na ni mngon sum nyid du 'dus la /
translated: If it is a valid cognition that is a direct perception, it is included in direct perception.

original: lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa'i tshad ma nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'dus te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa'i tshad ma nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'dus te /
translated: If it is a valid cognition that is an inference, it is included in inference.

original: de la mngon sum pa la ni mngon sum las gzhan pa rjes su dpag pa dang / de ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang 'khrul ba'i shes pa dag las gang gis kyang mi rtogs te /
analyzed: de la mngon sum pa la ni mngon sum las gzhan pa rjes su dpag pa dang / de ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang 'khrul ba'i shes pa dag las gang gis kyang mi rtogs te /
translated: In that case, that which is a direct perception is not known by anything other than direct perception, such as inference, or by any other conceptual or mistaken consciousness.

original: @181a * // rtog pa dang 'khrul pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @181a * // rtog pa dang 'khrul pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because conceptual and mistaken consciousnesses do not apprehend intrinsic characteristics.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa yang rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa mngon sum dang / rtags ma yin pa las byung ba'i rtog pa dang 'khrul pa'i shes pa dag gis mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa yang rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa mngon sum dang / rtags ma yin pa las byung ba'i rtog pa dang 'khrul pa'i shes pa dag gis mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, that which is not direct perception is not understood by any other than inference, and by conceptual cognitions and erroneous cognitions that arise from non-evidence.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid la 'di dag tu 'dus pas khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid la 'di dag tu 'dus pas khyab pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since all valid cognitions are included in these, they are necessarily just these.

original: de nyid 'di ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in the following way.

original: gzhal bar bya ba gnyis nyid yin pa ni rgyu gnyis nyid du ston la /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba gnyis nyid yin pa ni rgyu gnyis nyid du ston la /
translated: The two objects of comprehension are shown to be the two causes.

original: de gnyis kyang rang la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag so sor nges te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang rang la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag so sor nges te /
translated: And those two are ascertained individually as the specific effects of the consciousness that observes them.

original: gcig ni mngon sum kho na skyed la /
analyzed: gcig ni mngon sum kho na skyed la /
translated: One is produced only by direct perception.

original: gzhan ni rjes su dpag pa kho na skyed pas so //
analyzed: gzhan ni rjes su dpag pa kho na skyed pas so //
translated: The other is produced only by inference.

original: de ltar na gang 'bras bu'i bye brag re re bskyed par nges pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa gnyis nyid yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i bye brag gnyis skyed par rung ba nyid yin te zhes bya bar rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis tshad ma gnyis nyid du sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na gang 'bras bu'i bye brag re re bskyed par nges pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa gnyis nyid yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i bye brag gnyis skyed par rung ba nyid yin te zhes bya bar rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis tshad ma gnyis nyid du sgrub pa'am /
translated: Thus, the collection of causes that is ascertained to generate each particular effect is suitable to generate two particular effects.

original: yang na gang 'bras bu'i bye brag re re so sor nges pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa gnyis nyid dang ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: yang na gang 'bras bu'i bye brag re re so sor nges pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa gnyis nyid dang ldan pa de ni /
translated: Or, that which possesses the collection of causes that is ascertained to generate each particular effect individually

original: 'bras bu bdag nyid kyang gnyis nyid yin no zhes rang bzhin gyi rtags gzhan 'phangs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu bdag nyid kyang gnyis nyid yin no zhes rang bzhin gyi rtags gzhan 'phangs so //
translated: also has two particular effects.

original: sbyor ba snga ma'i khyad par dang / phyi ma gnyis kyi rtags ma grub pa spangs pa'i phyir de dag las gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sbyor ba snga ma'i khyad par dang / phyi ma gnyis kyi rtags ma grub pa spangs pa'i phyir de dag las gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to avoid the fault that the reason is not established in the former syllogism and the latter two, he says, ‚Äúamong those . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni don gang la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni don gang la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAmong those‚Äù refers to the object.

original: rjes su byed pa ni shes pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su byed pa ni shes pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCorresponding‚Äù refers to the appearance of consciousness.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù refers to what is not direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gang gis kyang rtogs par mi rigs pa can nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gang gis kyang rtogs par mi rigs pa can nyid do //
translated: It is not reasonable to understand it by any means other than inference.

original: rtags dang rtags 'brel ba'i don rtags la brten nas rtogs pa ni spyi'i rnam pas rtogs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas ni mi rtogs te /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags 'brel ba'i don rtags la brten nas rtogs pa ni spyi'i rnam pas rtogs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas ni mi rtogs te /
translated: The object that is related to the reason is understood by means of the universal, not by means of the particular,

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i stobs kyis yin pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i stobs kyis yin pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is by the power of concomitance and because the particular does not appear.

original: rtags ni 'brel pa'i stobs kyis go bar byed par bstan pa dang / gzhan dag de las brtsams nas gal te 'brel pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rtags ni 'brel pa'i stobs kyis go bar byed par bstan pa dang / gzhan dag de las brtsams nas gal te 'brel pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The reason is taught to be understood by the power of relation, and others begin with that, saying, ‚ÄúIf it is only relation,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'brel pa yang yin la gzung bar bya ba'i chos can ni shes par 'dod pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang yin la gzung bar bya ba'i chos can ni shes par 'dod pa'i chos can te /
translated: The relation is the object to be apprehended, and the subject that is desired to be known is the subject.

original: de la mthong ba ni chos can yod pa nyid de phyogs kyi chos kyang ngo //
analyzed: de la mthong ba ni chos can yod pa nyid de phyogs kyi chos kyang ngo //
translated: The existence of that subject is seeing, and it is also the property of the subject.

original: phyogs kyi chos de sgra la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos de sgra la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That property of the subject does not exist in sound.

original: rig byed kyi sgra ni gang la yang mi brten la nam mkha'i yon tan gyi @181b sgra yang brjod par bya ba'i chos can la mi brten par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rig byed kyi sgra ni gang la yang mi brten la nam mkha'i yon tan gyi @181b sgra yang brjod par bya ba'i chos can la mi brten par 'dod pas so //
translated: The sound of the Vedas does not depend on anything at all, and the sound of the quality of space is also asserted not to depend on the subject that is the object of expression.

original: 'on kyang de don rtogs par ni byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de don rtogs par ni byed do //
translated: However, it does cause the understanding of the meaning.

original: des na tshad ma gzhan nyid do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gzhan nyid do snyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is another valid cognition.

original: lan sbyin pa ni de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan sbyin pa ni de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzung bar bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can la med na'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzung bar bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can la med na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means if it does not exist in the subject that possesses the quality that is the object of apprehension.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the sound.

original: de la zhes bya ba gzung bar 'dod pa ni chos can la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba gzung bar 'dod pa ni chos can la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the subject that is desired to be apprehended.

original: ma mthong na ma mthong ba des chos can de la ji ltar 'dod ba sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ma mthong na ma mthong ba des chos can de la ji ltar 'dod ba sgrub pa'am /
translated: If it is not seen, how could that non-seeing establish what is desired in that subject,

original: de dang 'gal ba 'gog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba 'gog par 'gyur /
translated: or negate what is contrary to that?

original: gal te sngar mthong ba la sgra yis dran par byed na'o //
analyzed: gal te sngar mthong ba la sgra yis dran par byed na'o //
translated: If it reminds one of what was previously seen by means of sound.

original: lan ni sgra dang rtags dag med par yid kyi nye bar gtod pas kyang dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni sgra dang rtags dag med par yid kyi nye bar gtod pas kyang dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúBecause of the mental orientation, there is recollection even without words and signs.‚Äù

original: gal te sgras dran pa dang nye bar gtod pas dran pa dag la khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgras dran pa dang nye bar gtod pas dran pa dag la khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: If there is a difference between recollection by means of words and recollection by means of mental orientation,

original: 'di dag gi gnas skabs dag la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi gnas skabs dag la zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says: ‚Äúin their states.‚Äù

original: bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: there is no difference.

original: gzung bar 'dod pa'i chos can la ma grub pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung bar 'dod pa'i chos can la ma grub pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the subject that is to be apprehended is not established,

original: sgra 'dis chos can 'ga' zhig la yang ngo //
analyzed: sgra 'dis chos can 'ga' zhig la yang ngo //
translated: this word does not refer to any subject.

original: ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ste tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ste tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni sgra dag las so //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni sgra dag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom them‚Äù means from the words.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la sgra de dang don de dag 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la sgra de dang don de dag 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because the connection between the word and the object is not established.

original: 'di nyid 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'og nas ston to //
translated: This is shown below.

original: brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pa gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pa gang gi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the connection with what is to be expressed.

original: de lta na ni 'bras bu'i rtags nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'bras bu'i rtags nyid yin no //
translated: In that case, it is a logical mark of effect.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci ran ta la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci ran ta la sogs pa ste /
translated: If you say that it is like the case of the inference of fire from smoke, etc.,

original: de yod na yod pa zhes bya ba dang / rigs pa dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan yod pas gnyis nyid la gnod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa zhes bya ba dang / rigs pa dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan yod pas gnyis nyid la gnod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: then, since there is another valid cognition, namely, the existence of the effect when the cause exists, and the existence of the cause when the effect exists, and the existence of the cause when the effect exists, and the non-apprehension of the imperceptible, you are contradicting your own position that there are only two means of valid cognition.

original: de yod na yod pas ni skyed par sgrub par byed la mi dmigs pas ni med pa'o //
analyzed: de yod na yod pas ni skyed par sgrub par byed la mi dmigs pas ni med pa'o //
translated: The existence of the effect when the cause exists proves the production of the effect, and the non-apprehension of the imperceptible proves its non-existence.

original: de dag mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: But these are not direct perception,

original: gzhan gyis gzhan rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one thing is not cognized by another.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they inference,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the forward and reverse pervasions.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To explain that they do not have the forward and reverse pervasions, he says,

original: 'di la dpe yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di la dpe yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no example.‚Äù

original: dpe med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa de yod na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba las khyad par du gyur pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa de yod na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba las khyad par du gyur pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is without example, he says, ‚Äúbecause it exists when that exists‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause there is no other proof different from non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: de dpe gzhan gyis sgrub par byed na yang de la snga ma 'dra ba'i phyir dpe gzhan @182a * //
analyzed: de dpe gzhan gyis sgrub par byed na yang de la snga ma 'dra ba'i phyir dpe gzhan @182a * //
translated: If it were to prove that by another example, then since it would be similar to the former, another example would be necessary.

original: dgos par 'gyur bas na dpe thugs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
analyzed: dgos par 'gyur bas na dpe thugs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that there would be an infinite regress of examples.

original: ma yin te zhes gsungs te /üîΩdpe thugs pa med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes gsungs te / dpe thugs pa med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNo.‚ÄùüîΩThere is no infinite regress of examples,

original: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not non-inference.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩde yod na yod pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i yul mthong ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / de yod na yod pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i yul mthong ba na /
translated: How is that?üîΩWhen the object of non-apprehension is seen,

original: yul can bskyed pa dang med pa'i tha snyad dag kyang sngon de na yod na yod pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las /
analyzed: yul can bskyed pa dang med pa'i tha snyad dag kyang sngon de na yod na yod pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las /
translated: then the production of the subject and the convention of non-existence are also from the existence of that and non-apprehension.

original: bskyed pa dang med pa'i tha snyad zhugs pa'i rtags dang rtags can 'brel pa dran pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang med pa'i tha snyad zhugs pa'i rtags dang rtags can 'brel pa dran pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sign and the counter-correlate, which are engaged by the conventions of production and non-existence, are recalled in connection.

original: dpe mngon sum gyis grub pa yod do //
analyzed: dpe mngon sum gyis grub pa yod do //
translated: The example is established by direct perception.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni yod na yod pa yin la ;
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni yod na yod pa yin la ;
translated: The pervasion and counter-pervasion are: if it exists, it exists;üîΩand if it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gi ngo bo ni med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gi ngo bo ni med do //
translated: The nature of those causes and effects other than that does not exist.

original: de yang mngon sum gyis sngon grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyis sngon grub pa nyid do //
translated: That is also established by direct perception.

original: dmigs par rigs pa de ltar ma dmigs na de med do zhes 'jig rten 'di mngon sum gyi stobs kyis smra'o //
analyzed: dmigs par rigs pa de ltar ma dmigs na de med do zhes 'jig rten 'di mngon sum gyi stobs kyis smra'o //
translated: When the object to be observed is not observed, the world speaks of its non-existence by the power of direct perception.

original: de ltar med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the reason for the convention of non-existence is taught to be non-observation.

original: yod na snod du rung ba las mi dmigs pa'i phyir med de /
analyzed: yod na snod du rung ba las mi dmigs pa'i phyir med de /
translated: If it exists, it is not observed because it is suitable to be observed.üîΩIt is like not observing what is suitable to be observed in a previous dwelling place.

original: sngon gnas khang na dmigs par rigs pa las ma dmigs pa bzhin no zhes grangs can la sogs pa rmongs pa dag las /
analyzed: sngon gnas khang na dmigs par rigs pa las ma dmigs pa bzhin no zhes grangs can la sogs pa rmongs pa dag las /
translated: Thus, the deluded SƒÅ·πÉkhya and others say,

original: dmigs par rigs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyus med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid ston te /
analyzed: dmigs par rigs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyus med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid ston te /
translated: The reason why it is proper to designate the non-apprehension of the object as non-existence is shown.

original: med pa grub kyang tha snyad du rung ba nyid ma grub pa la tha snyad du rung bar byed pa /
analyzed: med pa grub kyang tha snyad du rung ba nyid ma grub pa la tha snyad du rung bar byed pa /
translated: Even though non-existence is established, the propriety of the conventional is not established.

original: dper na skyed par byed par khas len pas pha nyid grub kyang pa'i tha snyad du ma grub pa la skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na skyed par byed par khas len pas pha nyid grub kyang pa'i tha snyad du ma grub pa la skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, even though the father is established as the producer, the conventional ‚Äúfather‚Äù is not established.

original: pha yin no zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pha yin no zhes bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is taught: ‚ÄúHe is the father because he is the producer.‚Äù

original: de ltar shin du rmongs pa ma yin na dmigs par rigs pa ma dmigs pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis med pa'i tha snyad kyang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar shin du rmongs pa ma yin na dmigs par rigs pa ma dmigs pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis med pa'i tha snyad kyang grub pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, if one is not very confused, the conventional ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is established by the direct perception of the non-apprehension of the object that is proper to apprehend.

original: de nyid kyi phyir med bar nges kyang med pa'i tha snyad las bzlog pa can gyi rmongs pa la ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir med bar nges kyang med pa'i tha snyad las bzlog pa can gyi rmongs pa la ste /
translated: Therefore, even though non-existence is ascertained, the confusion that is the opposite of the conventional ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is taught.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rtsa mchog rtse na glang chen brgya //
analyzed: rtsa mchog rtse na glang chen brgya //
translated: ‚ÄúOn the peak of Mount Meru, there are one hundred elephants,

original: sngon chad ma mthong yod do zhes //
analyzed: sngon chad ma mthong yod do zhes //
translated: which have not been seen before, and they exist.‚Äù

original: de skad grangs can phyugs las gzhan //
analyzed: de skad grangs can phyugs las gzhan //
translated: Except for the CƒÅrvƒÅka,

original: ngo tsha bcas pa su brjod rtsol //
analyzed: ngo tsha bcas pa su brjod rtsol //
translated: and shame.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de ni shin tu rmongs don te //üîΩgang rdzi mo bar grags phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de ni shin tu rmongs don te // gang rdzi mo bar grags phyir ro //
translated: And, ‚ÄúThat is the meaning of ‚Äòvery confused,‚Äô

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: because of being known as a cowherd.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du de yod na yod pa dang / rmongs pa la tha snyad bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de yod na yod pa dang / rmongs pa la tha snyad bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Thus, when it exists, it exists; and the convention of confusion is established.

original: bskyed pa nyid dang med pa nyid sgrub na ni dpe thug pa med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bskyed pa nyid dang med pa nyid sgrub na ni dpe thug pa med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if production itself and nonexistence are established, then the example would be endless.

original: tha snyad @182b bsgrub pa la ni skyon med de tha snyad zhugs pa la ni dpe yin la rmongs pas tha snyad ma grub pa la ni rgyu ston pas so //
analyzed: tha snyad @182b bsgrub pa la ni skyon med de tha snyad zhugs pa la ni dpe yin la rmongs pas tha snyad ma grub pa la ni rgyu ston pas so //
translated: But there is no fault in establishing a convention, because the example is for one who engages in convention, but for one who does not establish a convention due to confusion, the cause is taught.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni bstan nas /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the nonobservation of appearance,

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa yang rtags nyid du bsdu ba'i phyir rgyu med pas yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa yang rtags nyid du bsdu ba'i phyir rgyu med pas yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to include the nonobservation of nonappearance as a logical reason, he says, ‚ÄúThe negation of the convention of existence due to the absence of a cause,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu mtshan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa la pha'i tha snyad mi bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa la pha'i tha snyad mi bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as one does not use the convention ‚Äúfather‚Äù for a nonproducer of a reason.

original: de ltar de yod na yod pa dang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags nyid yin pa de'i phyir don rang gi rnam pa snang bar grub pa ma yin pa thams cad ni grub par byed pa don rang nyid las gzhan pa mi 'khrul pa ni
analyzed: de ltar de yod na yod pa dang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags nyid yin pa de'i phyir don rang gi rnam pa snang bar grub pa ma yin pa thams cad ni grub par byed pa don rang nyid las gzhan pa mi 'khrul pa ni
translated: Thus, if it exists, it exists as the nature of non-apprehension and as the sign of effect. Therefore, all that is not established as the appearance of the aspect of the object is established by the object itself, not by another non-erroneous means of knowledge.

original: mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'o //
translated: It is non-deceptive.

original: de'i rgyu ni don dang 'brel pa ste don rang la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni don dang 'brel pa ste don rang la rag las pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the connection with the object, the dependence on the object itself.

original: de la rang rtogs pa ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rang rtogs pa ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it depends on the realization of itself,

original: ma 'brel pa las ni mi rtogs pas 'brel ba las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa las ni mi rtogs pas 'brel ba las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: it is not realized from what is not connected. Therefore, realization from what is connected is inference itself.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a means of knowledge that is not perception does not exist apart from inference.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin na 'di dag tu 'dus pas khyab cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin na 'di dag tu 'dus pas khyab cing /
translated: Therefore, since they are pervaded by being included in these,

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa gnyis nyid dang de gnyis kyang tshad ma re re kho na skyed par byed pas sbyor ba gnyis pa'i rtags kyang grub po zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa gnyis nyid dang de gnyis kyang tshad ma re re kho na skyed par byed pas sbyor ba gnyis pa'i rtags kyang grub po zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Since direct perception and non-perception each generate a single valid cognition, the reason of the second syllogism is also established.

original: yang rgyang 'phen pa gzhan ni mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang rgyang 'phen pa gzhan ni mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Again, another LokƒÅyata says: Apart from direct perception, there is no other valid cognition.

original: mngon sum gcig pu tshad ma zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gcig pu tshad ma zhes zer ro //
translated: Direct perception alone is valid cognition.

original: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is unreasonable.

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes zer ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes zer ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas so //
translated: Saying that inference is not a valid cognition contradicts one's own words.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said because of that and so on.

original: rgyang 'phen pa de rang nyid rtags gsum nyid khas len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyang 'phen pa de rang nyid rtags gsum nyid khas len pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that LokƒÅyata himself accepts the three reasons.

original: tshad ma dang ni cig shos spyi'i //
analyzed: tshad ma dang ni cig shos spyi'i //
translated: Valid cognition and the other are general

original: rnam gzhag phyir zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi rtags so //
analyzed: rnam gzhag phyir zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi rtags so //
translated: means the reason of nature.

original: blo gzhan rtogs phyir zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i rtags so //üîΩgang dag gis ni 'gog phyir yang //
analyzed: blo gzhan rtogs phyir zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i rtags so // gang dag gis ni 'gog phyir yang //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to understand other minds‚Äù indicates a reason based on effect.

original: zhes bya bas ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are the cause of cessation‚Äù indicates a reason based on non-apprehension.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgyang 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgyang 'phen pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey‚Äù refers to the CƒÅrvƒÅkas.

original: shes pa'i bye brag rnams las zhes bya bas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: shes pa'i bye brag rnams las zhes bya bas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom among the various types of cognition‚Äù indicates that the following explanation will be given.

original: 'di ni don gang mi slu ba de tshad ma yin la slu ba de tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don gang mi slu ba de tshad ma yin la slu ba de tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: A cognition that is non-deceptive with regard to a particular object is a valid cognition. A cognition that is deceptive is not a valid cognition.

original: des na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la zhugs pa'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i @183a * //üîΩgsal ba ma lus pa'i yul rnams slu ba dang / mi slu ba dag las /
analyzed: des na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la zhugs pa'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i @183a * // gsal ba ma lus pa'i yul rnams slu ba dang / mi slu ba dag las /
translated: Therefore, direct perception and inference that occur in one‚Äôs own mind stream or in the mind streams of others

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa gang rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa gang rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: are classified as valid or invalid in relation to their non-deceptive or deceptive objects, which are all the manifest objects of knowledge.

original: de yang mi slu ba can gyi mngon sum gyi shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyi tshad mar rab tu grags pa dag mi slu ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi dper gang rgyang 'phen pa dag la ston par byed de /
analyzed: de yang mi slu ba can gyi mngon sum gyi shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyi tshad mar rab tu grags pa dag mi slu ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi dper gang rgyang 'phen pa dag la ston par byed de /
translated: In this way, the clarity of some nondeceptive direct perceptual consciousnesses, which are well known to be valid direct perception, are shown to the LokƒÅyatas as examples of nondeceptive inferential valid knowledge.

original: des rim pa 'dis rjes su dpag pa tshad mar khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des rim pa 'dis rjes su dpag pa tshad mar khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: By this process, they should accept that inference is valid knowledge.

original: gzhan du na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub po zhes ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan du na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub po zhes ston par mdzad de /
translated: Otherwise, it is taught that it is not established that both direct perception and inference are valid knowledge or that they are not valid knowledge.

original: shes pa'i bye brag rnams las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i bye brag rnams las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Among the different types of consciousness‚Äù

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la zhugs pa'o //
translated: refers to those that occur in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mindstreams.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú They are pervaded by their definitions‚Äù

original: gang slu ba de tshad ma ma yin la mi slu ba de tshad ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gang slu ba de tshad ma ma yin la mi slu ba de tshad ma yin no zhes so //
translated: means that whatever is deceptive is not valid knowledge and whatever is nondeceptive is valid knowledge.

original: ji ltar ma smras pa na rang gi slob ma la bstan pa'i thabs gzhan med do //
analyzed: ji ltar ma smras pa na rang gi slob ma la bstan pa'i thabs gzhan med do //
translated: If you do not speak, there is no other way to teach your disciples.

original: de ltar ston na ni mngon sum gyi shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig tshad mar rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ston na ni mngon sum gyi shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig tshad mar rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: If you do teach, then some manifestation of a cognition is well known to be a valid cognition.

original: yang na shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: yang na shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Or, some manifestation of a cognition is well known.

original: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang mthun pa ni shes pa'i gsal ba 'di yang mi slu ba'am slu ba'i phyir tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang mthun pa ni shes pa'i gsal ba 'di yang mi slu ba'am slu ba'i phyir tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin no zhes so //
translated: That which is nondeceptive or deceptive in accordance with what is seen is a valid cognition or not a valid cognition, respectively.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid du gnas na rjes su dpog pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid du gnas na rjes su dpog pa yang yod do //
translated: If something is a proper object of inference, then there is inference.

original: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyang phan pa khyed la rjes su dpag pa khas mi len pas ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyang phan pa khyed la rjes su dpag pa khas mi len pas ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But that is not established for you, the CƒÅrvƒÅka, because you do not accept inference. That is the meaning of ‚Äúnot established.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni spyi rnam par gzhag nas khyab pa mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni spyi rnam par gzhag nas khyab pa mi smra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that having posited a universal, you do not state a pervasion.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: In that case, inference would not be a valid cognition.

original: rang gi 'dod pa la ni gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa la ni gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: But that contradicts your own belief.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yul nyams su myong ba las te rgyu'o //
analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba las te rgyu'o //
translated: From the experience of the object, i.e., from the cause.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni rang ngam gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i shes pa'i gsal bya'i bye brag gcig cig go //
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni rang ngam gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i shes pa'i gsal bya'i bye brag gcig cig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-manifest‚Äù is a particular instance of the manifestation of consciousness, whether in one‚Äôs own or another‚Äôs continuum.

original: de lta bu re re ste rjes su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bu re re ste rjes su 'gro ba'am /
translated: Each such instance is either concomitant or not concomitant.

original: ldog pa'i khyab pa bstan pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i khyab pa bstan pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is devoid of the teaching of pervasion.

original: de lta bu'i shes pa yang yin la bye brag kyang yin pas shes pa'i bye brag go //üîΩrnams las te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes pa yang yin la bye brag kyang yin pas shes pa'i bye brag go // rnams las te /
translated: It is a particular instance of consciousness because it is such a consciousness and it is a particular instance.

original: de lta bur rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: de lta bur rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba'i rgyu las so //
translated: From among those, i.e., from a cause that is not concomitant with such an instance.

original: bdag dang slob mar rang gi rgyud la @183b yod pa de rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par mtshon par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag dang slob mar rang gi rgyud la @183b yod pa de rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par mtshon par mi nus so //
translated: Because it is not concomitant with that, it cannot be characterized as valid or invalid cognition.

original: de'i phyir / bstan bcos la 'bad par mi bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bstan bcos la 'bad par mi bya ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore, one should not strive for treatises.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa de ni bstan bcos kyi sgra'i rtags las gzhan la bstan par bya ba'i don yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa de ni bstan bcos kyi sgra'i rtags las gzhan la bstan par bya ba'i don yin na /
translated: Thus, if the object of the definition of valid inference, etc., were to be taught to others by the treatises, then the consciousness in one‚Äôs own continuum that experiences that object would be the reason for the words of the treatises.

original: rtags kyi mtshan nyid khyab pa khas len pa med pas rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags kyi mtshan nyid khyab pa khas len pa med pas rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since the opponent does not accept the definition of the reason, there would be no inference, and so the treatises would be pointless.

original: gal te de ltar go bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos la 'bad par byed na'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar go bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos la 'bad par byed na'o //
translated: If one were to strive to compose treatises in order to make others understand in that way,

original: co 'dri ba 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba ste /üîΩrjes su dpag pa yang spong la /
analyzed: co 'dri ba 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba ste / rjes su dpag pa yang spong la /
translated: this would be self-contradictory.üîΩBecause it would reject inference

original: rang nyid rjes su dpag pa sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rjes su dpag pa sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it would itself employ inference.

original: de nyid pha rol gyis zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid pha rol gyis zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: This is indicated by ‚Äúthe opponent says.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'i rtags khas blangs pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'i rtags khas blangs pa bshad do //
translated: This explains the acceptance of the reason of effect.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas bsam pa'i don ston pa ma yin gyi lus nyid blo yin pas blo mngon sum gyis rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas bsam pa'i don ston pa ma yin gyi lus nyid blo yin pas blo mngon sum gyis rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the thought is not shown by inference, but that the body itself is the mind, and that the mind is realized by direct perception,

original: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the body itself is not the mind, etc.

original: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
analyzed: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
translated: The body itself is not the mind.

original: yin na lus rtogs pa ltar blo yang rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: yin na lus rtogs pa ltar blo yang rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were, then just as the body is realized, so the mind would be realized.

original: de la the tshom za ba'i phyir rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de la the tshom za ba'i phyir rtogs pa med do //
translated: But since there is doubt about that, it is not realized.

original: gal te sgra skad cig ma yin la de rtogs pa ltar 'di yang de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgra skad cig ma yin la de rtogs pa ltar 'di yang de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that sound is momentary, and that just as it is realized, so this is,

original: 'o na ni mngon sum du grub pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: 'o na ni mngon sum du grub pa nyid nyams so //
translated: then direct perception itself is undermined.

original: gzhan yang blo 'dis lus kho na yin na lus nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu med de lus nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo 'dis lus kho na yin na lus nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu med de lus nyid bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, if this mind is the body itself, then there is no cause for error, because it is the body itself.

original: de ltar na blo yang rtogs par 'gyur na de ni med do zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na blo yang rtogs par 'gyur na de ni med do zhes dgongs so //
translated: Thus, the mind would be realized, but it does not exist.

original: de lta bas na snang ba de ni de nyid yin pa la de grub na grub pas khyab pa /
