analyzed: de lta bas na snang ba de ni de nyid yin pa la de grub na grub pas khyab pa /
translated: Therefore, that appearance is that reality, and if it is established, it is necessarily established.

original: de la mi dmigs pa 'phangs te /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa 'phangs te /
translated: The non-apprehension of that is implied.

original: gang zhig grub kyang gang grub pa med pa de ni de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig grub kyang gang grub pa med pa de ni de nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is established but which does not establish anything is not that,

original: sngon po dang ser po lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po lta bu'o //
translated: like blue and yellow.

original: blo yang lus grub kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo yang lus grub kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the cognition is established in the body but does not establish it.

original: blo de skyes bu gzhan dang 'brel pa ni skyes bu mngon sum du grub pa tsam gyis gzhan gyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: blo de skyes bu gzhan dang 'brel pa ni skyes bu mngon sum du grub pa tsam gyis gzhan gyis mi rtogs so //
translated: The cognition related to another person is not understood by another merely through the direct perception of the person.

original: da ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags khas blangs pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags khas blangs pa ston te /
translated: Now, the acceptance of the reason of non-apprehension is shown.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rgyang ba na pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rgyang ba na pa'o //
translated: The word this refers to the distant.

original: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' 'byung ba lnga pa nyid la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' 'byung ba lnga pa nyid la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The word someone refers to the five elements of space and so on.

original: bsgribs pa shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: bsgribs pa shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa la yang ngo //
translated: It also refers to the inability to generate the cognition of obstruction.

original: @184a * // 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang ngo //
analyzed: @184a * // 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang ngo //
translated: The word contradictory refers to one's own words.

original: yang na mngon sum 'di log pas med do zhes bya ba gang la zhig ste /
analyzed: yang na mngon sum 'di log pas med do zhes bya ba gang la zhig ste /
translated: Or, when this direct perception is reversed, what is there to say that it does not exist?

original: mngon sum don gyi rgyu'am khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum don gyi rgyu'am khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because direct perception is not the cause or the pervader of the object.

original: de med pas don med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas don med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ascertainment of nonexistence in the absence of that.

original: gal te mngon sum med pas don med par nges pa de yod na ni ste /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum med pas don med par nges pa de yod na ni ste /
translated: If there were ascertainment of nonexistence in the absence of perception,

original: de ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags las gzhan gyis mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags las gzhan gyis mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would not be established by any other means than the evidence of nonapprehension.

original: gzhan yang yod pa ni mi 'khrul par 'dod pa'i don las don gzhan las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa ni mi 'khrul par 'dod pa'i don las don gzhan las skyes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, existence is the arising of an object from another object that is not confused.

original: med par yod pa yang mi 'khrul par 'dod pa'i don med par ro //
analyzed: med par yod pa yang mi 'khrul par 'dod pa'i don med par ro //
translated: Nonexistence is the existence of an object that is not confused with the absence of an object.

original: de ni de la rag ma las pa'i phyir der 'khrul pas na mi slu bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de la rag ma las pa'i phyir der 'khrul pas na mi slu bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not dependent on that, because it is not reasonable that it is nondeceptive due to confusion with that.

original: don mthong ba zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin de yang don la yod pa ste don gyi chos yin pa'o //
analyzed: don mthong ba zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin de yang don la yod pa ste don gyi chos yin pa'o //
translated: That nature called ‚Äúseeing the object‚Äù exists in the object; it is a property of the object.

original: mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir don thams cad skyes bu thams cad kyis mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir don thams cad skyes bu thams cad kyis mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of seeing and because it is direct perception, it follows that all objects would be seen by all persons.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba de gal te shes pa la yod na'o //üîΩdon dang shes pa 'brel bar khyod mi 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba zhes bya ba'i shes pa gzhan yod pas /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba de gal te shes pa la yod na'o // don dang shes pa 'brel bar khyod mi 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba zhes bya ba'i shes pa gzhan yod pas /
translated: If seeing exists in consciousness,üîΩthen it is not tenable that consciousness is related to objects, because you do not assert that consciousness is related to objects.

original: shes pa dang ma 'brel pa'i don gzhan yod par nges pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa dang ma 'brel pa'i don gzhan yod par nges pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could it be tenable to say that consciousness exists as something separate from objects?

original: gal te mthong ba zhes bya ba'i shes pa yod par 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba zhes bya ba'i shes pa yod par 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the existence of consciousness is established by the existence of seeing,

original: don dang shes pa'i 'brel pas shes pa la don mi 'khrul par 'dod na /
analyzed: don dang shes pa'i 'brel pas shes pa la don mi 'khrul par 'dod na /
translated: then if you assert that consciousness is not mistaken with regard to objects because of the relation between objects and consciousness,

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mi 'khrul ba de ni rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i rtags la yang mi 'khrul pa'i rgyur mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mi 'khrul ba de ni rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i rtags la yang mi 'khrul pa'i rgyur mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: then the cause of the relation, the nonmistaken relation, is similar to the cause of nonmistaken inference that is related to the essence.

original: gang de las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang don dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: gang de las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang don dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, inference that arises from that is also related to objects.

original: don dang 'brel pa'i phyir don la mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa'i phyir don la mi slu ba'o //
translated: Because it is related to objects, it is nondeceptive with regard to objects.

original: don la mi slu ba'i tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: don la mi slu ba'i tshad ma yin te /
translated: It is a valid means of knowledge that is nondeceptive with regard to objects.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no zhes sgrub pa'i 'bras bu gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no zhes sgrub pa'i 'bras bu gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the result of the proof is the establishment of the object to be established,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi 'dor ro //
translated: the definition of inferential valid cognition is not rejected.

original: de ltar na rim pa 'dis rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du phur bu ba dag gis khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rim pa 'dis rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du phur bu ba dag gis khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, by this process, the B·πõhatÃ£sƒÅman should accept that inference is valid cognition.

original: bha ti ha ris kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga tshad mar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bha ti ha ris kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga tshad mar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: BƒÅdarƒÅya·πáa also should accept that both perception and inference are valid cognitions.

original: 'di ltar rig byed kyang gang don la mi slu bar byed pa tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed kyang gang don la mi slu bar byed pa tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the Veda is valid cognition because it is nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: slu na ni der mi @184b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slu na ni der mi @184b 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were deceptive, it would not be valid cognition.

original: mi slu ba nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i shes pa dag la yod pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i shes pa dag la yod pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
translated: Nondeceptiveness is valid cognition because it exists in the cognitions explained above.

original: rig byed bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rim pas so //
analyzed: rig byed bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rim pas so //
translated: It is like the Veda.

original: rig byed pa gang dag mngon sum dang sgra gnyis tshad mar smra bas kyang rigs pa de nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig byed pa gang dag mngon sum dang sgra gnyis tshad mar smra bas kyang rigs pa de nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who are Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, who assert that both perception and verbal testimony are valid cognitions, should accept that inference is valid cognition by the same reasoning.

original: gang yang tshad ma cung zad kyang med do zhes smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' ni mi snang mod kyi /
analyzed: gang yang tshad ma cung zad kyang med do zhes smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' ni mi snang mod kyi /
translated: But the philosophical system that advocates there is not even the slightest bit of valid cognition does not appear.

original: 'on kyang de skad rtogs pa yod na des kyang tshad ma cung zad cig khas blang bar bya ste //
analyzed: 'on kyang de skad rtogs pa yod na des kyang tshad ma cung zad cig khas blang bar bya ste //
translated: However, if one understands it in this way, then one should accept that there is some valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, there would be no conventions of engagement and disengagement,

original: tshad ma cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and it would not even be the case that there is not even the slightest bit of valid cognition.

original: de bas na cung zad nges pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed na 'di'i rgyu de ni tshad ma'o zhes bya bar gnas te /
analyzed: de bas na cung zad nges pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed na 'di'i rgyu de ni tshad ma'o zhes bya bar gnas te /
translated: Therefore, if one establishes the convention of ascertaining something to some extent, then the cause of that is called valid cognition,

original: de nyid la tshad ma'i tha snyad grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la tshad ma'i tha snyad grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention of valid cognition is well known in just that sense.

original: de ltar tshad ma spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu byed pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu byed pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the treatise on the general definition of valid cognition in that way,

original: da ni mngon sum gyi rab tu byed pa bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni mngon sum gyi rab tu byed pa bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: now, wishing to explain the treatise on perception,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says there and so on.

original: tshad ma'i dbye ba gnyis bshad pa de la'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbye ba gnyis bshad pa de la'o //
translated: The two kinds of valid cognition are explained.üîΩThe term ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is taught in particular.

original: mngon sum nyid bye brag tu bstan pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid bye brag tu bstan pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de yang gzhan dag mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa snang bas de dag bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan dag mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa snang bas de dag bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, others have mistaken notions about the definition of direct perception, so in order to dispel those,

original: de dag kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: what are they like?

original: drang srong rkang mig pa na re dbang po dang don 'brel ba las skyes pa'i shes pa bstan du med pa mi 'khrul pa zhen pa'i bdag nyid can ni mngon sum zhes zer ro //
analyzed: drang srong rkang mig pa na re dbang po dang don 'brel ba las skyes pa'i shes pa bstan du med pa mi 'khrul pa zhen pa'i bdag nyid can ni mngon sum zhes zer ro //
translated: The sage Ak·π£apƒÅda says: ‚ÄúA cognition that arises from the connection of a sense faculty with an object, is imperceptible, non-erroneous, and has the nature of adherence is direct perception.‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa can gyi zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa can gyi zhugs pa yin te /
translated: This is the position of the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: bye brag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bye brag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas are also similar.

original: grangs can gyi zhugs pa thub pa ser skya ni yul la so sor zhen cing mthong ba ni mngon sum mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grangs can gyi zhugs pa thub pa ser skya ni yul la so sor zhen cing mthong ba ni mngon sum mo zhes zer ro //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya sage Kapila says: ‚ÄúThat which individually adheres to and sees an object is direct perception.‚Äù

original: drang srong chur lhung na re dbang po lnga dang ldan pa gang sems kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar gzhag pas /
analyzed: drang srong chur lhung na re dbang po lnga dang ldan pa gang sems kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar gzhag pas /
translated: The sage PƒÅ·πáini says: ‚ÄúThat which is endowed with the five sense faculties, by the mind places external things nearby,

original: spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las bye brag nges par 'dzin pa /
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las bye brag nges par 'dzin pa /
translated: The ascertainment of a particular from a thing that has a general and particular characteristic

original: sems kyi 'jug pa lnga las mchog gi 'jug pa ni mngon sum yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa lnga las mchog gi 'jug pa ni mngon sum yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: is the supreme engagement of the mind, and that is direct perception.

original: dpyod pa pa na re /
analyzed: dpyod pa pa na re /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say:

original: dang por yod pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: dang por yod pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: First there is the view of existence.

original: shes pa rnam rtog med pa can //
analyzed: shes pa rnam rtog med pa can //
translated: A cognition without conceptuality

original: byis dang lkugs sogs blo 'dra ba //
analyzed: byis dang lkugs sogs blo 'dra ba //
translated: is like the mind of an infant or mute.

original: dag pa'i dngos las skyes pa'o //üîΩde las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang //
analyzed: dag pa'i dngos las skyes pa'o // de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang //
translated: It arises from a pure thing.üîΩOther things

original: rigs kyi chos @185a * //üîΩsogs gang dang gang //
analyzed: rigs kyi chos @185a * // sogs gang dang gang //
translated: are the qualities of a class and so on.

original: blo ni zhen par byed pa de //
analyzed: blo ni zhen par byed pa de //
translated: Whatever the mind is attached to

original: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes zer te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin // zhes zer te /
translated: is asserted to be direct perception.

original: de dag thams cad kyang mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod do //
translated: All of these are asserted to be direct perception with conceptuality.

original: bstan bcos 'di rigs pa rnam par nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di rigs pa rnam par nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since this treatise is a definitive reasoning,

original: de dag rigs pa'i sgo nas bsal bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: de dag rigs pa'i sgo nas bsal bar bzhed nas /
translated: in order to eliminate them through reasoning,

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúDirect perception is free from conceptuality,‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed cing don la mngon sum du byed par grags pa rjes su brjod pa'i ngag ste /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed cing don la mngon sum du byed par grags pa rjes su brjod pa'i ngag ste /
translated: The expression direct perception is a conventional term for a cognition that is in conformity with its object, and that is known to be non-erroneous with regard to the object.

original: des ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi grub par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi grub par bstan to //
translated: This establishes the basis of the characteristic.

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de'i mtshan nyid ma grub pa sgrub pa'i ngag ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de'i mtshan nyid ma grub pa sgrub pa'i ngag ste /
translated: The expression free from conceptual differentiation, etc. establishes the characteristic that was not previously established.

original: de dag sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: These are the means of establishing it.

original: mdo'i go rims ma yin yang brjod pa nyung ba'i phyir ma 'khrul pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: mdo'i go rims ma yin yang brjod pa nyung ba'i phyir ma 'khrul pa sngar bshad do //
translated: Although this is not the order of the sutra, non-error is explained first because it is the most important.

original: 'di thams cad dbang po'i shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas ;
analyzed: 'di thams cad dbang po'i shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas ;
translated: Since all of these are causes of error for the sense consciousnesses,

original: de'i rjes su byed pa ni yid kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa ni yid kyi yang yin no //
translated: the mental consciousness is in conformity with them.

original: rang rig pa'i blo rnams thams cad du rang gi ngo bo la 'khrul ba'i rgyu gang yang med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i blo rnams thams cad du rang gi ngo bo la 'khrul ba'i rgyu gang yang med do //
translated: But the cognitions that are self-reflexive are never erroneous with regard to their own nature.

original: 'on kyang rtog pa ni ma rig pa nyid rab rib pa yin pas de'i dbang gis rang rig pa ma yin yang rang rig bas nga rgyal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa ni ma rig pa nyid rab rib pa yin pas de'i dbang gis rang rig pa ma yin yang rang rig bas nga rgyal ba'i phyir /
translated: But conceptual thought is the very cataract of nescience, and so, although it is not self-awareness by its power, it is self-awareness by the pride of self-awareness.

original: rab rib kyis 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid srid do //
analyzed: rab rib kyis 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid srid do //
translated: Therefore, the cause of error by the cataract is possible.

original: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum ni ma rig pa nyid rab rib yin pas dbang phyug dang skyes bu la sogs par snang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum ni ma rig pa nyid rab rib yin pas dbang phyug dang skyes bu la sogs par snang ngo //
translated: The direct perception of the yogi is the very cataract of nescience, and so it appears as ƒ™≈õvara, puru·π£a, and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i 'khrugs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i 'khrugs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: It is said to be the sound of the disturbance of error, such as attachment.

original: des na rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa srid par rtog par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa srid par rtog par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of the yogi should be understood to be the possibility of error.

original: mngon par rjod par byed pas mngon par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rjod par byed pas mngon par brjod pa ste /
translated: It is verbalization because it verbalizes.

original: don gyi spyi 'dzin pa snang ba sgra'i spyi ste /
analyzed: don gyi spyi 'dzin pa snang ba sgra'i spyi ste /
translated: The apprehension of the universal of the object is the universal of sound that appears.

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon par brjod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon par brjod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The intrinsic identity of sound is not what verbalizes.

original: de dang ldan pa ni der snang ba'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni der snang ba'i rtog pa'o //
translated: That which possesses it is the conceptual thought that appears as that.

original: don de so sor snang ba na snang bar 'gyur ba don la rjod par byed pa'i rang bzhin sgra'i spyi'i sgra ste /
analyzed: don de so sor snang ba na snang bar 'gyur ba don la rjod par byed pa'i rang bzhin sgra'i spyi'i sgra ste /
translated: When that object appears individually, it appears as the sound of the universal of the word that expresses the object.

original: bsten pa'i tshul gyis yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsten pa'i tshul gyis yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is: ‚ÄúIt does not exist by the method of dependence.‚Äù

original: yang bha ra ti ha ri na re /
analyzed: yang bha ra ti ha ri na re /
translated: Bhartrhari says,

original: thog ma tha ma med tshangs pa //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med tshangs pa //
translated: Brahma without beginning or end,

original: sgra yi de nyid gang 'jig med //
analyzed: sgra yi de nyid gang 'jig med //
translated: The reality of sound is not nonexistent.

original: de gyur ba las don rnams so //
analyzed: de gyur ba las don rnams so //
translated: From its transformation, there are objects.

original: 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du spyod ces don rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du 'dod pas na /
analyzed: 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du spyod ces don rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du 'dod pas na /
translated: Since objects are asserted to be the nature of sound in accordance with the world,

original: @185b de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du spong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @185b de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du spong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore, it is said that they are refuted as being of the nature of that.

original: yang de nyid /
analyzed: yang de nyid /
translated: Also, he says,

original: sgra yi rjes 'gro ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: sgra yi rjes 'gro ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Apart from following sound,

original: shes pa 'jig rten na yod min //
analyzed: shes pa 'jig rten na yod min //
translated: There is no cognition in the world.

original: shes pa rjes su bsgrub pa nyid //
analyzed: shes pa rjes su bsgrub pa nyid //
translated: The proof of cognition

original: thams cad sgra ru shes par bya //
analyzed: thams cad sgra ru shes par bya //
translated: Is that everything is known as sound.

original: zhes sgra ni shes pa'i srog lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes sgra ni shes pa'i srog lta bu ste /
translated: Sound is like the life of cognition.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir 'di la don ma reg bar rig pa tsam gyis chos kyang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir 'di la don ma reg bar rig pa tsam gyis chos kyang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not a phenomenon that is merely cognition, without contacting its object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra'i shes pa don 'di bum pa zhes nye bar sbyor gyi bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra shes pa rang nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa don 'di bum pa zhes nye bar sbyor gyi bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra shes pa rang nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the word connects with the object, the pot, not with the word itself, ‚Äúpot.‚Äù

original: de ltar sbyor na ni sgra las don bum pa mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor na ni sgra las don bum pa mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were connected in that way, it would follow that the object, the pot, would not be understood from the word.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras shes pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras shes pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù expresses the cognition itself.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i shes pas sgra dmigs pa ni don gyi sgra rab tu sbyor gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i shes pas sgra dmigs pa ni don gyi sgra rab tu sbyor gyi /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the word observes the word, but it does not connect with the word that expresses the object.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not the nature of cognition.

original: rig pa tsam gyi chos kyang ma yin te zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa tsam gyi chos kyang ma yin te zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
translated: It is established that it is not a phenomenon that is merely cognition.

original: don la sgra yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: don la sgra yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the word does not exist in the object,

original: don 'di nye bar sbyor bar gyur pas rnam par shes pa skyed pa na /
analyzed: don 'di nye bar sbyor bar gyur pas rnam par shes pa skyed pa na /
translated: when the object connects with it and consciousness arises,

original: don gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i sgra'i so sor snang ba mdun du byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i sgra'i so sor snang ba mdun du byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to make the appearance of the word, which is not the nature of the object, manifest,

original: ro nye bar sbyor bar gyur bas shes pa skyed pa na rol bdag nyid du med pa'i gzugs ro'i shes pas mdun du mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro nye bar sbyor bar gyur bas shes pa skyed pa na rol bdag nyid du med pa'i gzugs ro'i shes pas mdun du mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is not reasonable to make the form, which is not the nature of the taste, manifest through the contact of the tongue, since the consciousness arises from the contact of the tongue with the taste.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dril la sogs pa phan tshun sbyor ba ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dril la sogs pa phan tshun sbyor ba ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that the smell, etc. are not mutually combined.

original: des ni don gyi dbang du byas pa'i so sor nges pa bstan nas /
analyzed: des ni don gyi dbang du byas pa'i so sor nges pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the determination based on the object,

original: de ni shes pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: now, based on consciousness,

original: 'di stos las skyes pa'i shes pa don gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di stos las skyes pa'i shes pa don gzhan gzugs la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: the consciousness that arises from the object is the other, following form, etc.

original: de 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to apprehend that.

original: gal te don la rjod par byed pa'i sgra yod par khas blangs na /
analyzed: gal te don la rjod par byed pa'i sgra yod par khas blangs na /
translated: If one accepts that the word expressing the object exists,

original: don gzugs la sogs pa dbang po gzhan gyi shes pa skyed pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas dbang po gzhan gyi shes pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir mi skyed do //
analyzed: don gzugs la sogs pa dbang po gzhan gyi shes pa skyed pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas dbang po gzhan gyi shes pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir mi skyed do //
translated: But since the object, such as form, is not of the nature of the other sense faculties, it cannot generate the other sense consciousnesses.

original: bskyed na ni don gcig gis dbang po thams cad kyi blo skyong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed na ni don gcig gis dbang po thams cad kyi blo skyong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did generate them, it would follow that a single object would generate the cognitions of all the sense faculties.

original: de lta na yid kyi shes pa ltar dbang po'i shes pa gcig kyang don thams cad la dmigs par 'gyur te /üîΩmig kyang gzugs la brten nas skyes pa'i shes pa gcig gi don gzhan @186a * //
analyzed: de lta na yid kyi shes pa ltar dbang po'i shes pa gcig kyang don thams cad la dmigs par 'gyur te / mig kyang gzugs la brten nas skyes pa'i shes pa gcig gi don gzhan @186a * //
translated: In that case, like mental consciousness, a single sense consciousness would also observe all objects.

original: sgra yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye also generates a single consciousness that apprehends other objects, such as form and sound.

original: gal te de ni de ltar yin te yid kyi shes ba bzhin kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni de ltar yin te yid kyi shes ba bzhin kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that is so, that it is just like mental consciousness,

original: rnam bar rtog pa can gyi yid kyi shes ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam bar rtog pa can gyi yid kyi shes ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: then it is only conceptual mental consciousness.

original: dpang po'i blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpang po'i blo ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a sense consciousness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yid ni don gyi nus ba nye ba la mi ltos pa yin la dbang bo'i blo ni don nye ba la ltos pa nyid de /
analyzed: yid ni don gyi nus ba nye ba la mi ltos pa yin la dbang bo'i blo ni don nye ba la ltos pa nyid de /
translated: The mental consciousness does not depend on the presence of an object. The sense consciousnesses do depend on the presence of an object.

original: don nye ba la mi ltos na cis skyed ce na /
analyzed: don nye ba la mi ltos na cis skyed ce na /
translated: If they do not depend on the presence of an object, what causes them to arise?

original: rtog ba'i bag chags kyis bslang ba //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog ba'i bag chags kyis bslang ba // zhes gsungs te /
translated: They arise from latent potentialities of conception.

original: de'i dbang gi yul snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gi yul snang ba'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is the one that apprehends the object of the sense consciousnesses.

original: yid ni dbang po'i don ma nges par 'dzin la dbang po'i blo ni de las bzlog par nyams su myong bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni dbang po'i don ma nges par 'dzin la dbang po'i blo ni de las bzlog par nyams su myong bar grub pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness apprehends the object of the sense consciousnesses without certainty, whereas the sense consciousnesses experience their objects in a way that is the opposite of that.

original: rtog pa'i bag chags kyang ci'i phyir don du snang bar bskyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa'i bag chags kyang ci'i phyir don du snang bar bskyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why do latent potentialities of conception give rise to the appearance of objects?

original: de ni mngon sum gyi snang ba gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gang yang rung ba myong ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyi snang ba gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gang yang rung ba myong ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are related to the experience of any of the appearances of direct perception, such as forms, sounds, and so on.

original: des 'phangs pa'i phyir sgra dang don du lhan cig gam ste 'di bum pa zhes so //
analyzed: des 'phangs pa'i phyir sgra dang don du lhan cig gam ste 'di bum pa zhes so //
translated: Because of that, the appearance of the object and the sound of the word arise simultaneously, as in ‚ÄúThis is a pot.‚Äù

original: so sor te brda la ma byang ba'i sgra dang don du snang ba lta bur ro ;
analyzed: so sor te brda la ma byang ba'i sgra dang don du snang ba lta bur ro ;
translated: Or they arise separately, as in the case of the appearance of the word and the appearance of the object for someone who is not familiar with the sign.

original: / don ni dbang po shes pa skyed par nye bar sbyor te sgyed par mngon sum du phyogs te mthar thug ba na'o //
analyzed: / don ni dbang po shes pa skyed par nye bar sbyor te sgyed par mngon sum du phyogs te mthar thug ba na'o //
translated: The object is applied to the production of the cognition of the sense faculty, when it is directly in front of it, and is at its limit.

original: sgra dran pa'i nye ba la ltos nas dbang po'i blo skyed na'o //
analyzed: sgra dran pa'i nye ba la ltos nas dbang po'i blo skyed na'o //
translated: If the cognition of the sense faculty is produced in dependence on the proximity of the memory of the word,

original: dbang bo'i blo de'i don bsgribs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang bo'i blo de'i don bsgribs par 'gyur te /
translated: then the object of that cognition of the sense faculty will be obscured.

original: don nye ba tsam gyis skyed bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don nye ba tsam gyis skyed bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It will not be produced merely by the proximity of the object.

original: don yod pas shes pa mi skyed kyi dran pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod pas shes pa mi skyed kyi dran pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of the object does not produce cognition, but produces memory.

original: brda'i dus na yod pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i spyi dran pa med pa'i don la sgra de nye bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: brda'i dus na yod pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i spyi dran pa med pa'i don la sgra de nye bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: The universal of verbal expression that existed at the time of the convention is not remembered, and that word is applied to the object.

original: sgra'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no apprehension through the word,

original: sgra gang gzhan brdar ma byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra gang gzhan brdar ma byas pa bzhin no //
translated: like any other word that has not been made into a convention.

original: dper na bum pa la brda ma byas pa'i snam bu'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la brda ma byas pa'i snam bu'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the word cloth that has not been made into a convention for a pot.

original: de lta bas na sngon gyi sgra dran pa nyid 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na sngon gyi sgra dran pa nyid 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that it is just the memory of the previous word.

original: dran par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dran par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable to remember,

original: don gyis lhan cig byas pa'i bye brag ste /üîΩdon gyis dran pa'i bag chags sad par byas pa'i 'gyur ba nang ste /üîΩshes pa la med na sgra'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: don gyis lhan cig byas pa'i bye brag ste / don gyis dran pa'i bag chags sad par byas pa'i 'gyur ba nang ste / shes pa la med na sgra'i bye brag ste /
translated: The difference is in the meaning.üîΩThe difference is in the consciousness.

original: don de'i ming dran par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don de'i ming dran par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so, it would be unreasonable for the specific sound to recall the meaning.

original: sgra'i bye brag dran pa de des byas pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: sgra'i bye brag dran pa de des byas pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: If the specific sound were not produced by that,

original: don de dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir snam bu kun nas bslang ba ma yin pa'i bum pa'i sgras snam bu mi 'dzin pa ltar de'i ming des don de rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dran pa ma skyes pa nyid du dran pa'i @186b bag chags sad pa'i 'gyur ba dran ba la mi ltos pas blo la don gyis byed na ni /
analyzed: don de dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir snam bu kun nas bslang ba ma yin pa'i bum pa'i sgras snam bu mi 'dzin pa ltar de'i ming des don de rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gal te dran pa ma skyes pa nyid du dran pa'i @186b bag chags sad pa'i 'gyur ba dran ba la mi ltos pas blo la don gyis byed na ni /
translated: then it would not be related to that meaning, and therefore, just as a pot is not apprehended by the sound of a cloth, which does not produce it, so that name would not cognize that meaning.

original: blo skyed pa nyid kyang dran pa la ci ste ltos zhes bya ba'i don du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: blo skyed pa nyid kyang dran pa la ci ste ltos zhes bya ba'i don du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If the production of the cognition of the meaning were due to the transformation of the arousing of the latent potentiality of memory, without the production of memory itself, then why would the production of the cognition depend on memory?üîΩThis is the meaning of the passage.

original: don blo skyed par zhugs pa na dran pas bar chad du 'gyur ba des na'o //
analyzed: don blo skyed par zhugs pa na dran pas bar chad du 'gyur ba des na'o //
translated: When the cognition of the meaning is engaged, memory would be an obstruction.

original: nus ba zhugs ba'i don gyis dran pa bskyed pa'i dus na blo skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nus ba zhugs ba'i don gyis dran pa bskyed pa'i dus na blo skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of that,

original: gang sngon blo yi skyed byed min //
analyzed: gang sngon blo yi skyed byed min //
translated: The non-producer of the previous

original: nye bar sbyor ba dbyer med do //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba dbyer med do //
translated: cognition is not different from the application.

original: nus pa zhugs pa nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa zhugs pa nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the entry of the potentiality itself.

original: don de ni des kyang ste dran pa skyed pa nang  bskyed bar byed pa ma yin pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de ni des kyang ste dran pa skyed pa nang  bskyed bar byed pa ma yin pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That object is also not produced by that, by the production of memory.

original: blo gcig la yang sngar bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa dang / phyi nas bskyed par bya ba nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: blo gcig la yang sngar bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa dang / phyi nas bskyed par bya ba nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that what was not to be produced before is to be produced later.

original: de ltar don de'i skyed pa ma yin la blo yang des bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir don med kyang mig blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar don de'i skyed pa ma yin la blo yang des bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir don med kyang mig blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that object is not produced, and the cognition is not to be produced by that. Therefore, even without the object, there would be cognition.

original: 'di  mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di  mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this does not depend on that.

original: dran bas nye bar sbyor ba ste dran pa yod na de ma thag tu yod pa'i phyir blo'i don 'di'i rjes su bya ba ste des bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran bas nye bar sbyor ba ste dran pa yod na de ma thag tu yod pa'i phyir blo'i don 'di'i rjes su bya ba ste des bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: It is applied by memory, because it is immediately present when memory is present. It is the object of the intellect, because it is produced by the intellect.

original: dngos po ni rang bzhin des rang bzhin de la mi ltos pa ste rang bzhin de la mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni rang bzhin des rang bzhin de la mi ltos pa ste rang bzhin de la mi brten pa'o //
translated: The thing is not dependent on that nature, because it is not based on that nature.

original: bye brag tu byed pa dbyug pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba skyes bu dang / de dag gi 'brel ba dang / 'jig rten ba'i rnam bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu byed pa dbyug pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba skyes bu dang / de dag gi 'brel ba dang / 'jig rten ba'i rnam bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The distinction is the stick, the distinguished is the man, and their relation is the worldly convention.

original: skyes bu dbyug pa can zhes bya'i dbyug pa skyes bu can zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dbyug pa can zhes bya'i dbyug pa skyes bu can zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: The man is called ‚Äúthe man with the stick,‚Äù but the stick is not called ‚Äúthe stick of the man.‚Äù

original: de snyed bzung nas bye brag tu byed pa'i blo yis skyes bu dbyug pa can zhes ba sdu ba'o //
analyzed: de snyed bzung nas bye brag tu byed pa'i blo yis skyes bu dbyug pa can zhes ba sdu ba'o //
translated: Having grasped it in that way, the intellect that makes the distinction combines them, saying ‚Äúthe man with the stick.‚Äù

original: de lta na bye brag tu rtogs kyi gzhan du de las bzlog na ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na bye brag tu rtogs kyi gzhan du de las bzlog na ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: In that way, it is understood as a distinction, but not otherwise, because that is the opposite of that.

original: dbyug pa can la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni ba lang 'gro ba can zhes bya'i 'gro ba la lang can zhes bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbyug pa can la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni ba lang 'gro ba can zhes bya'i 'gro ba la lang can zhes bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuch as the club-bearer‚Äù is meant to include the example of the cow-herder, where the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not the word ‚Äúcow-herder.‚Äù

original: rnam par gzhag pa mi shes na bye brag tu byed pa la sogs pa'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa mi shes na bye brag tu byed pa la sogs pa'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not know the classification, one will not know the distinction between the differentia and the substratum of the differentia.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad kyi 'brel pa dag tha dad pa mngon sum gyi blo la mi snang bas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad kyi 'brel pa dag tha dad pa mngon sum gyi blo la mi snang bas /
translated: Since the relation of the different characteristics is not perceived by the mind,

original: rigs la sogs pa'i bye brag tu byed pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba'i shes bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i bye brag tu byed pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba'i shes bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one will not know the distinction between the differentia and the substratum of the differentia.

original: 'o ma dang chu ngag sngar tha dad par mthong na ni 'o ma chu dag ces rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu ngag sngar tha dad par mthong na ni 'o ma chu dag ces rtogs kyi /
translated: If one sees milk and water separately at first, one understands that they are milk and water.

original: sngar 'o ma dang der 'dre ba'i chu dag bye brag ma mthong na ni de la 'o ma chu can zhes bya bar ni mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar 'o ma dang der 'dre ba'i chu dag bye brag ma mthong na ni de la 'o ma chu can zhes bya bar ni mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: But if one does not see the distinction between the milk and the water mixed together, one does not understand that it is milk with water in it.

original: gang yang dbyug pa @187a * //
analyzed: gang yang dbyug pa @187a * //
translated: As for the man with the club,

original: can la sogs pa ni bye brag tu byed pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba tha dad pa rtogs pa de la yang ngo //
analyzed: can la sogs pa ni bye brag tu byed pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba tha dad pa rtogs pa de la yang ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate the different specific and general properties that are understood.

original: brda dran pa'i tshul ni brda dran pa'i thabs te snga phyir dran pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: brda dran pa'i tshul ni brda dran pa'i thabs te snga phyir dran pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe manner of remembering the convention‚Äù means the method of remembering the convention, that is, the order of remembering the prior and subsequent.

original: ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sngar dbyug pa dang / skyes bu dang / de dag gi 'brel ba dang de nas de dag bsdus nas dbyug pa can zhes sdud pa'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: sngar dbyug pa dang / skyes bu dang / de dag gi 'brel ba dang de nas de dag bsdus nas dbyug pa can zhes sdud pa'i rim gyis so //
translated: First, the stick, the man, and their relation are remembered, and then, by the process of combining them, the compound ‚Äústick-holder‚Äù is remembered.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma la mi dmigs kyi da ltar tsam la dmigs pa'i mig gis zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pas so //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma la mi dmigs kyi da ltar tsam la dmigs pa'i mig gis zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe eye that perceives only the present‚Äù refers to the sense perception.

original: de ji ltar sdud par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ji ltar sdud par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit cannot combine them‚Äù means that it cannot combine them in the way that the mental perception does.

original: yid dang dbang po'i shes pa dag bye brag med na ni nyams su myong ba dag dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid dang dbang po'i shes pa dag bye brag med na ni nyams su myong ba dag dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if there were no difference between the mental perception and the sense perception, it would follow, absurdly, that they would contradict each other‚Äôs experience,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe mental perception of the past and future . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'di bum pa 'di bum pa zhes bya ba'i yul mngon par 'du byas pa'i sgra dbang po'i shes pas rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'di bum pa 'di bum pa zhes bya ba'i yul mngon par 'du byas pa'i sgra dbang po'i shes pas rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the auditory consciousness understands the sound that is the object of mental activity, ‚ÄúThis is a pot, this is a pot,‚Äù

original: rigs la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni rdzas te /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni rdzas te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin terms of substance, etc.‚Äù refers to substance, quality, action, name, and collection.

original: dbyug pa can dang / yon tan de ba lang dkar po dang / las te ba lang 'gro ba zhes bya ba dang / ming gi ste 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba rtags lnga bstan te /
analyzed: dbyug pa can dang / yon tan de ba lang dkar po dang / las te ba lang 'gro ba zhes bya ba dang / ming gi ste 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba rtags lnga bstan te /
translated: The five signs are: the man with the stick, the white cow, the action, the cow goes, and the name, this is a cow.

original: de dag gi tha snyad ni brda'am de dag gcig tu bsdus par dbyug ba can dang ba lang dkar po zhes du ma bsdus pa snang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tha snyad ni brda'am de dag gcig tu bsdus par dbyug ba can dang ba lang dkar po zhes du ma bsdus pa snang ba'o //
translated: The conventions of these are the sign or the collection of these in one, the appearance of the collection of many, the man with the white cow.

original: de dag yul ma yin pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag yul ma yin pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa ni /
translated: Since these are not objects, the sense consciousnessüîΩis not understood to combine many objects into one.

original: don du ma gcig tu sbyor bar byed par rtogs te don rnams sbyor bar byed pa yang de yin la rtogs pa yang de yin pas /
analyzed: don du ma gcig tu sbyor bar byed par rtogs te don rnams sbyor bar byed pa yang de yin la rtogs pa yang de yin pas /
translated: It is the combination of objects and it is the understanding,

original: don rnam sbyor bar byed par rtogs pa ste de'i nang du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: don rnam sbyor bar byed par rtogs pa ste de'i nang du mi 'jug go //
translated: but it does not engage in the combination of objects.

original: rnam par rtog bas bslang ba yin na dbang po'i blo de'i tshogs pa mig dang snang ba dang gzugs dag 'dus pa dang ldan pa gang rang gi yul ba lang du snang ba yang 'di ltar brtag par bya'o snyam pa'i 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur te rnam par
analyzed: rnam par rtog bas bslang ba yin na dbang po'i blo de'i tshogs pa mig dang snang ba dang gzugs dag 'dus pa dang ldan pa gang rang gi yul ba lang du snang ba yang 'di ltar brtag par bya'o snyam pa'i 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur te rnam par
translated: If it is aroused by conception, then the cognition of the sense faculty would be associated with the assembly of eye, light, and form, and it would be stopped by the conception that thinks, ‚ÄúI will investigate whether the object that appears as a cow is like this.‚Äù

original: rtog pa yin pa'i phyir rnam bar rtog ba gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa yin pa'i phyir rnam bar rtog ba gzhan yin te /
translated: Because it is a conception, it is a different conception.

original: 'dod pa'i rtog pa gnyen po'i 'dod pas ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rtog pa gnyen po'i 'dod pas ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the conception of desire being stopped by the antidote of non-desire.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa ni zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa ni zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúThat very conception‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: dbang po'i blo 'di don nye ba la mi ltos par yang 'gyur te rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo 'di don nye ba la mi ltos par yang 'gyur te rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This cognition of the sense faculty would not depend on the object being near, because it is a conception.

original: gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum smra ba dag gi lugs @187b brtag par bzhed nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum smra ba dag gi lugs @187b brtag par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, wishing to investigate the system of the proponents of conception, such as Kumarila,

original: re zhig de dag gi 'dod pa legs par dgod ba ste /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gi 'dod pa legs par dgod ba ste /
translated: he first sets forth their assertions well.

original: gzhan min 'di zhes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan min 'di zhes pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not other, it is this,‚Äù

original: bya ba 'brel ba dang bcas pa smos so //
analyzed: bya ba 'brel ba dang bcas pa smos so //
translated: The object of the sense faculty is the object of the sense consciousness.

original: de la lan gdab pa ni nye ba nges pa zhes bya ba deng yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la lan gdab pa ni nye ba nges pa zhes bya ba deng yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúProximity‚Äù is not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar mun pa na yod pa'i bum pa ni dbang bo'i shes pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir med pa dang / bye brag med pa la yang bum pa der reg pa las kyang 'di bum pa'i blo de 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa na yod pa'i bum pa ni dbang bo'i shes pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir med pa dang / bye brag med pa la yang bum pa der reg pa las kyang 'di bum pa'i blo de 'byung la /
translated: Thus, a pot in the dark is not able to generate a sense consciousness, so it is nonexistent. Also, in the absence of distinctions, the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a pot‚Äù arises from touching the pot.

original: de ni mngon sum don nye ba nges pa ma yin te /üîΩmun pa na gnas pa'i bum ba gang dbang po'i yul gyi don dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la bum pa de ni nus pas stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum don nye ba nges pa ma yin te / mun pa na gnas pa'i bum ba gang dbang po'i yul gyi don dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la bum pa de ni nus pas stong pa'i phyir /
translated: That is not a direct perception that ascertains proximity to the object.

original: med par dang bye brag med pa'i phyir 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i blo ni thams cad du bum pa'i gzugs de'i mthu las mngon sum du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par dang bye brag med pa'i phyir 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i blo ni thams cad du bum pa'i gzugs de'i mthu las mngon sum du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a pot that exists in the dark is not able to generate a sense consciousness that is an object of the sense faculty, it is nonexistent and without distinctions. The cognition ‚ÄúThis is a pot‚Äù does not always engage in direct perception due to the power of that form of the pot.

original: gal te reg pas lus kyi blo skye la de las mngon sum gzugs la skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te reg pas lus kyi blo skye la de las mngon sum gzugs la skye'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the cognition of the body arises from contact and from that the cognition of form arises,üîΩthen the cognition of the body would not arise from contact with the body.

original: brgyud pas nye bar sbyor na 'das pa'i yul dang blo dag byas la /
analyzed: brgyud pas nye bar sbyor na 'das pa'i yul dang blo dag byas la /
translated: If you say that they are related indirectly, then the past object and cognition would be related.

original: de las da ltar mngon sum skye bas da ltar gyi mngon sum gyis 'das pa dag mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las da ltar mngon sum skye bas da ltar gyi mngon sum gyis 'das pa dag mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the present direct perception arises from that, it follows that the present direct perception would see the past.

original: don nye ba nges pa'i yul can du khyed kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nye ba nges pa'i yul can du khyed kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And you also accept that direct perception has a present object.

original: 'das pa ni mi nye bas mngon sum ma de'i yul ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'das pa ni mi nye bas mngon sum ma de'i yul ma yin no ;
translated: Since the past is not present, it is not the object of direct perception.

original: / yul ma yin pa la 'jug na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / yul ma yin pa la 'jug na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it engaged with what is not its object, there would be the fault of overextension.

original: de'i phyir med pa las khyad par du ma gyur pa la yang re ga na 'di bum pa'o zhes rtog pa ni /üîΩbum pa'i gzugs mngon sum du gyur pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa las khyad par du ma gyur pa la yang re ga na 'di bum pa'o zhes rtog pa ni / bum pa'i gzugs mngon sum du gyur pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù without distinguishing it from what is nonexistent,üîΩone would not have the direct perception of the form of the pot.

original: gal te bum pa'i gzugs ni reg bas mngon sum du mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i gzugs ni reg bas mngon sum du mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If you say that the form of the pot is not directly perceived by contact,

original: bum pa'i rdzas dag reg bas kyang mngon sum du bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i blo ni reg pa'i sgo nas rdzas kyi don nye bar nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa'i rdzas dag reg bas kyang mngon sum du bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i blo ni reg pa'i sgo nas rdzas kyi don nye bar nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Also, the substance of the pot is directly perceived by contact. Therefore, the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a pot‚Äù is the ascertainment of the object, substance, by means of contact.

original: reg pas bskyed pa ni reg bya'i dngos po las skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: reg pas bskyed pa ni reg bya'i dngos po las skyes pa yin na /
translated: If that which is generated by contact is generated from the entity of the tangible object,

original: bum pa 'di zhes shes ba ni reg bya'i dbang pos skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: bum pa 'di zhes shes ba ni reg bya'i dbang pos skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: it is not logical that the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a pot‚Äù is generated by the sense faculty of touch.

original: de ltar rtog par byed pa na blo de la kha dog kyang so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtog par byed pa na blo de la kha dog kyang so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one conceives of it in that way, that cognition also perceives color individually.

original: kyang gi sgras ni reg bya yang snang ba'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni reg bya yang snang ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the tangible object also appears.

original: de ltar gzugs dang reg bya gnyig blo gcig la snang ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs dang reg bya gnyig blo gcig la snang ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both form and the tangible object appear to a single cognition.

original: yang dbang po'i shes pa dag rang gi ming gi sgo nas don dag shes par byed pa nyid @188a * //üîΩyin na / sgra gang zhig brda'i dus na yod pa'i ming du mthong ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: yang dbang po'i shes pa dag rang gi ming gi sgo nas don dag shes par byed pa nyid @188a * // yin na / sgra gang zhig brda'i dus na yod pa'i ming du mthong ba'i sgra ni /
translated: Moreover, if the sense consciousnesses are the cognition of objects by means of their names,

original: don de mthong ba na sgra de dran par rigs te /
analyzed: don de mthong ba na sgra de dran par rigs te /
translated: then when one sees an object, it is logical that one would recall the sound that is the name that existed at the time of the convention.

original: 'di bum ba zhes don 'dzin ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di bum ba zhes don 'dzin ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the apprehension of the object, the pot.

original: yid kyi nye bar gtod pas kyang sgra dran bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar gtod pas kyang sgra dran bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: And it is true that the sound is remembered by the mental attention,

original: de ni don de'i sgo nas don dag shes pa ma yin no//
analyzed: de ni don de'i sgo nas don dag shes pa ma yin no//
translated: but that does not mean that the object is known by way of that object.

original: de'i phyir don 'dzin pa'i sgra ni ma rtogs par 'byung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don 'dzin pa'i sgra ni ma rtogs par 'byung bar mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the sound which apprehends the object arises without understanding.

original: don ma rtogs kyang dran na ni don dang mi 'dzin ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don ma rtogs kyang dran na ni don dang mi 'dzin ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one remembers without understanding the object, then because one does not apprehend the object, it would not be direct perception.

original: don de sgra dran bar sngar rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don de sgra dran bar sngar rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And one would not previously understand the object by remembering the sound,

original: don rtogs pa'i sgra dran pa la ltos pa'i phyir la de yang ma dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i sgra dran pa la ltos pa'i phyir la de yang ma dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sound which understands the object depends on the memory of the sound, and that is not remembered.

original: de ltar don de rtogs pa med pa la sgra'i bye brag gang don 'dzin pa ji ltar dran te don ma rtogs par de sgra dran na don mi 'dzin bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar don de rtogs pa med pa la sgra'i bye brag gang don 'dzin pa ji ltar dran te don ma rtogs par de sgra dran na don mi 'dzin bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, how could one remember the particular sound which apprehends the object without understanding that object? Because if one remembers the sound without understanding the object, it follows that one does not apprehend the object.

original: sgra de mi dran na yang skyes bu des sgra dang bsres pa'i don rtogs so zhes bya ba de ji ltar srid /
analyzed: sgra de mi dran na yang skyes bu des sgra dang bsres pa'i don rtogs so zhes bya ba de ji ltar srid /
translated: But if the sound is not remembered, how could that person understand the meaning associated with the sound?

original: ji ltar dran par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dran par mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it not reasonable to remember the sound?

original: sgra de ni don 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir don mthong ba ni don de las brda'i dus na 'brel ba'i sgra dran par rigs te /
analyzed: sgra de ni don 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir don mthong ba ni don de las brda'i dus na 'brel ba'i sgra dran par rigs te /
translated: Because the sound is the apprehender of the meaning, it is reasonable that when the meaning is seen, the sound that was associated with that meaning at the time of the convention is remembered,

original: 'brel ba shes pa'i me dang du bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba shes pa'i me dang du bdag bzhin no //
translated: like the fire and smoke that are known to be related.

original: de lta yin na yang skyes bu 'di sgra la ltos nas dbang po'i blo skye ba'i phyir sgra med pa can gyi don mi mthong la /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang skyes bu 'di sgra la ltos nas dbang po'i blo skye ba'i phyir sgra med pa can gyi don mi mthong la /
translated: Even if that is so, because the person‚Äôs mental state arises in dependence on the sound, he does not see the meaning without the sound.

original: don mi mthong na yang sgra mi dran no ;
analyzed: don mi mthong na yang sgra mi dran no ;
translated: And if he does not see the meaning, he does not remember the sound.

original: / sgra ma dran na yang sgra'i sgo nas don la 'jug par mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: / sgra ma dran na yang sgra'i sgo nas don la 'jug par mi sbyor ro //
translated: And if he does not remember the sound, he does not connect the meaning with the sound.

original: sgra ma sbyar na yang don mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩlong ba nyid 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra ma sbyar na yang don mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir / long ba nyid 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: And if he does not connect the sound, he does not understand the meaning. Therefore, because all beings would be without understanding of the meaning,üîΩthey would be like the blind.

original: 'on ba la sogs pa yang 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on ba la sogs pa yang 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: They would be like the deaf and so on.

original: de lta bas na dbang po'i shes pa'i gtam yang ldog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po'i shes pa'i gtam yang ldog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the theory of the sense perception is also refuted.

original: gal te don shes pa skyed pa la mngon du phyogs bas tshogs pa nang gi sgra'i 'du byed bag chags sad bar byed pa des na sgra dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te don shes pa skyed pa la mngon du phyogs bas tshogs pa nang gi sgra'i 'du byed bag chags sad bar byed pa des na sgra dran pa ma yin te /
translated: If the sound that is the cause of the recollection of the word is the sound that is the cause of the arising of the cognition of the object, then the sound that is the cause of the arising of the cognition of the object is not the sound that is the cause of the recollection of the word, because the sound that is the cause of the arising of the cognition of the object is the sound that is the cause of the arousing of the latent potentialities of the internal conditions of the sound that is directed toward the arising of the cognition of the object.

original: de lta na don las sgra skye bar 'gyur la de lta na ni don dang sgra ngag gi 'brel pa dngos po'i dbang gis gnas par 'gyur na de ni med do//
analyzed: de lta na don las sgra skye bar 'gyur la de lta na ni don dang sgra ngag gi 'brel pa dngos po'i dbang gis gnas par 'gyur na de ni med do//
translated: If that were so, then the word would arise from the object, and in that case, the relation between the object and the word would be established by the power of real entities, but that does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brda ma bstan pa la 'brel ba de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brda ma bstan pa la 'brel ba de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because there is no relation in the absence of the teaching of the convention.

original: brda kho na'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir don gyis bskyed pa ni med do //
analyzed: brda kho na'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir don gyis bskyed pa ni med do //
translated: Because it follows only the convention, it is not produced by the object.

original: gal te don dang brda gnyis la brten nas dngos bor 'gyur ba'i 'brel ba skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dang brda gnyis la brten nas dngos bor 'gyur ba'i 'brel ba skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation that is the cause of the arising of the cognition of the object is produced in dependence on both the object and the convention,

original: brda ni 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: brda ni 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir la /
translated: then because the convention is engaged by desire,

original: skyes bu'i 'dod @188b bas ni don rnams ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod @188b bas ni don rnams ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because objects do not change due to the desire of a person,

original: don gyi rang bzhin du 'brel pa 'dod pas zhugs pa'i brda'i dus na skyes pa'i rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin du 'brel pa 'dod pas zhugs pa'i brda'i dus na skyes pa'i rang bzhin med do //
translated: the nature of the object is related to the sign. Therefore, the nature of the sign does not arise due to the desire of a person.

original: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas don rnams gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas don rnams gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: If objects change due to the desire of a person,

original: don gyi rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa skye na ni don de nyid du 'gyur bas na brda ma bstan pa'i skyes bu gzhan la yang de'i ming gis 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa skye na ni don de nyid du 'gyur bas na brda ma bstan pa'i skyes bu gzhan la yang de'i ming gis 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: and the nature of the object is related to the sign, then the object would be the sign itself. Therefore, even a person who has not been taught the sign would apprehend the object by means of its name,

original: du ba las me bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba las me bzhin no //
translated: just as one apprehends fire by means of smoke.

original: gal te 'brel pa de skyes bu'i dbang gis tha dad de des na skyes bu ma bstan pas rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa de skyes bu'i dbang gis tha dad de des na skyes bu ma bstan pas rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation is different due to the power of a person, and therefore it is not understood without the teaching of a person,

original: skyes bu so sos 'brel ba'i don rnams bdag nyid tha dad bar 'gyur ba ni med de /
analyzed: skyes bu so sos 'brel ba'i don rnams bdag nyid tha dad bar 'gyur ba ni med de /
translated: then the objects related by individual persons would not be different from each other.

original: 'brel pa de'i bdag nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel pa de'i bdag nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that the relation would not be the nature of those objects.

original: de bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist as the nature of that.

original: dbang po'i 'dis so //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'dis so //
translated: By this sense faculty.

original: sgra'i sgo nas rtogs pa med kyang don nye ba'i dbang gis mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sgra'i sgo nas rtogs pa med kyang don nye ba'i dbang gis mthong ba ste /
translated: Even though there is no understanding by way of sound, there is seeing by the power of the object's proximity.

original: der snang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na rigs ba du ma bstan pa de dag ni gzhan gyi lugs brtags pas ;
analyzed: der snang ba'i phyir ro // yang na rigs ba du ma bstan pa de dag ni gzhan gyi lugs brtags pas ;
translated: Because it appears there.

original: rjes su dpag pas slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Or, those many reasonings taught are the intention of master Dignaga, as indicated by the inference of the other system.

original: da ni dbang po'i blo rtogs pas stong pa nyid du mngon sum gyis grub pa'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dbang po'i blo rtogs pas stong pa nyid du mngon sum gyis grub pa'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the establishment by direct perception of the emptiness of the cognition of the sense faculties, thus and so forth is stated.

original: mngon bar brjod pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su spangs te ;
analyzed: mngon bar brjod pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su spangs te ;
translated: Having completely abandoned all intentions of verbal expression,

original: gang blo rtogs pas ma bskyod pa'i bdag nyid brtan par gnas pa'i skyes bus kyang mig gis gzugs shes pa'i bdag nyid dmigs te /
analyzed: gang blo rtogs pas ma bskyod pa'i bdag nyid brtan par gnas pa'i skyes bus kyang mig gis gzugs shes pa'i bdag nyid dmigs te /
translated: the person who is steadfast, whose nature is unmoved by the cognition of the mind, observes the nature of the eye consciousness of form.

original: de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i blo mngon par brjod pa med par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i blo mngon par brjod pa med par 'dod do //
translated: That is asserted to be a cognition arisen from a sense faculty, without verbalization.

original: gal te rtog pa skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ba ltar mi rung bas na mi rtogs pa'i phyir med pa nyid mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ba ltar mi rung bas na mi rtogs pa'i phyir med pa nyid mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If it is said that non-existence is not established because it is not cognized, like the arising and ceasing of thoughts,

original: rtog pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] declares, ‚ÄúThis thought . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar skyes bu bsam pa spangs te gnas pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu bsam pa spangs te gnas pa la /
translated: Thus, when a person has abandoned thoughts and abides,

original: yang rnam par rtog ba byung ba na 'di snyam du /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog ba byung ba na 'di snyam du /
translated: if a thought arises again, he thinks,

original: yang bdag rnam rtog cung zad cig / rtog ba byung bar 'gyur mthong ngo //
analyzed: yang bdag rnam rtog cung zad cig / rtog ba byung bar 'gyur mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúI see that a little thought has arisen.‚Äù

original: zhes byar rtogs kyi /
analyzed: zhes byar rtogs kyi /
translated: In that way, he realizes that.

original: sngar smos pa bsam pa yongs su spangs pa'i gnas skabs na dbang po'i shes pa yod pa la mi rtogs pa phyis byung ba ji lta bde lta bu yod par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar smos pa bsam pa yongs su spangs pa'i gnas skabs na dbang po'i shes pa yod pa la mi rtogs pa phyis byung ba ji lta bde lta bu yod par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the existence of a sense consciousness in the state of having abandoned thoughts, as previously mentioned, is not cognized, so too is the existence of the thought that arises later.

original: skyes bu de yang bsam pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa las langs pa'i sems kyis cung zad rnam @189a * //
analyzed: skyes bu de yang bsam pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa las langs pa'i sems kyis cung zad rnam @189a * //
translated: That person, having arisen from the state of having abandoned all thoughts, with a mind that is thinking a little,

original: bar rtog pa'i skyes bu de rang gi sems kyi rgyud la 'di snyam du bdag la 'di lta 'di ltar rnam bar rtog pa byung ngo zhes rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar rtog pa'i skyes bu de rang gi sems kyi rgyud la 'di snyam du bdag la 'di lta 'di ltar rnam bar rtog pa byung ngo zhes rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The person who is the middle term, the thought, is known to the continuum of one‚Äôs own mind in the following way: ‚ÄúSuch and such a thought has arisen in me.‚Äù

original: des na rtog pa 'di mngon sum du gyur ba mthong ba la ji ltar na nye bar bkod pa'i rtog pa ngo mi shes zhes bya ste ngo shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rtog pa 'di mngon sum du gyur ba mthong ba la ji ltar na nye bar bkod pa'i rtog pa ngo mi shes zhes bya ste ngo shes pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, how can one say that the thought which is the middle term is not recognized in the perception of the direct perception of thought? It is recognized.

original: de ltar rtog pas stong pa'i shes pa dang / yang rtog ba dag rang rig pa bltar rung ba de ni rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i mngon sum sngar ma mthong ba'i bdag nyid la /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pas stong pa'i shes pa dang / yang rtog ba dag rang rig pa bltar rung ba de ni rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i mngon sum sngar ma mthong ba'i bdag nyid la /
translated: Thus, the consciousness devoid of thought and the thought itself are seen by reflexive awareness. This is a direct perception not mixed with thought, which has a nature not seen before.

original: phyis mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa'i bdag nyid med par grub bas na /
analyzed: phyis mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa'i bdag nyid med par grub bas na /
translated: Later, the nature of the thought is seen. Since it is established that the nature of the thought does not exist,

original: rtog pa mngon sum de'i bdag nyid yin par brtag ba 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: rtog pa mngon sum de'i bdag nyid yin par brtag ba 'gog par byed de /
translated: the thought is refuted as having the nature of direct perception.

original: bum pa snang ba'i bdag nyid la 'dre snang ba'i bdag nyid 'gog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa snang ba'i bdag nyid la 'dre snang ba'i bdag nyid 'gog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like refuting the nature of the appearance of a ghost in the appearance of a pot.

original: yang phyis mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa mngon sum sngar mthong ba la brten par mthong bas ni /
analyzed: yang phyis mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa mngon sum sngar mthong ba la brten par mthong bas ni /
translated: Also, later on, one sees that the conception of the nature of what is seen is based on what was seen before.

original: rtog ba dang ldan pa 'gog pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa dbang po'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa yod par brtags pa spong bar byed de /
analyzed: rtog ba dang ldan pa 'gog pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa dbang po'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa yod par brtags pa spong bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of the appearance of the negation of what is conceived eliminates the conception that the sense consciousness has conception.

original: sa phyogs la bum pa 'gog ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs la bum pa 'gog ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the negation of a pot in a place.

original: gzhon nu ma len na re /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len na re /
translated: Kumarila says:

original: gal te blo mngon sum ma yin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gal te blo mngon sum ma yin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: If the mind is not a direct percept, etc.

original: rtog pa mngon sum yin yang blo mngon sum ma yin pas na yul ba ltar mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa mngon sum yin yang blo mngon sum ma yin pas na yul ba ltar mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though conception is a direct percept, the mind is not a direct percept. Therefore, it is not suitable as an object.

original: dbang bo'i shes pa rtog pa med par khas len pas mi dmigs par gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba dgag pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma bkod pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bo'i shes pa rtog pa med par khas len pas mi dmigs par gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba dgag pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma bkod pa'o //
translated: Since we accept that the sense consciousnesses are without conception, non-observation does not invalidate.

original: lan spyin pa ni de yang re zhig bltar rung bas na yang dag par rigs pa'i rtog pa 'di phan tshun spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan spyin pa ni de yang re zhig bltar rung bas na yang dag par rigs pa'i rtog pa 'di phan tshun spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The response to that is: That is not so. Since it is suitable to see, this conception of what is correct is mutually exclusive.

original: don dang blo dag las gzhan pa mi srid pas don dang blo gang gis bdag nyid du gzhag bar bya zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: don dang blo dag las gzhan pa mi srid pas don dang blo gang gis bdag nyid du gzhag bar bya zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: Since it is impossible for it to be other than the object and the mind, which of the two, the object or the mind, is to be posited as the self?

original: de la don gyi bdag nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la don gyi bdag nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Of these, it is not reasonable for it to be the nature of the object,

original: nang sems kyi bdag nyid du skye ba dang 'gag pa g-yo ba'i phyir dang / yang don gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa na skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: nang sems kyi bdag nyid du skye ba dang 'gag pa g-yo ba'i phyir dang / yang don gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa na skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis te /
