translated: because it arises and ceases as the nature of the inner mind, and because it moves, and also because when it becomes the nature of the object, it is under the power of the person‚Äôs desire.

original: rtog pa ni skyes bu'i 'dod bas 'jug pa dang / ldog ba can yin par 'dod pas phyi rol gyi don skye ba dang / 'gag par yongs su g-yo ba nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa ni skyes bu'i 'dod bas 'jug pa dang / ldog ba can yin par 'dod pas phyi rol gyi don skye ba dang / 'gag par yongs su g-yo ba nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is asserted that conceptualization engages and disengages under the power of the person‚Äôs desire, it is not reasonable for the external object to move to arise and cease.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gi blo g-yo bar 'gyur gyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gi blo g-yo bar 'gyur gyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind moves under the power of conceptualization, but not the object.

original: blo la ni rnam bar @189b 'gyur ba yod mod kyi zhes bya bas 'dod pas 'gyur ba'i rtog pa yod par rung yang ngo //
analyzed: blo la ni rnam bar @189b 'gyur ba yod mod kyi zhes bya bas 'dod pas 'gyur ba'i rtog pa yod par rung yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind has a transformation‚Äù means that it is suitable for conceptualization to change under the power of desire.

original: blo de yang rig pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog ba 'jug kyang gsal bar mi 'gyur te rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo de yang rig pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog ba 'jug kyang gsal bar mi 'gyur te rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because that cognition is not a direct perception of awareness, even though conceptualization occurs, it is not clear, that is, it is not realized.

original: rtog pa de don gyi bdag nyid snang ba'i dbang gis don nyid skye ba dang / 'jig pa de ltar 'jug pa gsal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa de don gyi bdag nyid snang ba'i dbang gis don nyid skye ba dang / 'jig pa de ltar 'jug pa gsal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And that conceptualization is not clear with regard to the occurrence of the arising and cessation of the object itself, due to the appearance of the nature of the object.

original: don gyi bdag nyid du 'dus pa sun phyung zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid du 'dus pa sun phyung zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the collection as the nature of the object has already been refuted.

original: don dang blo dag las gzhan pa'i phung po yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dang blo dag las gzhan pa'i phung po yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because there is no other aggregate apart from the object and cognition,

original: gzhan cung zad dang rjes su 'brel pas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan cung zad dang rjes su 'brel pas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said that it is not related to anything else in the least.

original: rjes su gzung ba ni phan ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su gzung ba ni phan ba'o //
translated: Beneficial is helpful.

original: nye bar gnod pa ni gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnod pa ni gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Harmful is injurious.

original: bdag nyid kyis ma myong ba'i phyir skyes bu gzhan gyis yang dag par myong bas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ma myong ba'i phyir skyes bu gzhan gyis yang dag par myong bas /
translated: Because it is not experienced by oneself, it is experienced by another person.

original: bdag la rjes su gzung ba dang nye bar gnod par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag la rjes su gzung ba dang nye bar gnod par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It does not become helpful or harmful to the self.

original: gang yang mngon sum gyis rang gi blo rnam par mi rtogs na skyes bus bdag rang yang ji ltar bdag nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang mngon sum gyis rang gi blo rnam par mi rtogs na skyes bus bdag rang yang ji ltar bdag nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: If the mind does not perceive itself by itself, how can a person perceive himself by himself?

original: blun po ni bzhad gad du bya ba yin pa'i phyir lha rnams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: blun po ni bzhad gad du bya ba yin pa'i phyir lha rnams dga' ba'o //
translated: The gods are delighted because the fool is an object of ridicule.

original: dbang po dang don dag las blo yod par mi 'khrul na rtags nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po dang don dag las blo yod par mi 'khrul na rtags nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: If the mind were not mistaken about the sense faculties and objects, then that would be the reason.

original: mi 'khrul ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But there is no non-mistaken mind, that is the meaning.

original: gal te blo'i rtags nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo'i rtags nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind is the reason for the existence of the self,

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then the self would be the reason for the existence of the mind.

original: gal te bye brag pa dag rnam par shes ba nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bye brag pa dag rnam par shes ba nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: If the Vaise~ika says that the self is not consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: but is the cause of consciousness,

original: de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa yul gzhan mi 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa yul gzhan mi 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that because of it consciousness does not apprehend other objects,

original: de gsal ba'i phyir de'i bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de gsal ba'i phyir de'i bya ba gsungs te /
translated: then in order to clarify that, he says that it is the activity of the self.

original: yid de'i yul gzhan la rnam par shes pa'i skyed pa nus pas shin tu stong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: yid de'i yul gzhan la rnam par shes pa'i skyed pa nus pas shin tu stong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind, the object of the self, is completely devoid of the ability to generate consciousness of other objects,üîΩthen the self would be completely devoid of activity.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan yul la mi skyed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan yul la mi skyed pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because another consciousness does not generate an object.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa de yang blo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa de yang blo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ma grub po //
translated: And that kind of consciousness is not established because it is the nature of cognition.

original: gal te yul gsal ba blo'i rtags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul gsal ba blo'i rtags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the clarity of the object is the evidence for cognition,

original: blo de'i bye brag gsal ba nyid kyang khyod la ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: blo de'i bye brag gsal ba nyid kyang khyod la ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the clarity itself, which is a particular of that cognition, is not established for you.

original: yul gsal ba don gyi rang bzhin nyid yin na don gyi bdag nyid kyang rang dang gzhan gyi thun mong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi blo yang dpag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gsal ba don gyi rang bzhin nyid yin na don gyi bdag nyid kyang rang dang gzhan gyi thun mong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi blo yang dpag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the clarity of the object is the nature of the object itself, then since the nature of the object is common to self and other, it follows that the cognition of another would be inferred.

original: 'di la don thams cad kyis rtogs par yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la don thams cad kyis rtogs par yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this case, it would follow that all objects are cognized,

original: rgyang pa na pa la dpyad pa nyid kyis @190a * //
analyzed: rgyang pa na pa la dpyad pa nyid kyis @190a * //
translated: because it is suitable to cognize what is distant by analysis itself.

original: rtogs bar rung ba'i phyir 'dir ma gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs bar rung ba'i phyir 'dir ma gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is not stated here.

original: gal te gsal ba yul gyi rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas rtags grub tu chug kyang /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba yul gyi rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas rtags grub tu chug kyang /
translated: Even if one accepts that the clarity of the object is the nature of the object and allows that the evidence is established,

original: blo nam yang ma grub ba dang 'brel ba gzung ba med pa'i phyir rjes su mi dpogs so //
analyzed: blo nam yang ma grub ba dang 'brel ba gzung ba med pa'i phyir rjes su mi dpogs so //
translated: Since the mind is never established and is not related to a nonexistent apprehended object, it is not inferred.

original: de ltar blo mngon sum ma yin ba nyid mi rigs pa de'i phyir mngon sum nyid du rang rig bas grub pa de la rtog bas stong bar mngon sum ma ma snang ba mi dmigs pas grub bas na /
analyzed: de ltar blo mngon sum ma yin ba nyid mi rigs pa de'i phyir mngon sum nyid du rang rig bas grub pa de la rtog bas stong bar mngon sum ma ma snang ba mi dmigs pas grub bas na /
translated: Since it is illogical for the mind to be nonperceptual, it is established by reflexive awareness to be perceptual. Therefore, it is not tenable for the mind to be nonperceptual.

original: mngon sum thams cad ni mngon par brjod pa dang 'dres pa med pa kho nas don rtogs so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad ni mngon par brjod pa dang 'dres pa med pa kho nas don rtogs so zhes brjod do //
translated: Since it is established by the nonobservation of the appearing object, it is said that all perceptions realize their objects only by being unmixed with expressions.

original: gzhan yang dbang po'i byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po'i byed pa med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the object of the sense consciousnesses is not the activity of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i shes pa med na sgra 'ba' zhig las don rtogs ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa med na sgra 'ba' zhig las don rtogs ba ni /
translated: When there is no sense consciousness, the object is not realized from the mere sound.

original: dbang bo'i shes pas don gsal ba nyid dang / don byed pa nyid ji lta bar sgra'i don sgra'i blo la so sor mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang bo'i shes pas don gsal ba nyid dang / don byed pa nyid ji lta bar sgra'i don sgra'i blo la so sor mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because the object is not individually cognized by the mind as the object of the sound just as it is cognized by the sense consciousness, which is the clear appearance of the object and the object‚Äôs functionality.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul de ni brjod med rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul de ni brjod med rtogs pa'o //
translated: The object of the sense consciousness is realized without expression.

original: gsal ba dang don byed pa nyid de mngon sum mngon par brjod pa med pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba dang don byed pa nyid de mngon sum mngon par brjod pa med pa'i yul yin te /
translated: The object of direct perception is just the clear and the functional.

original: dbang po'i byed ba med na dbang po'i shes pas mthong ba ltar sgras blo la so sor snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed ba med na dbang po'i shes pas mthong ba ltar sgras blo la so sor snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, if the sense faculty is not operative, the object does not appear to the mind individually, as if it were seen by the sense consciousness.

original: de ltar sgra dang dbang bo'i shes pa'i yul mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sgra dang dbang bo'i shes pa'i yul mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since it is established that the object of the word and the object of the sense consciousness are of different characteristics,

original: gang sgra'i don ma yin pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang sgra'i don ma yin pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat which is not the meaning of the word . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ro'i blos dri bzhin zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: ro'i blos dri bzhin zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the smell for the mind of taste‚Äù is a concordant example.

original: mig gis blos gzugs bzhin zhes bya bas ni mi mthun ba'o //
analyzed: mig gis blos gzugs bzhin zhes bya bas ni mi mthun ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the form for the mind of the eye‚Äù is a discordant example.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de'i phyir rnam par 'jog par nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de'i phyir rnam par 'jog par nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because it does not follow concomitance and the counter-positive, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is not possible to posit . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yang don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgra sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don la tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgra sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don la tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, in order to understand the meaning, the word is applied in order to designate the object.

original: dbang po'i don ni brda'i rgyus sgras 'brel pa'i don phyis mthong ba'i dus na brda dang rjes su mthun par tha snyad du byed pa'i rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i don ni brda'i rgyus sgras 'brel pa'i don phyis mthong ba'i dus na brda dang rjes su mthun par tha snyad du byed pa'i rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of the sense faculty is not the cause of the convention, because when the object is seen later, it does not accord with the convention.

original: dbang po'i shes pa nyid dang don lhan cig 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa nyid dang don lhan cig 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sense consciousness itself and the object cease simultaneously.

original: de nyid rgyas bar bstan pa'i phyir de 'di ltar zhes ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas bar bstan pa'i phyir de 'di ltar zhes ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that very point, it says, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i don de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni rigs 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba thams cad las tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po'i don de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni rigs 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba thams cad las tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: The intrinsic identity of the object of the sense faculty is different from all that is similar and dissimilar.

original: yul dang lhan cig tu mthong ba'i dngos po'i skad cig ma ni /
analyzed: yul dang lhan cig tu mthong ba'i dngos po'i skad cig ma ni /
translated: The moment of the thing that is seen together with the object

original: 'gar yang gzhan du mi @190b mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gar yang gzhan du mi @190b mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is never seen as anything else.

original: mngon sum gyi don rnams rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir gsal ba las thang dbang 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don rnams rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir gsal ba las thang dbang 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because the objects of direct perception are not subsequent, they are not dependent on the clarity of the sense faculty.

original: gzhan pa tha mi dad pa spyi ni med de de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo'i bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa tha mi dad pa spyi ni med de de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo'i bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But there is no such thing as a different universal, because there is no difference in the cognition that apprehends it.

original: spyi gang la sgra 'jug pa gsal ba las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: spyi gang la sgra 'jug pa gsal ba las tha dad pa'o //
translated: The universal is that which the word applies to, and it is different from the particulars.

original: 'dis ni snang ba mi dmigs pa 'phangs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni snang ba mi dmigs pa 'phangs so //
translated: This implies the non-apprehension of appearance.

original: nye bar mi mtshon pa ni nges par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi mtshon pa ni nges par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Non-indication is the inability to ascertain.

original: ba lang ba lang zhes gcig tu 'dzin pa'i blo dang sgra spyi la zhugs nas brdar byas pa'i blo dang sgra de gzhan gsal ba la 'jug ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: ba lang ba lang zhes gcig tu 'dzin pa'i blo dang sgra spyi la zhugs nas brdar byas pa'i blo dang sgra de gzhan gsal ba la 'jug ba nyid yin na /
translated: If the cognition and the word that engage the universal, having been made by convention, ‚Äúcow, cow,‚Äù and the cognition and the word that engage the other particulars, are different,

original: spyi ma rtogs na ni gsal pa spyi'i blo dang sgras mi mtshon par 'gyur na /
analyzed: spyi ma rtogs na ni gsal pa spyi'i blo dang sgras mi mtshon par 'gyur na /
translated: then if the universal is not apprehended, the particulars would not be indicated by the cognition and the word of the universal.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis spyi de las gsal ba mi mtshon pa min no //
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis spyi de las gsal ba mi mtshon pa min no //
translated: But in your system, the universal does not fail to indicate the particulars.

original: spyi'i blo dang sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i blo dang sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: It is not endowed with the conformity of the cognition and the word of the universal.

original: spyi med pa'i bye brag gsal ba 'di spyi mthong ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba yang brda'i dus kyi rang bzhin tha snyad kyi dus kyi tshe yang yod bar rtogs pas spyis gsal ba la blo dang sgras yul du byed pa'i phyir ji ltar mi mtshon zhes bya /
analyzed: spyi med pa'i bye brag gsal ba 'di spyi mthong ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba yang brda'i dus kyi rang bzhin tha snyad kyi dus kyi tshe yang yod bar rtogs pas spyis gsal ba la blo dang sgras yul du byed pa'i phyir ji ltar mi mtshon zhes bya /
translated: Since the particular, which is not a universal, is clear, and since one understands that the nature of the object at the time of the sign exists at the time of the expression, the universal is the object of the mind and the word, because of the power of seeing the universal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang las gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang las gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúFrom which, to which?‚Äù

original: spyi so sor snang na yang mi gsal ba las tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pas so //
analyzed: spyi so sor snang na yang mi gsal ba las tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pas so //
translated: Even if the universal appears individually, there is no concomitance, because it is different from the unclear.

original: yang na so sor snang na yang zhes bya ba ni spyi dbang po la so sor snang na yang dbang po la snang bdag la 'dres pa med par snang bas rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na so sor snang na yang zhes bya ba ni spyi dbang po la so sor snang na yang dbang po la snang bdag la 'dres pa med par snang bas rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, even if it appears individually means that even if the universal appears individually to the sense faculty, there is no concomitance, because it appears to the sense faculty without mixing with itself.

original: sngon bum pas chu 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu byed pa de mthong ba'i bum pa de phyis mthong ba rnams la /
analyzed: sngon bum pas chu 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu byed pa de mthong ba'i bum pa de phyis mthong ba rnams la /
translated: The pot that was seen previously, which had the effect of holding water, is seen later in other pots.

original: mthong ba snga ma dran pa'i sa bon bzhag cing mthong ba phyi mas bag chags de nyid sad par byed pas myong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa 'dis chu 'dzin pa'o snyam pa las de don dug nyer ba'i mngon bar 'dod pa skyes pa'i tshul gyis thaüîΩsnyad rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩmngon sum don la lta ba tsam yin yang don byed pa nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i bag chags kyi mthu las byung ba'i dran pas phyis don byed pa snga ma dang 'dra ba gzhan nyams su myong ba sngon gyi de nyid 'di'o zhes nyams su myong
analyzed: mthong ba snga ma dran pa'i sa bon bzhag cing mthong ba phyi mas bag chags de nyid sad par byed pas myong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa 'dis chu 'dzin pa'o snyam pa las de don dug nyer ba'i mngon bar 'dod pa skyes pa'i tshul gyis tha snyad rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro // mngon sum don la lta ba tsam yin yang don byed pa nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i bag chags kyi mthu las byung ba'i dran pas phyis don byed pa snga ma dang 'dra ba gzhan nyams su myong ba sngon gyi de nyid 'di'o zhes nyams su myong
translated: The self is imputed in the manner of the arising of the desire to appropriate the object of the former seeing, thinking, This is mine, from the memory that arises from the power of the latent potentialities that arise from the experience of the functioning of the object, even though the seeing is merely the seeing of the object.

original: ba dag mtshams sbyor bar byed pa na don med pa sngar mthong ba de nyid de de dang rigs mthun pa mthong ba na de dag gcig tu byas nas mngon par 'dod pa dang / cig shos mi 'dod pa 'byung la /
analyzed: ba dag mtshams sbyor bar byed pa na don med pa sngar mthong ba de nyid de de dang rigs mthun pa mthong ba na de dag gcig tu byas nas mngon par 'dod pa dang / cig shos mi 'dod pa 'byung la /
translated: When the memory that arises from the power of the latent potentialities that arise from the experience of the functioning of the object in the past connects the experience of the functioning of the object in the present, which is similar to the former functioning of the object, thinking, That former one is this, the desire to appropriate the object of the former seeing, which is meaningless, arises, and the desire not to appropriate the other arises.

original: de las ni 'thob pa dang spong ba'i tha snyad dag 'jug bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de las ni 'thob pa dang spong ba'i tha snyad dag 'jug bar 'gyur ro /
translated: From that, the conventions of obtaining and abandoning arise.

original: @191a * // 'di'i nus pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: @191a * // 'di'i nus pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
translated: The engagement of its power is called memory.

original: dran pa las ni mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos kyi nus pa yang 'thob pas de dag kyang skye'o //
analyzed: dran pa las ni mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos kyi nus pa yang 'thob pas de dag kyang skye'o //
translated: From memory, the power of desire and the power of aversion are obtained, and they arise.

original: de las ni blang ba dang dor ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: de las ni blang ba dang dor ba la 'jug go //
translated: From that, the engagement of taking up and rejecting arises.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag ba'i rkyen zhes bya bas ni rgyud gcig gis dbang bo'i shes pa dang yid kyi shes pa nyid 'brel bar bstan te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag ba'i rkyen zhes bya bas ni rgyud gcig gis dbang bo'i shes pa dang yid kyi shes pa nyid 'brel bar bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmediately preceding condition‚Äù indicates that the consciousness of the sense faculties and mental consciousness are related by a single continuum.

original: gzhan du rnal 'byor pa rgyud gzhan dang 'brel ba'i dbang po'i shes ba la dmigs pa'i yid kyi dbang pos ni dmigs pa'i rkyen byas pa yang dbang bo'i shes bas skyed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du rnal 'byor pa rgyud gzhan dang 'brel ba'i dbang po'i shes ba la dmigs pa'i yid kyi dbang pos ni dmigs pa'i rkyen byas pa yang dbang bo'i shes bas skyed pa yin pas so //
translated: In other cases, the mental consciousness of a yogi that is related to another continuum and focuses on the consciousness of the sense faculties is the objective condition of the consciousness of the sense faculties, but it is not produced by the consciousness of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i shes pa rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa ste /
translated: The immediately preceding object of the consciousness of the sense faculties is

original: de'i bar med pa'i yul gyi skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de'i bar med pa'i yul gyi skad cig ma'o //
translated: the moment of the object that is without interval.

original: de dang dbang po'i shes pa lhan cig byed pas so //
analyzed: de dang dbang po'i shes pa lhan cig byed pas so //
translated: And it is the cause of the sense consciousnesses, since it is the simultaneous and cooperative condition of those.üîΩ

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba dag don dang de shes pa dag dus mnyam bar 'dod pas dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni de nyid dang dus mnyam pa la yod la de'i de ma thag pa'i yul ni de nyid dus phyis yin pas na yid rang gi shesüîΩpa dang dus gcig na yod pa yin gyi yul de dbang po'i shes pa dang byed pa'i dus mi mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba dag don dang de shes pa dag dus mnyam bar 'dod pas dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni de nyid dang dus mnyam pa la yod la de'i de ma thag pa'i yul ni de nyid dus phyis yin pas na yid rang gi shes pa dang dus gcig na yod pa yin gyi yul de dbang po'i shes pa dang byed pa'i dus mi mtshungs pas so //
translated: The object field of the sense consciousness is the object that exists at the same time as it, and the object field of the immediately preceding condition is the object that exists at a later time.üîΩTherefore, the object field of the mental consciousness exists at the same time as its own consciousness.

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang de'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul gnyi ga yang dus mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang de'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul gnyi ga yang dus mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The object field of the sense consciousness and the object field of the immediately preceding condition are both simultaneous.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i dus na rang gi yul ni med de rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'das pas so //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i dus na rang gi yul ni med de rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'das pas so //
translated: At the time of the sense consciousness, its object does not exist because it is a cause that has already passed.

original: des na dbang po'i shes pa rang dang dus gcig pa de ni skad cig gnyis pa'i yid kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: des na dbang po'i shes pa rang dang dus gcig pa de ni skad cig gnyis pa'i yid kyi yul yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object of the mental consciousness in the second moment is the object of the sense consciousness that exists at the same time as itself.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is a coemergent condition.

original: gzhan du rgyu yul dang 'bras bu shes pa dag dus mnyam na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du rgyu yul dang 'bras bu shes pa dag dus mnyam na ni /
translated: Otherwise, if the object-field of the cause and the result, the consciousness, were simultaneous,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med pas na snga na ni nus pa med la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med pas na snga na ni nus pa med la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: there would be no cause and result. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf there were no prior potentiality . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa 'dzin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa 'dzin na /
translated: If the object-field of the sense consciousness is apprehended immediately after it,

original: bzung zin ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bzung zin ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would be the apprehension of what has already been apprehended.üîΩIf the object-field of the sense consciousness is apprehended immediately after it,

original: 'di tshad ma snga ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma snga ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then it would be the apprehension of what has already been apprehended.

original: bcad pa'i yul can tshad ma yin na dran pa yang tshad ma nyid du ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcad pa'i yul can tshad ma yin na dran pa yang tshad ma nyid du ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the valid cognition of the prior moment is the valid cognition of the object-field, then it would follow, absurdly, that memory also would be a valid cognition.

original: de nyid ji lta zhe na /üîΩmthong ba'i 'du byed ma brjed pa //
analyzed: de nyid ji lta zhe na / mthong ba'i 'du byed ma brjed pa //
translated: How is that?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe conditioned things that have been seen are not forgotten.‚Äù

original: dran pa de las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa de las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between that memory and the valid cognition.

original: dran pa dang 'dra ba'i nyid na yang tshad mar mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir bya ba'i las byas zin ba las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dran pa dang 'dra ba'i nyid na yang tshad mar mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir bya ba'i las byas zin ba las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Even though it is similar to memory, it is not suitable to be a valid cognition. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not a valid cognition of the object-field of the action that has already been performed.‚Äù

original: shes pas rtogs zin pa la shes pa gzhan gyis bsgrub bar bya ba med @191b pa'i phyir phyi ma ni sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes pas rtogs zin pa la shes pa gzhan gyis bsgrub bar bya ba med @191b pa'i phyir phyi ma ni sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: The latter is a means of valid cognition because it establishes what has already been realized by a cognition, since there is no need for another cognition to establish it.

original: ma rtogs pa rtogs bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa rtogs bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It causes the realization of what has not been realized.

original: gal te don rnams ni rtag pa yin ba'i phyir snga ma nyid dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba yid kyis kyang gzung ba'i phyir yid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don rnams ni rtag pa yin ba'i phyir snga ma nyid dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba yid kyis kyang gzung ba'i phyir yid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If objects are permanent, then since the object was already apprehended by the sense consciousness, the mental consciousness does not apprehend it, and therefore the mental consciousness is not a means of valid cognition.

original: de gsal bar don de nyid rgyur gyur pa'i blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de gsal bar don de nyid rgyur gyur pa'i blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To clarify that, he says, ‚ÄúThe mental consciousness is a means of valid cognition because it is a cognition that has as its cause the very object that has been perceived by the sense consciousness.‚Äù

original: rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang bo dang / yid kyi shes pa dag rim gyis 'byung bar yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang bo dang / yid kyi shes pa dag rim gyis 'byung bar yang 'gal lo //
translated: Since there is no difference in the cause, it is contradictory that the sense consciousness and the mental consciousness arise sequentially.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i bye brag gis rim gyis 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i bye brag gis rim gyis 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that they arise sequentially due to the difference in the cooperative conditions,

original: don rtogs pa bcos su med pa la gzhan la ltos par yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa bcos su med pa la gzhan la ltos par yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would not be reasonable for the mental consciousness to depend on another, since the realization of the object cannot be fabricated.

original: gal te bya ba shes pa tha dad pas rim gyis 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba shes pa tha dad pas rim gyis 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that they arise sequentially due to the difference in the action of the cognition,

original: bya ba tha dad pa nyid yin na yang de'i byed pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba tha dad pa nyid yin na yang de'i byed pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the action were different, then its activity would also be different, and permanence would be undermined.

original: de ltar rtag pa mi 'thad bas na don rnams ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin pas 'das pa med pas ni yid don nye ba la ltos pas gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa mi 'thad bas na don rnams ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin pas 'das pa med pas ni yid don nye ba la ltos pas gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: Since permanence is not tenable in this way, objects are not momentary. Since the past does not exist, the mind does not apprehend objects that are present.

original: de ltar na bya ba gcig la grub pa dang / bde ba gcig po'i shes ba dag kyang so sor skad cig gi bye brag gis tshad mar 'gyur na de ni mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bya ba gcig la grub pa dang / bde ba gcig po'i shes ba dag kyang so sor skad cig gi bye brag gis tshad mar 'gyur na de ni mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: In that case, if a single cognition that is established and a single cognition that is happy are valid cognitions in terms of the distinctions of individual moments, this is unacceptable.

original: de ni tha snyad kyi dbang gis tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa yin pas don gcig byed pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad kyi dbang gis tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa yin pas don gcig byed pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid do //
translated: Since valid cognition is posited through the power of convention, it is a single valid cognition because it performs a single function.

original: gal te de lta na yid kyang dbang po'i shes pa dang / don gcig byed pa'i yul can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yid kyang dbang po'i shes pa dang / don gcig byed pa'i yul can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the mind would be the subject that performs the same function as the sense consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor pa skad cig mas tha snyad du byed pa'i dbang du bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor pa skad cig mas tha snyad du byed pa'i dbang du bya ba yin pas /
translated: This is from the perspective of yogis who conventionally make statements about moments.

original: skad cig rnams don dam par 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir yid ni skad cig so so nas tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: skad cig rnams don dam par 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir yid ni skad cig so so nas tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Since the moments are ultimately different from the effect, the mind is valid cognition in each moment.

original: gal te skad cig la phrad pa med pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig la phrad pa med pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not valid cognition because there is no contact with the object in a moment,

original: rang gi yul la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod par mi byed pa nyid 'di'i mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi yul la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod par mi byed pa nyid 'di'i mi slu ba yin no //
translated: its nondeceptiveness is that it is not contradicted by another valid cognition with regard to its object.

original: yang na ma rtogs pa'i don gsal bar byed pa nyid tshad ma yin la 'dis kyang don byed nus pa'i dngos po ma rtogs pa rtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na ma rtogs pa'i don gsal bar byed pa nyid tshad ma yin la 'dis kyang don byed nus pa'i dngos po ma rtogs pa rtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, valid cognition is that which makes known an object that was not known, and this [mind] is valid cognition because it knows an object that is capable of effective action and was not known.

original: tshad ma'i bdag nyid don dam par thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma'i bdag nyid don dam par thob pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is ultimately obtained as valid cognition.

original: yid 'di yang dbang bo'i shes pa rnams 'gags pa'i che chad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: yid 'di yang dbang bo'i shes pa rnams 'gags pa'i che chad ma nyid yin no //
translated: This mind is also valid cognition when the sense consciousnesses have ceased.

original: don dam bar skad cig rnams tha dad pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyi skad cig gi mtshan nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rkyen gyis @192a * //
analyzed: don dam bar skad cig rnams tha dad pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyi skad cig gi mtshan nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rkyen gyis @192a * //
translated: Ultimately, the moments are different, so it has the characteristic of a moment that is a different nature from the sense consciousness. The observed object condition is

original: bskyed pa'i yid kyis ni don gzhan kho na rtogs so //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i yid kyis ni don gzhan kho na rtogs so //
translated: The mental consciousness that is the cause of the memory of the object is a different entity from the mental consciousness that perceives the object.

original: brda ni don gzhan sgra las tha dad pa dang sgra dag sbyor bar byed na /
analyzed: brda ni don gzhan sgra las tha dad pa dang sgra dag sbyor bar byed na /
translated: If a sign is a different entity from the object, and if the sign is connected to the word,

original: rang las gzhan pa'i yul cung zad kyang mi dmigs pas brda sbyor bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa'i yul cung zad kyang mi dmigs pas brda sbyor bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: then the sign cannot be connected to the word, because it does not perceive any object that is different from itself.

original: gal te rang rig pa ma 'ongs pa'i sgra'i yul du byed do zhe na /üîΩbde ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa rnams yul du bya ste yang dag par myong ba ni med de /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa ma 'ongs pa'i sgra'i yul du byed do zhe na / bde ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa rnams yul du bya ste yang dag par myong ba ni med de /
translated: If you say that the sign is the future object of the word,

original: rang myong ba de skyes pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir de yang med do //
analyzed: rang myong ba de skyes pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir de yang med do //
translated: then the sign would be the future object of the word, but the future object of the word is not a present object of experience, because it is not arisen.üîΩAnd the experience of the future object of the word is not the experience of the present object of experience, because the experience of the present object of experience is characterized by the present object of experience, and the future object of the word is not characterized by the present object of experience.

original: de ltar rang nyid las gzhan cung zad kyang mi rtogs pa de 'di rang nyid mngon par brjod pa dang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rang nyid las gzhan cung zad kyang mi rtogs pa de 'di rang nyid mngon par brjod pa dang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which does not perceive anything different from itself is not connected to the word.

original: cha shas su rtog pa med pas bdag nyid la brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas su rtog pa med pas bdag nyid la brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not conceived as a part, it is contradictory for it to be the basis of the activity of expression and the expressed.

original: gal te brda sbyor ba med kyang brda las byung ba'i sgras dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brda sbyor ba med kyang brda las byung ba'i sgras dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is perceived by a sound that arises from a sign even though there is no connection,

original: rang rig pa des rang de'i bdag rang gi mtshan nyid sngar ma mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang rig pa des rang de'i bdag rang gi mtshan nyid sngar ma mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: then that reflexive awareness would not have previously seen the self-character of that self.

original: brda las byung ba'i sgras ni sngon gyi de 'di'o zhes snga ma mthong ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda las byung ba'i sgras ni sngon gyi de 'di'o zhes snga ma mthong ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But a sound that arises from a sign would have previously seen it and would say, ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag nyid la sgra gdod sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid la sgra gdod sbyor zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sound is connected to the self,

original: mngon par brjod par gzo ba na gzo de nyid yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i dus na yul mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod par gzo ba na gzo de nyid yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i dus na yul mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then when the sound is produced, the object would not exist, because the one who produces the sound would be the one who is produced.

original: gal te shes pa phyi mas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa phyi mas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the subsequent consciousness,

original: rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then it would be another, because it is reflexive awareness.

original: snga ma rang gi mtshan nyid de tha snyad kyi dus na yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir brda don med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: snga ma rang gi mtshan nyid de tha snyad kyi dus na yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir brda don med pa yang yin no //
translated: The former, the intrinsic identity, does not occur even at the time of the conventional, so the signifier and the signified are nonexistent.

original: gzhan dag ni bye brag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bye brag pa'o //
translated: Others are the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: don gcig ni bdag nyid gcig la'o //
analyzed: don gcig ni bdag nyid gcig la'o //
translated: The same object is the same identity.

original: 'du ba shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa 'brel ba'i shes pas te bdag gcig gis so //
analyzed: 'du ba shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa 'brel ba'i shes pas te bdag gcig gis so //
translated: The cognition of the collection is the cognition of the connection of pleasure, etc., by the same self.

original: shes pa des bde ba la sogs pa myong bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa des bde ba la sogs pa myong bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That cognition experiences pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba nyid kyis myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba nyid kyis myong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that pleasure itself experiences.

original: rnam shes rgyu las gzhan min zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rnam shes rgyu las gzhan min zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúconsciousness is not different from its cause‚Äù means

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang dbang bo zhes bya ba dag yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang dbang bo zhes bya ba dag yin la /
translated: that the cause of consciousness is the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: de dag kho na las skyes pa bde ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kho na las skyes pa bde ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Since pleasure, etc. are produced from those alone, why are they not consciousness?

original: tshogs pa 'du ba la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa 'du ba la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are produced from the collection of causes.

original: 'dir nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dag mtshungs pa'i phyir ro @192b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dag mtshungs pa'i phyir ro @192b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the appropriating cause and the co-operating causes are similar.

original: gal te bud shing gi nye bar lan pa dang de'i lhan cig byed pa gcig las thal ba dang du ba dag mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag snang ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bud shing gi nye bar lan pa dang de'i lhan cig byed pa gcig las thal ba dang du ba dag mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag snang ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not certain that fire and fuel are the same, because it is seen that from the same fuel, ash and smoke arise with different characteristics,

original: de'i skyon med de /
analyzed: de'i skyon med de /
translated: we reply that this is not a fault.

original: du ba'i nye bar len pa ni bud shing gi chu'i khams yin la /
analyzed: du ba'i nye bar len pa ni bud shing gi chu'i khams yin la /
translated: The appropriating cause of smoke is the water element in fuel.

original: thal ba ni sa'i khams so//
analyzed: thal ba ni sa'i khams so//
translated: Ash is the earth element.

original: gal te bud shing gis thal ba dang / thal ba ma yin pa shing gi rang bzhin dag skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rigs tha dad pa yang skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bud shing gis thal ba dang / thal ba ma yin pa shing gi rang bzhin dag skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rigs tha dad pa yang skyed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that fire produces ash and non-ash, that is, fuel, which are different effects,

original: gang thal ba skyed pa de dag gis ni thal ba nyid skyed kyi shing ma yin no //
analyzed: gang thal ba skyed pa de dag gis ni thal ba nyid skyed kyi shing ma yin no //
translated: we reply that those things which produce ash produce ash, not fuel.

original: gang yang tshogs pa 'dra ba las ni 'dra bar dpag gi tshogs pa gcig la ni mi 'dra ba tshad mas grub pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gang yang tshogs pa 'dra ba las ni 'dra bar dpag gi tshogs pa gcig la ni mi 'dra ba tshad mas grub pa'i don yin no //
translated: But when the collection is similar, then the effect is similar.

original: de'i phyir mar me'i tshogs pa las rang gi rigs 'dra ba dang snying po tshig pa dang 'od dang sor mo la sogs pa sreg pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa dag srid la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mar me'i tshogs pa las rang gi rigs 'dra ba dang snying po tshig pa dang 'od dang sor mo la sogs pa sreg pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa dag srid la /
translated: Therefore, from the collection of a lamp, its own type, the burning of the wick, light, the burning of the fingers, etc., and the production of eye consciousness are possible.

original: de dang 'dra bar gzhan la yang de bzhin du mtshungs so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gzhan la yang de bzhin du mtshungs so //
translated: And in the same way, the other is similar.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa'i rigs mtshungs pa ni rgyu mtshungs pa'o //üîΩrgyu'i tshogs pa 'dra ba nyid las kyang 'bras bu mi 'dra bar 'gyur na ni sna tshogs kyi tha dad pa dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa'i rigs mtshungs pa ni rgyu mtshungs pa'o // rgyu'i tshogs pa 'dra ba nyid las kyang 'bras bu mi 'dra bar 'gyur na ni sna tshogs kyi tha dad pa dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the similarity of the collection is the similarity of the cause.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from the mere similarity of the collection of causes, then the differences of the various effects would be causeless.

original: gal te tshogs pa 'dra yang byas pa'i shugs zhes bya bas 'du shes kyi bye brag gi shes pa dang shes pa ma yin pa nges par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa 'dra yang byas pa'i shugs zhes bya bas 'du shes kyi bye brag gi shes pa dang shes pa ma yin pa nges par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: If, although the collection is similar, the effect is determined by the power of prior action, then consciousness and non-consciousness would be different due to the difference in the power of prior action.

original: byas pa'i shugs kyis nus pa tshad mas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i shugs kyis nus pa tshad mas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of the cause is not seen by valid cognition.

original: byas pa'i shugs kyang nye bar len pa la 'dod na ni gang gi goms pa'i bye brag can gyi rnam par shes pa nus pa can nyid yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: byas pa'i shugs kyang nye bar len pa la 'dod na ni gang gi goms pa'i bye brag can gyi rnam par shes pa nus pa can nyid yin par mthong ste /
translated: If you assert that the power of the cause is the appropriated aggregates, then you see that consciousness, which is the specific result of the cause, possesses power.

original: de'i phyir nang gi byed pa la brten pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi byed pa la brten pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said that ‚Äúthe internal states of pleasure and so on are based on internal activity.‚Äù

original: nang gi rnam par shes pa goms pas gsal ba la bde ba la sogs pa yang sgrin la /
analyzed: nang gi rnam par shes pa goms pas gsal ba la bde ba la sogs pa yang sgrin la /
translated: Because pleasure and so on are clear to the internal consciousness that is habituated to them, they are clear to the wise.

original: blun pa la ni blun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blun pa la ni blun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are unclear to the foolish, they appear unclear to the foolish.

original: gal te rgyu bye brag med pas 'bras bu yang mtshungs pa nyid na rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa yang bde ba'am sdug bsngal lam btang snyoms pa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu bye brag med pas 'bras bu yang mtshungs pa nyid na rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa yang bde ba'am sdug bsngal lam btang snyoms pa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the result is the same because the cause is undifferentiated, then because the cause is the same, pleasure and so on would be the same as pleasure, pain, or equanimity.

original: yul dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa nang gi bye brag bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yul dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa nang gi bye brag bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The internal distinctions of objects, mental activity, etc.

original: shes pa ma yin par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin par ni ma yin te /
translated: are pleasure, pain, etc., but not consciousness.

original: tshogs pa 'dra ba las skyes kyang /üîΩnang gi bye brag gis the tshom dang @193a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa 'dra ba las skyes kyang / nang gi bye brag gis the tshom dang @193a * //
translated: Even though they arise from similar collections,

original: gtan la phebs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag bzhin no //üîΩgzhan ni grangs can no bye brag pa dang sangs rgyas pa gnyi ga'i ltar nang gi yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gtan la phebs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag bzhin no // gzhan ni grangs can no bye brag pa dang sangs rgyas pa gnyi ga'i ltar nang gi yang ma yin la /
translated: internal distinctions are like the distinctions of consciousness, such as doubt and certainty.

original: sangs rgyas pa ltar sems pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ltar sems pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: The other, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, is neither internal nor, like the Buddhist, is it endowed with mind.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: grangs can rang gi bsam ba bstan pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid ni sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grangs can rang gi bsam ba bstan pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid ni sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To teach the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs own idea, he says, ‚ÄúSound, etc. are of the nature of pleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag gi 'don pa'i go rims ni rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna zhes bya ba yin bas de'i go rims pas yul yang dang por sgra smos te /üîΩreg bya la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'don pa'i go rims ni rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna zhes bya ba yin bas de'i go rims pas yul yang dang por sgra smos te / reg bya la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the order of the objects is sound, touch, form, taste, and smell.

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa yul gyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa yul gyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, pleasure, etc. are the nature of the objects.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / sems can yang yin rig bya'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems can yang yin rig bya'i phyir //
translated: because it is a sentient being and because it is to be known,

original: de bdag min pa rigs min phyir //
analyzed: de bdag min pa rigs min phyir //
translated: it is not reasonable that it is not the self.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni me'i bud shing sreg par byed kyang de'i nang du ma zhugs pa ni sreg pa med de me'i 'od kyi nang du chud pa kho na sreg go //üîΩde bzhin du shes pa yang rang gi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni me'i bud shing sreg par byed kyang de'i nang du ma zhugs pa ni sreg pa med de me'i 'od kyi nang du chud pa kho na sreg go // de bzhin du shes pa yang rang gi ngo bo'am /
translated: The intention here is that although fuel is burned by fire, that which is not included in the fire is not burned, for only that which is included in the light of the fire is burned.

original: rnam bar shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur na shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam bar shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur na shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, consciousness is known when it becomes the nature of itself or of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gang rang rig pa ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas shes par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang rang rig pa ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas shes par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which is reflexive awareness is known by its own nature alone.

original: gzhan ni rnam pa'i sgo nas yin pa'i phyir gang yul gyi rnam pa yang dag pa myong ba med pa de zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa'i sgo nas yin pa'i phyir gang yul gyi rnam pa yang dag pa myong ba med pa de zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The other is from the point of view of aspect. Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThat which does not experience the aspect of the object correctly.‚Äù

original: yul 'di'i shes pa 'di'o //
analyzed: yul 'di'i shes pa 'di'o //
translated: The cognition of this object is this.

original: gal te yul las skyes ba myong ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin na ni dbang po la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul las skyes ba myong ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin na ni dbang po la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cause of experience arises from the object, then it would follow that the sense faculty would also be the cause of experience.

original: sogs pas ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pas ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: grangs can pa dag ni sems yod pa ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: grangs can pa dag ni sems yod pa ni bdag yin la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the self is the existent mind.üîΩSince it is permanent, it is not tenable to say that it cognizes when it is similar and does not cognize when it is not.

original: de ni rtag pa nyid yin pas 'dra bar yod pa'i tshe ni rtogs la gzhan du mi rtogs so zhes bya bar mi rung ste 'dra ba'i sngon du 'dra ba med pa dang de 'dra ba'i dus su nyams pa dang phyis 'dra ba 'gags pa na nyams pa
analyzed: de ni rtag pa nyid yin pas 'dra bar yod pa'i tshe ni rtogs la gzhan du mi rtogs so zhes bya bar mi rung ste 'dra ba'i sngon du 'dra ba med pa dang de 'dra ba'i dus su nyams pa dang phyis 'dra ba 'gags pa na nyams pa
translated: If it is similar, it would be impermanent. If it is not similar, it would not be tenable to say that it cognizes.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the problem?

original: 'dra ba yod na mi rtag par 'gyur ba las skyon gzhan de 'dra ba med na shes par mi rung ba zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'dra ba yod na mi rtag par 'gyur ba las skyon gzhan de 'dra ba med na shes par mi rung ba zhes bya ba'o//
translated: If it is similar, it would be impermanent. If it is not similar, it would not be tenable to say that it cognizes.

original: gal te shes pa rnam pa med par 'dod pa dag rig pa yin pa'i phyir don shes pa yin gyi rnam pa yod pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa rnam pa med par 'dod pa dag rig pa yin pa'i phyir don shes pa yin gyi rnam pa yod pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that consciousness is without aspects, then it is the object that is cognized because it is the object that is known, not because of the existence of aspects.

original: rig pa yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rig pa yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The existence of consciousness alone,

original: rig ba tsam ni don thams cad la bye brag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig ba tsam ni don thams cad la bye brag med pa'i phyir /
translated: because consciousness alone is not differentiated with respect to all objects,

original: shes pa gcig gis don thams cad rig par thal bar @193b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig gis don thams cad rig par thal bar @193b 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that a single consciousness would cognize all objects.

original: 'dra ba yod na ni shes pa las 'dra ba yod pa'i don ni rtogs la med pa ni mi rtogs pa'i phyir thal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dra ba yod na ni shes pa las 'dra ba yod pa'i don ni rtogs la med pa ni mi rtogs pa'i phyir thal ba med do //
translated: If there were a similarity, then it would be the object that has the similarity to consciousness that is cognized, and that which does not have that similarity would not be cognized.

original: de ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin du ma grub ba ni rtogs par mi rung la /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin du ma grub ba ni rtogs par mi rung la /
translated: Thus, that which is not established as the nature of consciousness is not suitable to be cognized.

original: kho bo bde ba yang shes ba'i rang bzhin 'di nyid yin bas myong bar rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: kho bo bde ba yang shes ba'i rang bzhin 'di nyid yin bas myong bar rung ba nyid de /
translated: But since this very nature of consciousness is also pleasure, it is suitable to be experienced.

original: gang rje btsun sangs rgyas nyid kyis bde ba'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang rje btsun sangs rgyas nyid kyis bde ba'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: The venerable Buddha himself said, What is the feeling of pleasure?

original: myong ba phya le ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni sems can du grub po //
analyzed: myong ba phya le ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni sems can du grub po //
translated: Therefore, pleasure and so on are established as sentient beings.

original: gal te yul dang 'dra ba yul de yang dag bar myong ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul dang 'dra ba yul de yang dag bar myong ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If the object is similar to the object, it is the nature of the correct experience of that object.

original: bde ba la sogs ba dang 'dra ba yang dag bar myong bar 'gyur la bde ba la sogs pa ni sngon bo la sogs ba bzhin du yang dag par myong ba ma yin pa de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs ba dang 'dra ba yang dag bar myong bar 'gyur la bde ba la sogs pa ni sngon bo la sogs ba bzhin du yang dag par myong ba ma yin pa de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If pleasure and so on are similar, they would be the correct experience, but pleasure and so on are not the correct experience of blue and so on, so they would be the nature of that.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúNo‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa'i ngo bor ma gyur pa myong bar mi rung ba'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa yod na de shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yang dag bar myong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bor ma gyur pa myong bar mi rung ba'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa yod na de shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yang dag bar myong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du ste /
translated: Since that which is not the nature of consciousness is not suitable to be experienced, when pleasure and so on exist, they are the nature of the correct experience of consciousness. This is stated to teach that

original: gang myong ba yod pa de la de 'dra ba'i phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes smra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang myong ba yod pa de la de 'dra ba'i phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes smra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not said that when experience exists, an external object like that exists.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation of that is:

original: de la yang dag par myong ba nyid ni gcig tu nang gi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i bdag nyid yin par blta ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la yang dag par myong ba nyid ni gcig tu nang gi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i bdag nyid yin par blta ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The experience of that is seen to be of the nature of internal pleasure and pain.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is because of the reasoning that will be explained.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: That is as follows.

original: bde ba la sogs ba 'di myong ba'i bdag nyid 'di gzhan phyi rol gyis gzhag par mi rigs te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs ba 'di myong ba'i bdag nyid 'di gzhan phyi rol gyis gzhag par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc. is established by something external,

original: phyi rol gyi de'i bye brag med kyang srog chags kyi rang bzhin dang / goms pa'i bye brag las bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi bye brag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi de'i bye brag med kyang srog chags kyi rang bzhin dang / goms pa'i bye brag las bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi bye brag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though there is no external difference in that, the difference in the nature of pleasure, etc. is established from the difference in the nature of the living being and the difference in habit.

original: ro'i bye brag gcig nyid srog chags kha cig gi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: ro'i bye brag gcig nyid srog chags kha cig gi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: The difference in taste is the cause of pleasure for some living beings,

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but for others it is the cause of pain, etc.

original: gal te blo zhes bya ba rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te blo zhes bya ba rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin par 'dod de /
translated: If you assert that what is called mind is not of the nature of awareness,

original: de bde ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan gyi yang dag par myong ba ni shes pa nyid du bsams pa ste /
analyzed: de bde ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan gyi yang dag par myong ba ni shes pa nyid du bsams pa ste /
translated: It is the consciousness itself that is considered to possess the specific attributes of pleasure, etc.

original: de ni bde ba la sogs pa bye brag dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni bde ba la sogs pa bye brag dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that the specific attributes of pleasure, etc.

original: blo ni yul gyi rnam ba can te /
analyzed: blo ni yul gyi rnam ba can te /
translated: are not the object of consciousness.

original: gal te yang dag par myong ba ma yin ba'o //üîΩgzhan don yang dag par myong ba ni myong ba'o zhe na /üîΩ'dra ba gzhan shel la yod pa'i 'dra bdag la blo der 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang dag par myong ba ma yin ba'o // gzhan don yang dag par myong ba ni myong ba'o zhe na / 'dra ba gzhan shel la yod pa'i 'dra bdag la blo der 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is not the object of consciousness,

original: yang @194a * //
analyzed: yang @194a * //
translated: then it is not the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.

original: dag par myong ba med pa nyid shel 'dra ba dang blo 'dra ba dag gi bye brag yod na ni smros shig / gal te shel ni phyi yin la blo ni nang gi byed pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dag par myong ba med pa nyid shel 'dra ba dang blo 'dra ba dag gi bye brag yod na ni smros shig / gal te shel ni phyi yin la blo ni nang gi byed pa nyid yin pas /
translated: If it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.

original: de nyid bye brag de'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: de nyid bye brag de'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na'o //
translated: If it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.

original: de yang blo'i bye brag rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩyan lag tu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang blo'i bye brag rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩyan lag tu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: If it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness, then it is the object of consciousness.üîΩIf it is the object of consciousness,

original: ji ltar yan lag ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not a part?üîΩIt is the nature of clarity, etc.

original: shin tu dang ba'i rang bzhin dang / sogs ba'i sgras nang gi byed pa bzung ste /
analyzed: shin tu dang ba'i rang bzhin dang / sogs ba'i sgras nang gi byed pa bzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the internal faculties.

original: de lta bu gzhan mig la sogs pa yod pas de dag kyang blo'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu gzhan mig la sogs pa yod pas de dag kyang blo'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they exist, it follows that the eye, etc. are also of the nature of cognition.

original: yul gyi rnam bar gzhag pa yang dag par myong ba la brten pa ste /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam bar gzhag pa yang dag par myong ba la brten pa ste /
translated: The determination of the object is based on the experience of the object.

original: de la ltos pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de la ltos pa yin na'o //
translated: It depends on that.

original: blo de sems pa med pa la yul med pa'i phyir ji ltar de las don gyi rnam par gzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo de sems pa med pa la yul med pa'i phyir ji ltar de las don gyi rnam par gzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the object does not exist for the cognition that is without thought, how can the determination of the object occur from that?

original: de lta na 'dra ba tsam gyi phyir sngon po nyid sngon po'i yul dang / bum pa yang bum ba'i yul nyid du ha cang yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'dra ba tsam gyi phyir sngon po nyid sngon po'i yul dang / bum pa yang bum ba'i yul nyid du ha cang yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow, absurdly, that blue itself would be the object of blue and that a pot would be the object of a pot, because they are similar.

original: gal te sgra'i don gcig la yang srog chags dang goms pa'i bye brag gis bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa dag la 'gal ba med de sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid phyi'i bde ba la sogs pa bye brag med kyang blo'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba
analyzed: gal te sgra'i don gcig la yang srog chags dang goms pa'i bye brag gis bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa dag la 'gal ba med de sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid phyi'i bde ba la sogs pa bye brag med kyang blo'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba
translated: If you say that there is no contradiction in the fact that the one object of a word is pleasure, etc., because of the differences of the living beings who are accustomed to it, then the pleasure, etc.,

original: la sogs pa ni bye brag can du skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: la sogs pa ni bye brag can du skye'o zhe na /
translated: of the external nature of sound, etc., are not differentiated, but the pleasure, etc., of the nature of the mind are born with a difference.

original: blo'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the pleasure, etc., of the nature of the mind, etc.,

original: bde ba la sogs pa phyi'i bdag nyid gcig la goms pa la sogs pas gcig par gzhan du 'gyur ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa phyi'i bdag nyid gcig la goms pa la sogs pas gcig par gzhan du 'gyur ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are one, because of the difference of the living beings who are accustomed to them, then it is contradictory that they become one in another way.

original: sems pa can las gzhan du yul gyi bdag nyid kyang ma yin pa bde ba la sogs ba'i rnam pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: sems pa can las gzhan du yul gyi bdag nyid kyang ma yin pa bde ba la sogs ba'i rnam pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: There is no such thing as a cognition that has the difference of the aspects of pleasure, etc., and that is not of the nature of a living being, nor is it of the nature of an external object.

original: sems pa can de'i bdag nyid log pa la /
analyzed: sems pa can de'i bdag nyid log pa la /
translated: When the nature of that living being is destroyed,

original: blo'i mtshan nyid yul 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i mtshan nyid yul 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the characteristic of cognition, the apprehension of an object, is not perceived.

original: de lta bas na yul myong ba ni gcig ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na yul myong ba ni gcig ste /
translated: Thus, the experience of the object is one.

original: blo dang yang dag par myong ba zhes bya ba gnyis ni med de yang dag bar myong ba gcig pu'o /
analyzed: blo dang yang dag par myong ba zhes bya ba gnyis ni med de yang dag bar myong ba gcig pu'o /
translated: There is no second, called ‚Äúcognition‚Äù or ‚Äúexperience.‚Äù There is only the experience.

original: rangs pa dang ma rangs pa ni yang dag par myong ba de nyid kyi bye brag tu rnam par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rangs pa dang ma rangs pa ni yang dag par myong ba de nyid kyi bye brag tu rnam par 'jug ste /
translated: The distinction between pleasure and displeasure is a particular mode of the experience itself.

original: bye brag gi rang bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi rang bzhin du blta'o //
translated: It is to be regarded as a particular nature.

original: yang dag bar myong ba de la ming ni blo dang shes pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'dod pas byed do //
analyzed: yang dag bar myong ba de la ming ni blo dang shes pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'dod pas byed do //
translated: The name ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is given to it by the wish to call it ‚Äúcognition,‚Äù ‚Äúconsciousness,‚Äù and so on.

original: yul nye bar longs spyod pa ni skyes bu shes pa yod pa nyid yin na /üîΩyul @194b nye bar longs spyod pa shes pa nyid mngon sum ma yin na'o //
analyzed: yul nye bar longs spyod pa ni skyes bu shes pa yod pa nyid yin na / yul @194b nye bar longs spyod pa shes pa nyid mngon sum ma yin na'o //
translated: If the experience of the object is the existence of consciousness,üîΩthe experience of the object is not direct perception.

original: yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin yang /
analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin yang /
translated: Even if the consciousness that experiences the object is not direct perception,

original: yul nye bar longs spyod pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: yul nye bar longs spyod pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: it is the experience of the object.

original: yul yod pa nyid tsam gyis yul longs spyod bar yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul yod pa nyid tsam gyis yul longs spyod bar yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows, absurdly, that the mere existence of the object is the experience of the object.

original: shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir yul de nyams su myong bas longs spyod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir yul de nyams su myong bas longs spyod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since consciousness is not direct perception, it does not experience the object by experiencing it.

original: yul nyams su myong ba yod kyang nyams su myong ba grub pa'i phyir yul dang nyams su myong ba dag med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba yod kyang nyams su myong ba grub pa'i phyir yul dang nyams su myong ba dag med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there is experience of the object, it is not established that there is experience, because there is no difference between the nonexistence of the object and experience.

original: gal te blo las myong ba dpag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag bas longs spyod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo las myong ba dpag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag bas longs spyod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that one experiences it by inference, because experience is inferred from the mind,

original: rtags las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rtags las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe reason is not established.‚Äù

original: sngar dbang po'i mngon sum ma yin pa la 'brel pa gzung ba med do zhes ji skad smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar dbang po'i mngon sum ma yin pa la 'brel pa gzung ba med do zhes ji skad smos pa bzhin no //
translated: As was said earlier, ‚ÄúThere is no apprehension of a connection in what is not the sense direct perception.‚Äù

original: gal te blo kho nas yul nye bar longs spyod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo kho nas yul nye bar longs spyod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind alone experiences the object,

original: yul la mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul la mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe object is not apprehended directly.‚Äù

original: blo yul mngon sum du dmigs pas yul rtogs pa'i tha snyad ma tshang ba med pa'i rdzogs pas na blo las gzhan pa shes pa yod pa brtag pa'i don med do //
analyzed: blo yul mngon sum du dmigs pas yul rtogs pa'i tha snyad ma tshang ba med pa'i rdzogs pas na blo las gzhan pa shes pa yod pa brtag pa'i don med do //
translated: Since the mind directly observes the object, the convention of ‚Äúrealizing the object‚Äù is complete without any deficiency. Therefore, it is meaningless to investigate whether there is a consciousness that is different from the mind.

original: shes pa yod pa de yang yul mngon sum du byed pa nyid du blo dang bdag nyid gcig par tshad mas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa de yang yul mngon sum du byed pa nyid du blo dang bdag nyid gcig par tshad mas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that consciousness exists because valid knowledge sees that it is the same nature as the mind that directly perceives the object.

original: gal te blo dang shes pa dag tha dad kyang 'dres pas rnam par dbye mi shes te /
analyzed: gal te blo dang shes pa dag tha dad kyang 'dres pas rnam par dbye mi shes te /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúAlthough the mind and consciousness are different, they are mixed and cannot be distinguished.

original: lcags gong me bzhin du de cir 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: lcags gong me bzhin du de cir 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Like a lump of iron, what is it?‚Äù

original: me nyid du 'dzin te reg pa na me 'di'i bdag nyid mngon par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me nyid du 'dzin te reg pa na me 'di'i bdag nyid mngon par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is apprehended as fire because when it is touched, the nature of that fire manifests.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad par snang ba yang gcig la bye brag mi mngon yang tha dad pa nyid 'dres pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod par khas len na ni /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad par snang ba yang gcig la bye brag mi mngon yang tha dad pa nyid 'dres pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod par khas len na ni /
translated: If you accept that although pleasure and so on and blue and so on appear to be different, they are not different in one thing, but that they exist as a nature that is a mixture of difference,

original: de lta na ni dngos kun la //
analyzed: de lta na ni dngos kun la //
translated: then in that case, all thingsüîΩwould be one.
