original: tha dad tha dad min gzhag nyams te don gcig tu dmigs pa rnams la 'dres par rang bzhin gzhan the tshom za ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir dang / sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tha dad par dmigs kyang bde ba la sogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi bdag nyid du 'dod pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad min gzhag nyams te don gcig tu dmigs pa rnams la 'dres par rang bzhin gzhan the tshom za ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir dang / sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tha dad par dmigs kyang bde ba la sogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi bdag nyid du 'dod pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although aspects such as blue and pleasure are observed as different, pleasure and so on are not different because they are asserted to be of the nature of external objects such as blue.

original: tha dad min par shes pas rig pa dang ni gcig nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad min par shes pas rig pa dang ni gcig nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Consciousness is said to be the same as cognition.

original: gcig nyid du shes pa de ltar gang min te du ma @195a * //
analyzed: gcig nyid du shes pa de ltar gang min te du ma @195a * //
translated: It is not that it is not the same as the consciousness that cognizes many.

original: shes pas rig pa de ni mtshan nyid tha dad can du 'grub po //
analyzed: shes pas rig pa de ni mtshan nyid tha dad can du 'grub po //
translated: The consciousness that cognizes many is established as having different characteristics.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i shes pas rig pa 'di tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid yin na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i shes pas rig pa 'di tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid yin na /
translated: If consciousness is the cause of positing difference and nondifference,

original: tha dad pa grub byed mi 'grub bo ste tha mi dad pa yang de bzhin no zhes skabs kyis rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: tha dad pa grub byed mi 'grub bo ste tha mi dad pa yang de bzhin no zhes skabs kyis rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: The establishment of difference is not established, and the non-difference is also like that. This should be understood according to the context.

original: / de nyid rgyas par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / de nyid rgyas par bstan pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation of that is:

original: dkar dang sdug bsngal sogs /
analyzed: dkar dang sdug bsngal sogs /
translated: White, suffering, etc.

original: tha dad par rig pa dang phyi rol nyid gcig tu khas len cing /
analyzed: tha dad par rig pa dang phyi rol nyid gcig tu khas len cing /
translated: You accept that cognition is different, and external things are accepted as one.

original: blo dang myong ba dag yul gcig tu rang rig pa'i tshad mas grub pa dang ni tha dad par khas len ce na'o //
analyzed: blo dang myong ba dag yul gcig tu rang rig pa'i tshad mas grub pa dang ni tha dad par khas len ce na'o //
translated: You accept that cognition and experience are established by the valid cognition of reflexive awareness as one, and different.

original: me dang 'brel pa las 'bar ba zhes bya ba don gzhan skyes pas so //
analyzed: me dang 'brel pa las 'bar ba zhes bya ba don gzhan skyes pas so //
translated: Because of the arising of a different object called ‚Äúburning‚Äù due to the connection with fire.

original: blo'i tha dad par rig pa ni tha dad par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: blo'i tha dad par rig pa ni tha dad par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of the difference of cognition is the cause of positing difference. Therefore,

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang yang dag par myong ba dag dkar po la sogs pa rigs pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang yang dag par myong ba dag dkar po la sogs pa rigs pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable that pleasure, etc. and correct experience are different from white, etc.

original: de la yang dag par myong ba ni blo ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par myong ba ni blo ste /
translated: Moreover, correct experience is cognition,

original: myong ba dang gcig tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba dang gcig tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen as one with experience.

original: kha cig ni bde ba la sogs pa dag nang yang yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni bde ba la sogs pa dag nang yang yin la /
translated: Some say: Pleasure and so on are internal.üîΩ

original: sems ba can yang yin no zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: sems ba can yang yin no zhes 'dod de /
translated: Some believe that pleasure, etc. are internal and mental.

original: de dag gi ltar na ni rtogs par zad do //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na ni rtogs par zad do //
translated: But in that case, they are simply conceptual.

original: gang zhig gang goms par byed pa de ni goms pa yongs su rdzogs pa las de la de gsal bar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang goms par byed pa de ni goms pa yongs su rdzogs pa las de la de gsal bar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is thoroughly habituated to something, it appears clearly to him,

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa goms par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa goms par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: as, for example, fear, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'ga' zhig kyang thos pas bzung ba'i don rig pas bsams pas don rnam par gzhag pa goms par byed do zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi rtags so //üîΩgsal ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtogs la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'ga' zhig kyang thos pas bzung ba'i don rig pas bsams pas don rnam par gzhag pa goms par byed do zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi rtags so // gsal ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtogs la /
translated: The logical mark of this is the fact that some yogis, by reflecting with their intellect on the meaning of what they have learned, become habituated to the presentation of the meaning.

original: rigs pas gzhag pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir slu ba med pa dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pas gzhag pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir slu ba med pa dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te /
translated: It is non-deceptive and a direct perception because it is clear.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma gzhan grags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma gzhan grags pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a direct perception that is accepted by others.

original: 'dod pa yid la byed pa goms pas ni ji ltar rgyal po'i shing rta bcu pa'i bu dga' byed kyis rol rnyed ma yid la byas ba na /
analyzed: 'dod pa yid la byed pa goms pas ni ji ltar rgyal po'i shing rta bcu pa'i bu dga' byed kyis rol rnyed ma yid la byas ba na /
translated: For example, when the son of King Dashaharana, Nanda, thought of Panchashikha,

original: bdag gis de mthong /
analyzed: bdag gis de mthong /
translated: he saw her.

original: 'di na mdun dang rgyab dag tu /
analyzed: 'di na mdun dang rgyab dag tu /
translated: In front, behind,

original: nang dang phyi dang yongs su bskor dang rnam par 'gyur bar ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang yongs su bskor dang rnam par 'gyur bar ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: inside and outside, and all around, she was transformed.

original: mya ngan gyi rgyal po'i btsun mo dri za mas rang gi bu rnams mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi rgyal po'i btsun mo dri za mas rang gi bu rnams mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: Or, like the gandharva queen, who, in her grief, saw her sons.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par dpe brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par dpe brjod par bya'o //
translated: And so on for fear and so forth.

original: yid la rnam bar rtog pa yin pa'i phyir de dag @195b lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yid la rnam bar rtog pa yin pa'i phyir de dag @195b lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But they are not directly perceived, because they are mental images.

original: myur ba dang nan tan byed ba rab thob phyir /üîΩlkog tu gyur par 'du shes la de lta'o ste myur ba dang nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: myur ba dang nan tan byed ba rab thob phyir / lkog tu gyur par 'du shes la de lta'o ste myur ba dang nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: Because of the speed and the intensity of the thought,üîΩone thinks that they are hidden, but it is not so.

original: de yang ji ltar dga' byed sems nyid lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar dga' byed sems nyid lta bu ste /
translated: For example, Nanda thought that Panchashikha was in his mind.

original: snum ba'i sngo bsangs sdug gus byugs ba'i mkha' la sprin tshogs gseb na chu skyar rtse ba dang // rlung gis bskyod ba'i chu yi thigs pa chu 'dzin mdza' bo dag pas yid 'od sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: snum ba'i sngo bsangs sdug gus byugs ba'i mkha' la sprin tshogs gseb na chu skyar rtse ba dang // rlung gis bskyod ba'i chu yi thigs pa chu 'dzin mdza' bo dag pas yid 'od sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: In the sky anointed with the lovely blue of the oil, the cranes play in the midst of the clouds, and the drops of water shaken by the wind, which are like the pure friends of the clouds, make a pleasant sound.

original: 'dod par gyur pa dag ni brtan zhing sra ba'i snying gis dga' byed ba dag gis thams cad bzod //üîΩlus can ma ni ji ltar gyur na snyam du de ltar yid la byas bas mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: 'dod par gyur pa dag ni brtan zhing sra ba'i snying gis dga' byed ba dag gis thams cad bzod // lus can ma ni ji ltar gyur na snyam du de ltar yid la byas bas mthong gyur nas //
translated: Those who are in love, with their hearts firm and strong, endure all things with joy.üîΩBut when the woman is not like that, what can be done?

original: ae ma'o kyi hud lha mo bstan par gyis zhes myur du smra ba dang nan byed pa la sogs pa lta bu'i 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ae ma'o kyi hud lha mo bstan par gyis zhes myur du smra ba dang nan byed pa la sogs pa lta bu'i 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thinking thus, he sees her in that way, and does not see her as before, with the words Alas! Alas! Show me the goddess! Quickly! Forcefully! and so on.

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya bas ni sngar ma bshad pa cung zad rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya bas ni sngar ma bshad pa cung zad rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The verse in the middle is called a little elaboration of what was not explained before.

original: de ltar 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i dpe dag bsnyad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i dpe dag bsnyad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the examples well known in the world,

original: bstan bcos la grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos la grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach those well known in the treatises,üîΩhe says:

original: de ltar mi gtsang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar mi gtsang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it says, ‚Äúin this way, the impure, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de bslad pa'i blo dag kyang rung mngon par brjod pa dang 'dre ba'i shes pa thams cad la don gsal bar snang ba mi gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de bslad pa'i blo dag kyang rung mngon par brjod pa dang 'dre ba'i shes pa thams cad la don gsal bar snang ba mi gnas pa nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of things. Even for those with adulterated minds, in all cognitions that are mixed with verbal expressions, the appearance of the object as clear is not tenable.

original: dran bya ni gsal bar snang ngo de dran par byed pas te /
analyzed: dran bya ni gsal bar snang ngo de dran par byed pas te /
translated: The object of memory is the clear appearance. It is remembered because it is remembered.

original: de nyid la dran par byed pa'i shes ba la ni don de mi gsal bas don mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid la dran par byed pa'i shes ba la ni don de mi gsal bas don mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: In the cognition that remembers that, the object is not clear, so it is a different object.

original: bslad pa na yang bslad pa'am ma bslad pa'i gnas skabs na nyams su myong ba de dran pa na bslad pa na'ang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: bslad pa na yang bslad pa'am ma bslad pa'i gnas skabs na nyams su myong ba de dran pa na bslad pa na'ang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: Even when adulterated, when the experience is remembered in the state of being adulterated or unadulterated, the adulteration arises in the conceptual cognition.

original: nyams su myong ba de gsal bar snang ba ltar dran pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de gsal bar snang ba ltar dran pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the memory is of the experience as it appears clearly.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis mngon sum mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang bral ba tsam zhig gsungs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis mngon sum mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang bral ba tsam zhig gsungs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] taught that direct perception is merely free from conceptuality.

original: 'dir mi 'khrul ba sngar bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir mi 'khrul ba sngar bstan la /
translated: Here, non-deception was taught earlier,

original: slob dpon gyis kyang mi 'khrul ba nyid bzhed do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang mi 'khrul ba nyid bzhed do //
translated: and the master [DignƒÅga] also accepts non-deception.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩDeceptive, conventional knowledge,

original: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // rjes dpag rjes su dpag pa can //
analyzed: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // rjes dpag rjes su dpag pa can //
translated: Inference, and that which possesses inference,

original: dran dang sngon 'dod zhes bya ba //
analyzed: dran dang sngon 'dod zhes bya ba //
translated: Memory, and desire for the past‚Äî

original: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
translated: These are like direct perception, but with obscuration.

original: zhes 'khrul pa dag mngon sum ltar snang ba nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩslu ba la tshad ma nyid med la mngon sum tshad @196a * //
analyzed: zhes 'khrul pa dag mngon sum ltar snang ba nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro // slu ba la tshad ma nyid med la mngon sum tshad @196a * //
translated: Thus, it is said that deceptive [cognitions] are like direct perception.

original: ma nyid yin par bstan pas rtogs par nus pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa gcig bus mngon sum ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ma nyid yin par bstan pas rtogs par nus pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa gcig bus mngon sum ston par mdzad do //
translated: Since it can be understood through the teaching that direct perception is valid cognition and that there is no validity in deception, [DignƒÅga] taught direct perception merely with the word ‚Äúnon-conceptual.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar / dngos po mi 'dzin phyir rnam rtog / mngon sum ltar snang zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po mi 'dzin phyir rnam rtog / mngon sum ltar snang zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Thus, because it does not apprehend an entity, it is a conceptual cognition. The phrase ‚Äúlike a direct perception‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: slu bar byed pa'i phyir 'khrul pa mngon sum ltar snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slu bar byed pa'i phyir 'khrul pa mngon sum ltar snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is deceptive, it is a deceptive direct perception.

original: dbang skyes kyang zhes bya bas ni rtog pa med kyang mngon sum ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbang skyes kyang zhes bya bas ni rtog pa med kyang mngon sum ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though it arises from the sense faculties‚Äù indicates that even though it is nonconceptual, it is not a direct perception.

original: de la gzhan las khyad med phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan las khyad med phyir /
translated: Because it is not different from the other,

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i bslad pa gang zhig bslad pa de las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa ma bslad pa las bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i bslad pa gang zhig bslad pa de las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa ma bslad pa las bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is a deceptive cognition that arises from the sense faculties. It is not different from the other, that is, from a nondeceptive cognition that arises from the sense faculties.

original: dbang po las skyes pa nyid du bstan par bzhed ba de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa rnams ston pa na dran dang mngon brjod ces bya bas bar du bcad nas 'khrul pa dang rab rib zla ba gnyis su snang ba dag bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa nyid du bstan par bzhed ba de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa rnams ston pa na dran dang mngon brjod ces bya bas bar du bcad nas 'khrul pa dang rab rib zla ba gnyis su snang ba dag bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The reason why he wishes to show that it arises from the sense faculties is that he wants to show that it is a deceptive cognition. Therefore, in order to show that it is a deceptive cognition, he says, ‚Äúmemory, verbal expression,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni dbang po las skyes pa yin zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas par 'khrul pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po las skyes pa yin zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas par 'khrul pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to show that error is qualified by the phrase ‚Äúarising from the senses.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos kyi phyogs gzhan du slob dpon gyis mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams 'khrul pa zla ba gnyis par snang ba dang / ma 'khrul pa sngon por snang ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi phyogs gzhan du slob dpon gyis mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams 'khrul pa zla ba gnyis par snang ba dang / ma 'khrul pa sngon por snang ba'i dpe'o //
translated: In other parts of the treatise, the master [DignƒÅga] uses the example of the appearance of two moons as an instance of error and the appearance of blue as an instance of nonerror.

original: de ltar mngon sum gyi rab tu dbye ba bshad nas tshad ma'i 'bras bu'i rab tu byed pa bshad par rtsom ste /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyi rab tu dbye ba bshad nas tshad ma'i 'bras bu'i rab tu byed pa bshad par rtsom ste /
translated: Having explained the divisions of perception, he begins the exposition of the results of valid cognition.

original: yul brtag pa ni sngar mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag gi dbye bas kyang bstan la /
analyzed: yul brtag pa ni sngar mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag gi dbye bas kyang bstan la /
translated: The examination of objects was presented earlier in the division of perception and inference.

original: le'u gnyis pa nas kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa nas kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will also be presented in chapter 2.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma spyi'i rab tu byed pa dang mngon sum gyi rab tu byed pa dag bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma spyi'i rab tu byed pa dang mngon sum gyi rab tu byed pa dag bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the exposition of valid cognition in general and the exposition of perception.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid gang las tshad ma 'di'i gzhal bar bya ba rtogs pa dang bar chad med ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid gang las tshad ma 'di'i gzhal bar bya ba rtogs pa dang bar chad med ba ste /
translated: The definition of valid cognition is: that from which there is the realization of the object of comprehension and the absence of obstruction.

original: tshad ma gang yod ba tsam gyis gzhal par bya ba rtogs pa de nyid 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma gang yod ba tsam gyis gzhal par bya ba rtogs pa de nyid 'thob pa'o //
translated: The mere existence of valid cognition is the attainment of the realization of the object of comprehension.

original: de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúin regard to that,‚Äù

original: tshad ma zhes bya bstan pa de la'o //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya bstan pa de la'o //
translated: in regard to the teaching called ‚Äúvalid cognition.‚Äù

original: 'di ni sngon po rtogs ba'o zhes don dang shes pa dag so sor nges pa'i 'brel pa byed ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po rtogs ba'o zhes don dang shes pa dag so sor nges pa'i 'brel pa byed ba'o //
translated: This is the connection of the definite relation of the object and the cognition, ‚ÄúThis is the realization of blue.‚Äù

original: gal te dbang po dang rtags dag kyang rtogs par byed pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po dang rtags dag kyang rtogs par byed pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúAren‚Äôt the sense faculties and the signs also that which causes realization?‚Äù

original: bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of accomplishing the action,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma nyid ni byed pa'i don nyid yin na gang la bya ba dang / gang las 'ongs pa dang gang gi phyir zhes @196b bya ba kun kyang bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid yin mod kyi byed pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni byed pa'i don nyid yin na gang la bya ba dang / gang las 'ongs pa dang gang gi phyir zhes @196b bya ba kun kyang bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid yin mod kyi byed pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If valid knowledge itself is the meaning of action, then all actions such as what is acted upon, what it comes from, and for what purpose are indeed established as action, but they are not action itself.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu gang byed pa gang yod pa tsam las yin pa de byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu gang byed pa gang yod pa tsam las yin pa de byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, if an effect exists merely due to the existence of an action, then that is action itself.

original: de ltar na dbang po la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis gzhal bar bya ba rtogs pa mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis gzhal bar bya ba rtogs pa mi 'grub kyi /
translated: Thus, mere existence of the sense faculties, etc. does not establish the understanding of the object to be cognized.

original: don dang 'dra ba gang yod pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba gang yod pa tsam gyis so //
translated: It is merely due to the existence of what is similar to the object.

original: gal te 'dra ba med kyang don rig pa nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med kyang don rig pa nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says that even without similarity, the mere awareness of the object is valid knowledge,

original: nyams su myong ba tsam ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam ni zhes smos te /
translated: then it is said that mere experience is not valid knowledge.

original: don ni don gang dang yang yul dang yul can nyid du 'brel ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don ni don gang dang yang yul dang yul can nyid du 'brel ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The object is similar in that there is no reason for a connection as object and subject.

original: las dang byed pa'i rang bzhin gzhag par mi rung bas don dang 'dra ba gang yang yul 'di'i shes pa 'di'o zhes 'dra ba des yul dang yul can so sor nges pa'i las dang byed pa rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: las dang byed pa'i rang bzhin gzhag par mi rung bas don dang 'dra ba gang yang yul 'di'i shes pa 'di'o zhes 'dra ba des yul dang yul can so sor nges pa'i las dang byed pa rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Since it is not tenable to posit the nature of the object and agent, it is impossible to ascertain the object and subject separately by means of the similarity, ‚ÄúThis consciousness is of this object.‚Äù

original: de yang don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it would be the nature of the realization of the object.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni don la lta ba dang / bye brag tu byed pa'i shes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni don la lta ba dang / bye brag tu byed pa'i shes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the view of the object, the consciousness that makes distinctions, and so on.

original: de dag yod kyang shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i las de yul de dag gis shas pa'i bdag nyad las gzhan la yin pa don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bya ba'i bye brag 'di sngon po rtogs pa nyid do zhes nges par nus pa ma yin noüîΩ// tshad ma ni byed pa po'i don nyid kyis yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag yod kyang shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i las de yul de dag gis shas pa'i bdag nyad las gzhan la yin pa don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bya ba'i bye brag 'di sngon po rtogs pa nyid do zhes nges par nus pa ma yin no // tshad ma ni byed pa po'i don nyid kyis yin zhing /
translated: Even if they exist, it is impossible to ascertain the difference between the object and the agent, which is consciousness, by means of the similarity, ‚ÄúThis is the realization of blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe object is the cause of the action of the agent.

original: byed pa po'i yang bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis byed pa po'i de kho na nyid yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po'i yang bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis byed pa po'i de kho na nyid yin la /
translated: The object is the cause of the action of the agent.

original: dbang po la sogs pa shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de las kyang shes pa 'dis sngon po rtogs so zhes bya ba de'i bye brag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de las kyang shes pa 'dis sngon po rtogs so zhes bya ba de'i bye brag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And from that which is not the nature of consciousness, such as the sense faculties, this consciousness does not establish a distinction, such as ‚ÄúIt cognizes blue.‚Äù

original: gal te de'i bye brag med kyang dbang po la sogs pa las shes pa gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bye brag med kyang dbang po la sogs pa las shes pa gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag yod do zhe na /
translated: If, although there is no distinction in that, there is a distinction in the clarity, etc., of consciousness from the sense faculties, etc.,

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag yod kyang las dang byed pa'i yan lag ma yin pas na shes pa des byed pa po'i 'grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag yod kyang las dang byed pa'i yan lag ma yin pas na shes pa des byed pa po'i 'grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: then, although there is a distinction in clarity, etc., since it is not a part of the action, the agent is not established by that consciousness. Therefore, those are not valid cognitions.

original: yul 'di shes pa 'di'i las su nges par 'grub par byed pa de tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul 'di shes pa 'di'i las su nges par 'grub par byed pa de tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: That which establishes the ascertainment that this object is the object of this consciousness is a valid cognition.

original: de yang gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na ;
translated: What is that?

original: shes pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shes pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is stated: ‚Äúconsciousness that is in accordance with its object.‚Äù

original: don dang 'dra ba 'di las gzhan mi srid de /
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba 'di las gzhan mi srid de /
translated: This is impossible to be anything other than in accordance with the object,

original: don dang mi 'dra na de rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang mi 'dra na de rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is not in accordance with the object, it is not suitable to cognize it.

original: gal te dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang gis shes pa gsal ba la sogs pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang gis shes pa gsal ba la sogs pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that consciousness is clear, etc. due to the influence of the sense faculties, etc.,

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i g-yeng ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa @197a * //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i g-yeng ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa @197a * //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe distraction of the sense faculties, etc.‚Äù

original: smos so // dbang po la sogs pa de don 'di'i rtogs pa ni 'di'o zhes las dang byed pa'i 'brel pa 'grub pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: smos so // dbang po la sogs pa de don 'di'i rtogs pa ni 'di'o zhes las dang byed pa'i 'brel pa 'grub pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i rgyu med pa'o //
translated: The connection between the action and the agent is not established, because the sense faculties, etc. are not the cause of the realization of the object.

original: gal te rnam pa med par smra ba dag don gyi rnam pa med kyang don gyi bye brag gis byas pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa med par smra ba dag don gyi rnam pa med kyang don gyi bye brag gis byas pa ste /
translated: If the Proponents of Non-Feature assert that although there is no feature of the object, the distinction of the object is made by the distinction of the nature of the consciousness produced by the object,

original: bskyed pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag las las dang byed pa'i 'brel ba 'di rtogs kyi 'dra ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag las las dang byed pa'i 'brel ba 'di rtogs kyi 'dra ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: the connection between the action and the agent is realized from that, and not from a similarity.

original: ci ste shes pa'i bye brag de'i mtshan nyid mi ston te bstan par byos shig / gal te myong pa'i bye brag de 'di'o zhes bstan par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa'i bye brag de'i mtshan nyid mi ston te bstan par byos shig / gal te myong pa'i bye brag de 'di'o zhes bstan par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If the distinction of consciousness is not taught, its characteristics should be taught. If you say that the distinction of experience cannot be taught, ‚ÄúThis is it,‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: rang nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: ‚ÄúAnd it is also produced from the aspect of the object‚Äù and so on.

original: / don gyi rnam pa las gzhan pa'i sgrub byed gzhan yin te /
analyzed: / don gyi rnam pa las gzhan pa'i sgrub byed gzhan yin te /
translated: The proof is different from the aspect of the object.

original: dbang po la sogs ba don gyi rnam pa ma yin ba dag las so //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs ba don gyi rnam pa ma yin ba dag las so //
translated: It is from the sense faculties and so on, which are not the aspect of the object.

original: las ni yul lo /üîΩ'brel pa'i yul ni 'di'i rtogs pa ni shes pa 'di'i shes so //
analyzed: las ni yul lo / 'brel pa'i yul ni 'di'i rtogs pa ni shes pa 'di'i shes so //
translated: The object is the domain.üîΩThe domain of the relation is the object of this cognition.

original: 'brel pa don gyi rnam pa de yang don de shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'brel pa don gyi rnam pa de yang don de shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The relation is the aspect of the object. That also becomes the nature of the cognition of that object.

original: de'i phyir don gyi rnam pa de las don gzhan tshad ma'i 'bras bu min /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi rnam pa de las don gzhan tshad ma'i 'bras bu min /
translated: Therefore, from that aspect of the object, another object is not the effect of valid knowledge.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid dang tshad ma'i bdag nyid gcig pa de'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid dang tshad ma'i bdag nyid gcig pa de'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The nature of the effect and the nature of valid knowledge are the same. Therefore, the nature of the effect is the grasping.

original: tshad ma de yang rang gi yul la byed pa dang bcas pa'i phyir byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma de yang rang gi yul la byed pa dang bcas pa'i phyir byed pa po nyid do //
translated: That valid knowledge also is the agent because it is engaged with its object.

original: ci zhig ce na ;
analyzed: ci zhig ce na ;
translated: What is it?

original: don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis de'i yul de rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis de'i yul de rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cognition of the object. By the nature of cognizing the object, it makes that object known.

original: lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ji ltar 'jig rten na grags pa rtsva'i rgyun dang / de gcod pa'i zor ba dang / de dum bu gnyis su byed pa dang 'bras bu dag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med kyang byed pa dang 'bras bur snang bas na /
analyzed: lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ji ltar 'jig rten na grags pa rtsva'i rgyun dang / de gcod pa'i zor ba dang / de dum bu gnyis su byed pa dang 'bras bu dag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med kyang byed pa dang 'bras bur snang bas na /
translated: The words ‚Äúfor example‚Äù indicate that just as in the world, even though a stream of grass, the sickle that cuts it, and the one who cuts it in two parts and the result, the two parts, do not have different natures, they appear as agent and result.üîΩ

original: byed pa zhes gzhag go zhes ston to //
analyzed: byed pa zhes gzhag go zhes ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù indicates that, just as in the world, even though the stream of grass, the sickle that cuts it, and the two pieces of grass that it cuts are not different in nature, they are posited as the agent and the effect because they appear as the agent and the effect.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni rang gis te /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni rang gis te /
translated: This is explained by itself.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu dang byed pa tha dad pa byed pa can ma yin yang don gyi rnam pa de'i dbang gis 'bras bu de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu dang byed pa tha dad pa byed pa can ma yin yang don gyi rnam pa de'i dbang gis 'bras bu de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the effect and the agent are not different in nature, because of the aspect of the object, the effect is posited as that.

original: bar chad med pa ni gang zhig yod pa tsam gyis don rtogs pa nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa ni gang zhig yod pa tsam gyis don rtogs pa nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted is that which, by its mere existence, is the cause of the object being understood.

original: dbang po la sogs pa la de med pa'i phyir yul rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i byed pa po khyad par can de nye ba'i rgyur mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa la de med pa'i phyir yul rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i byed pa po khyad par can de nye ba'i rgyur mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the special agent that is the cause of the object being understood is not established as the immediate cause of that, since it does not exist in the sense faculty and so on.

original: gal te dbang po la sogs pas rtogs pa de la sbyor te de dag med na de yang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la sogs pas rtogs pa de la sbyor te de dag med na de yang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition of the object is connected with the sense faculty, etc., because if they do not exist, it does not exist,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: @197b thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @197b thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: All of them are not the object of cognition.

original: dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang don 'di rtogs pa ni 'di'o zhes shes pa la bye brag med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang don 'di rtogs pa ni 'di'o zhes shes pa la bye brag med pa'o //
translated: Even if the sense faculty, etc. exist, there is no difference in the cognition that ‚ÄúThis is the cognition of this object.‚Äù

original: gang gis rtogs pa 'di'i yul sngon po ste gzhan ni zhes shes pa dang / don so sor bye brag tu 'byed pa la byed pa po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis rtogs pa 'di'i yul sngon po ste gzhan ni zhes shes pa dang / don so sor bye brag tu 'byed pa la byed pa po zhes brjod do //
translated: The cognition that ‚ÄúThe object of this cognition is blue, not something else‚Äù and the cognition that ‚ÄúThe object is distinguished‚Äù are called the agent.

original: ba lang gi rdzas ni bye brag tu bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas ni bye brag tu bya ba'o //
translated: The object of the cognition of the object is the substance of the cow.

original: ba lang nyid dang / 'gro ba nyid dang / dkar po nyid bye brag tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang / 'gro ba nyid dang / dkar po nyid bye brag tu byed pa'o //
translated: Cowness, going, and whiteness are the distinctions.

original: de la bye brag tu byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa dag la yang yul gyis bya ba'i bye brag yul gyi rnam pa med na rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'bras bur 'dod pa la ba lang gi rdzas la
analyzed: de la bye brag tu byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa dag la yang yul gyis bya ba'i bye brag yul gyi rnam pa med na rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'bras bur 'dod pa la ba lang gi rdzas la
translated: Even for those who assert that the cognition that distinguishes the distinctions is valid knowledge, if the distinction of the object‚Äôs activity, the aspect of the object, does not exist, it is not established as the object of cognition.

original: dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / bye brag med pa'i phyir tshad ma dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / bye brag med pa'i phyir tshad ma dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: because the object of the act and the object of the valid cognition are not different, the establishment of the valid cognition and its result is not accomplished, and therefore it is not a valid cognition.

original: bya ba 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi yul can dang / byed pa tshad ma rigs la sogs pa'i yul can dag yul tha dad par yang 'gal ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: bya ba 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi yul can dang / byed pa tshad ma rigs la sogs pa'i yul can dag yul tha dad par yang 'gal ba'i phyir te ;
translated: Because it is contradictory for the object of the act, which is the substance of the result, and the object of the agent, which is the valid cognition, etc., to be different objects,

original: tshad mas yul du ma byas pa rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas yul du ma byas pa rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable to cognize what has not been made an object by the valid cognition.

original: bye brag med pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: bye brag med pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is not only without any difference.

original: yul tha mi dad pa nyid na yang tshad mar 'dod pa'i shes pa nyid kyis de rtogs zin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gnyis pa don med do //
analyzed: yul tha mi dad pa nyid na yang tshad mar 'dod pa'i shes pa nyid kyis de rtogs zin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gnyis pa don med do //
translated: Even if the object is not different, the second result is meaningless, because the cognition itself, which is accepted as the valid cognition, has already cognized it.

original: don med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi don de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa rim gyis 'byung ba yang rgyu mtshan tha mi dad pa'i phyir bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: don med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi don de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa rim gyis 'byung ba yang rgyu mtshan tha mi dad pa'i phyir bkag pa yin no //
translated: Not only is it meaningless, but the arising of the cognition produced by that object in sequence is also refuted because the reason is not different.

original: gal te bye brag tu byed pa dang bya ba'i shes pa dag dus gcig tu gyur na don med par ma zad kyi yang sgrub par byed pa ste /üîΩskyed par byed pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te bye brag tu byed pa dang bya ba'i shes pa dag dus gcig tu gyur na don med par ma zad kyi yang sgrub par byed pa ste / skyed par byed pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: If the cognition of the object and the cognition of the act of cognizing were simultaneous, not only would they be purposeless, but alsoüîΩthe producer, that is, the

original: bskyed par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: cause, would not be produced, that is, would not be the effect.

original: gal te shes pa'i don dang 'dra ba nyid dang / de rtogs pa dag kyang dus gcig pa'i phyir skyon der 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i don dang 'dra ba nyid dang / de rtogs pa dag kyang dus gcig pa'i phyir skyon der 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the fault does not arise because the object of cognition and the cognition of it are simultaneous,

original: shes pa'i cha shas dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes pa'i cha shas dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe parts of the cognition . . . .‚Äù

original: gal te chos kyi bye brag yod kyang dngos por gyur pa'i bye brag med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi bye brag yod kyang dngos por gyur pa'i bye brag med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not correct that although there is a difference in the object, there is no difference in the entity,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúEven though there is no difference in the entity . . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po tha dad pa med kyang nus pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dper na mar me rang gsal bar byed do zhes rnam par gzhag pa mthong ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa med kyang nus pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dper na mar me rang gsal bar byed do zhes rnam par gzhag pa mthong ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Even though there is no difference in the entity, there is a difference in the capacity, as is seen in the case of the presentation of the lamp, which illuminates itself.

original: dpe yang grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe yang grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The example is established.

original: gal te dngos por gyur ba'i tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa yang mi @198a * //üîΩsrid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos por gyur ba'i tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa yang mi @198a * // srid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that because there is no difference in the nature of things, their positing is also impossible,üîΩwe reply:

original: tha dad pa 'di zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This difference is a convention.

original: byed pa dang bya ba'i tha snyad 'di'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang bya ba'i tha snyad 'di'o //
translated: This is the convention of agent and action.

original: de yang bya ba de nyid byed pa por brjod ces bya ba 'dod ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bya ba de nyid byed pa por brjod ces bya ba 'dod ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because it is accepted that the action itself is called the agent.

original: bum pa'i gzugs dang ro la sogs pa thams cad nye yang /
analyzed: bum pa'i gzugs dang ro la sogs pa thams cad nye yang /
translated: Although all the form, taste, etc. of a pot are present,

original: gzugs sam ro la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kho na rtogs te ;
analyzed: gzugs sam ro la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kho na rtogs te ;
translated: only some form, taste, etc. are perceived.

original: des na nye ba la bye brag med kyang gzugs sam ro kho na rtogs pa'i bye brag de'i blo'i so sor snang ba ste /
analyzed: des na nye ba la bye brag med kyang gzugs sam ro kho na rtogs pa'i bye brag de'i blo'i so sor snang ba ste /
translated: Therefore, although there is no difference in their presence, the difference in the perception of only form or taste is the individual appearance of the cognition.

original: don gyi rnam pa nyid kyis byas pas de kho na tshad mar rigs te /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa nyid kyis byas pas de kho na tshad mar rigs te /
translated: Since it is produced by the aspect of the object itself, it is reasonable that it alone is valid knowledge,

original: rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the means of knowing.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba'i lugs la brten te bshad nas rnam par shes par smra ba'i lugs bstan par bzhed nas 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba'i lugs la brten te bshad nas rnam par shes par smra ba'i lugs bstan par bzhed nas 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having explained the system of those who propound external objects, in order to teach the system of those who propound consciousness, he says this and so on.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu rtogs pa nyid yod mod kyi 'on kyang don rtogs pa zhes bya ba la 'di ci zhig ces 'dri ba brtsams so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu rtogs pa nyid yod mod kyi 'on kyang don rtogs pa zhes bya ba la 'di ci zhig ces 'dri ba brtsams so //
translated: Although the result of valid knowledge, the realization of an object, does exist, he begins the question, ‚ÄúHowever, what is the realization of an object?‚Äù

original: don la skyes pa dang don 'dra bdag las myong bar gzhag go //
analyzed: don la skyes pa dang don 'dra bdag las myong bar gzhag go //
translated: It is posited that the object is experienced from something arisen from the object and similar to the object.

original: bum pa'i rnam pa can du 'dra bas yul mtshungs pa'i 'das ma thag pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam pa can du 'dra bas yul mtshungs pa'i 'das ma thag pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The immediately preceding consciousness that is similar to the aspect of a pot is the similar object.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa yul 'dra ba can yang rigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa yul 'dra ba can yang rigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the immediately preceding consciousness that is similar to the object is also just a type of consciousness.

original: gal te de lta na 'di nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ste de med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ste de med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is this that is called ‚ÄúI experience this‚Äù? It would not exist.

original: don de nyid rjes su ste khyod kyis phyi rol 'di'i zhes bsgrubs na kho bos kyang don rtogs kyi de lta ma yin na tshad ma kho bos ma mthong ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: don de nyid rjes su ste khyod kyis phyi rol 'di'i zhes bsgrubs na kho bos kyang don rtogs kyi de lta ma yin na tshad ma kho bos ma mthong ngo zhes ston to //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: If you establish that ‚Äúthis external object is seen,‚Äù then I also understand the meaning. But if it is not like that, then I do not see valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba dang thos pa dag las de'i rjes su byed pa'i nges pa'i shes pa dag tu 'gyur la de ltar 'grub pa de dag don de nyams su myong ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba dang thos pa dag las de'i rjes su byed pa'i nges pa'i shes pa dag tu 'gyur la de ltar 'grub pa de dag don de nyams su myong ba'o zhe na /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúThe ascertainment that occurs after seeing and hearing through direct perception is valid knowledge, and that which establishes it in that way experiences that object.‚Äù

original: 'di bltas so 'di mnyan no zhes bya ba de dag nyid rgyu ji ltar na shes pa de don de'i mthong pa yin no zhes don dang shes pa 'brel par byed pa'i rgyu 'dir dpyod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di bltas so 'di mnyan no zhes bya ba de dag nyid rgyu ji ltar na shes pa de don de'i mthong pa yin no zhes don dang shes pa 'brel par byed pa'i rgyu 'dir dpyod pa ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, how is it that the cause of ‚ÄúI see this‚Äù and ‚ÄúI hear this‚Äù is the seeing of that object? Here you analyze the cause that connects the object and consciousness.

original: gal te 'dir dpyad par ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dpyad par ci dgos she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it necessary to analyze this?‚Äù

original: don de dag mthong pa rnam par gzhag pa ni don de dag shes pa'i 'brel pa brten nas rnam par nges te /
analyzed: don de dag mthong pa rnam par gzhag pa ni don de dag shes pa'i 'brel pa brten nas rnam par nges te /
translated: The presentation of seeing that object is ascertained in dependence on the connection of knowing that object.

original: 'brel pa de med na ni 'di bltas 'di mnyan to zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel pa de med na ni 'di bltas 'di mnyan to zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no relation, then it would not be the case that ‚Äúthis is seen‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is heard,‚Äù

original: 'brel pa med pa dag kyang de dag tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa dag kyang de dag tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those that are unrelated would also be seen and heard.

original: don yod pa ma yin par bsams te rnam par dpyad nas /
analyzed: don yod pa ma yin par bsams te rnam par dpyad nas /
translated: Having analyzed the nonexistence of an object,

original: da ni don yod kyang blo la de dang 'dra ba nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir shes pa'i @198b yul dang 'dra ba yang ma yin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: da ni don yod kyang blo la de dang 'dra ba nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir shes pa'i @198b yul dang 'dra ba yang ma yin te zhes smos te /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that even if an object exists, it is not like cognition, he says, ‚ÄúNor is the object of cognition like cognition.‚Äù

original: dang po rang gi sde pa'i lugs dpyad pa'i phyir de'i snang ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dang po rang gi sde pa'i lugs dpyad pa'i phyir de'i snang ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to analyze the system of our own schools first, he says, ‚ÄúIts appearance is not like cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of cognition.

original: phyi rol pa'i lugs dpyad pa'i phyir yul la zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i lugs dpyad pa'i phyir yul la zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: In order to analyze the system of the non-Buddhists, he says, ‚ÄúNor is the object of cognition like the object,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te blo la rags par snang ba nyid don gyi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te blo la rags par snang ba nyid don gyi rnam pa yin te /
translated: If the appearance of the gross to cognition is the aspect of the object,

original: yul la yan lag can rags pa gcig yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul la yan lag can rags pa gcig yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then the object would be a single gross whole.

original: yul la rags pa gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu ni med do //
analyzed: yul la rags pa gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu ni med do //
translated: There is no such realization of the object as a single gross whole.

original: yul rags pa gcig nyid yod na lags pa 'am /
analyzed: yul rags pa gcig nyid yod na lags pa 'am /
translated: If the gross object exists as one, then

original: rkang pa la sogs pa gcig g-yo bas lus thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa gcig g-yo bas lus thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur te /
translated: when one part, the foot, for example, moves, the whole body would move,

original: g-yo ba de nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba de nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mover is not different from the other parts.

original: gos khrus mkhan gyi dbyug ba las brgyang ba las chus khru ba na gos ni gnas la chu ni mi gnas par 'dzag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gos khrus mkhan gyi dbyug ba las brgyang ba las chus khru ba na gos ni gnas la chu ni mi gnas par 'dzag pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a cloth that is beaten with a stick by a washerman: the cloth remains in one place, but the water, which is not beaten, flows away.

original: yang na phyogs gcig ma bsgribs na yang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na phyogs gcig ma bsgribs na yang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, if one part is not covered, then the whole is not covered, because there is no difference.

original: gang la yang ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la yang ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the whole is not covered, then the parts are not covered.

original: gal te cha shas lag pa la sogs pa bsgribs kyi cha shas can lus ni ma bsgribs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te cha shas lag pa la sogs pa bsgribs kyi cha shas can lus ni ma bsgribs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the parts, the hands, etc., are covered, but the whole, the body, is not covered,

original: lus 'di ni sngon du ma bsgribs ba bzhin du na'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni sngon du ma bsgribs ba bzhin du na'o //
translated: then the body would be seen as uncovered, as before the covering.

original: gal te cha shas 'di thams cad kyi sgo nas cha shas can mthong ba'i phyir gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te cha shas 'di thams cad kyi sgo nas cha shas can mthong ba'i phyir gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the whole is seen by means of all the parts, then it is one with the parts.

original: gal te cha shas thams cad mthong ba la rag las na lag pa la sogs pa cha shas rnams kyang de'i phyi rol dang dbus mtha' dag cig car mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir cha shas can 'di thams cad du mi mthong bar ro //
analyzed: gal te cha shas thams cad mthong ba la rag las na lag pa la sogs pa cha shas rnams kyang de'i phyi rol dang dbus mtha' dag cig car mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir cha shas can 'di thams cad du mi mthong bar ro //
translated: If it were dependent on seeing all the parts, then the parts, the hand and so on, would not be able to see simultaneously the outside, the middle, and the end of the body. Therefore the body would not be seen everywhere.

original: gcig nyid kyi phyir cung zad kha bsgyur na thams cad kha bsgyur ba 'am cung zad kha ma bsgyur na yang thams cad kha ma bsgyur bar rtogs bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi phyir cung zad kha bsgyur na thams cad kha bsgyur ba 'am cung zad kha ma bsgyur na yang thams cad kha ma bsgyur bar rtogs bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of its oneness, if a part is changed, it follows that the whole would be changed, or if a part is not changed, the whole would not be changed.

original: don dang blo la 'dra ba cung zad kyang med pa de nyid kyi phyir blo las gzhan don myong ba yod min la blo nyid myong ba yin no //
analyzed: don dang blo la 'dra ba cung zad kyang med pa de nyid kyi phyir blo las gzhan don myong ba yod min la blo nyid myong ba yin no //
translated: Because there is not the slightest similarity between the object and the cognition, there is no experience of an object other than cognition, and it is cognition itself that is experienced.

original: blo de myong ba yang blo gzhan ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: blo de myong ba yang blo gzhan ni ma yin gyi //
translated: That cognition is not experienced by another cognition.

original: blo de'i myong ba blo de'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: blo de'i myong ba blo de'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
translated: The experience of that cognition is the very nature of that cognition.

original: thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi ldan te med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi ldan te med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Everywhere, there is no apprehended object and no apprehending subject, because they do not exist.

original: / de'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo 'di 'di ltar rang gis rang gsal byed //
analyzed: blo 'di 'di ltar rang gis rang gsal byed //
translated: This cognition is self-illuminating.

original: 'dra ba med pa dang de las byung ba dang / de 'dra ba yang 'khrul pa dang yul dang 'dra ba las gzhan gyis kyang 'dzin par mi rigs pa dag gis yul gyi mtshan nyid gsal ba'i phyir don 'ga' yang nyams su myong ba med la /üîΩblo @199a * //
analyzed: 'dra ba med pa dang de las byung ba dang / de 'dra ba yang 'khrul pa dang yul dang 'dra ba las gzhan gyis kyang 'dzin par mi rigs pa dag gis yul gyi mtshan nyid gsal ba'i phyir don 'ga' yang nyams su myong ba med la / blo @199a * //
translated: Since the object is characterized by clarity, there is no experience of any object whatsoever by means of the three: the non-similarity, the arising from that, and the similarity to the object, because it is not tenable that it is apprehended by anything other than that.

original: 'di yang rang las gzhan 'ga' yang nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang rang las gzhan 'ga' yang nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
translated: And this cognition is not experienced by anything other than itself,

original: blo gzhan de la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gzhan de la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another cognition does not have the character of an object apprehended and an apprehender.

original: mar me la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i dngos pos rang gsal bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i dngos pos rang gsal bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the self-illumination of a lamp and so on.

original: gal te de lta na sngon po myong ba zhes bya ba'i drug pa ji ltar 'thad ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na sngon po myong ba zhes bya ba'i drug pa ji ltar 'thad ce na /
translated: If that is so, how is it tenable to say ‚Äúthe experience of blue‚Äù and so on?

original: sngon po la sogs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said ‚Äúblue and so on.‚Äù

original: sngon po rang bzhin de nyid nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir sngon po yang de yin la myong ba yang de yin pas sngon po myong ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po rang bzhin de nyid nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir sngon po yang de yin la myong ba yang de yin pas sngon po myong ba ste /
translated: Because the experience of the reality of blue is blue, and it is experience, it is the experience of blue.

original: autpala sngon po bzhin no //
analyzed: autpala sngon po bzhin no //
translated: It is like a blue lotus.

original: gal te yul med na blang ba dang dor ba dag med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul med na blang ba dang dor ba dag med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is no object, there would be no acceptance or rejection.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par nyams su myong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par nyams su myong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: When there is experience of the aspect of the object, then there is acceptance or rejection.

original: rang rig pa kho nas te /
analyzed: rang rig pa kho nas te /
translated: It is only by reflexive awareness,

original: blo rang gi rnam pa myong ba kho nas don rtogs pa rdzogs par 'gyur bas rang gi rnam par myong ba de kho nar 'bras bur rig pa'o ;
analyzed: blo rang gi rnam pa myong ba kho nas don rtogs pa rdzogs par 'gyur bas rang gi rnam par myong ba de kho nar 'bras bur rig pa'o ;
translated: because the realization of the object is complete by the experience of the aspect of the mind itself, and that experience of the aspect is known as the result.

original: / gal te don de rang nyid kyis ji ltar rnam par gnas pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: / gal te don de rang nyid kyis ji ltar rnam par gnas pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the object is realized just as it is by itself,

original: don gcig la shes pa thams cad 'dod pa gcig nyid du nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don gcig la shes pa thams cad 'dod pa gcig nyid du nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then all consciousnesses of a single object would definitely be the same desire.üîΩBut it is not so.

original: skyes bu'i bye brag gis sna tshogs su myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i bye brag gis sna tshogs su myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not the case that the object is experienced in a variety of ways due to the variety of individuals.

original: don gcig la sna tshogs nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la sna tshogs nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for a single object to be various.

original: gal te gcig tu nges so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu nges so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is definitely one,

original: rnam pa ni sna tshogs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sna tshogs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúBut the aspects are various, etc.‚Äù

original: srog chags kyi bye brag gis dbang po'i bde ba sdug bsngal nyid du skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi bye brag gis dbang po'i bde ba sdug bsngal nyid du skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the pleasure and pain of the sense faculties arise from the different species of living beings.

original: lus dang lces reg pa tsam gyis 'dod ba dang len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang lces reg pa tsam gyis 'dod ba dang len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body and tongue merely touch the object, desire and attachment arise.

original: don mthun par 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rang gi rnam par rig pa'i rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho na don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: don mthun par 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rang gi rnam par rig pa'i rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho na don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since they do not grasp the object as common, therefore the object is realized as having the nature of self-awareness, which is the self-awareness of the cognition itself.

original: rtogs pa de'i sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa de'i sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: That realization is the proof of the object.

original: tshad ma yang yul gyi rnam ba nyid yin te /üîΩrnam pa de'i sgo nas rang rigs par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma yang yul gyi rnam ba nyid yin te / rnam pa de'i sgo nas rang rigs par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The valid cognition is also the form of the object itself,üîΩbecause it is characterized by the establishment of the cognition in accordance with that form.

original: rnam pa ji ltar snang pa ltar shes pa 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar snang pa ltar shes pa 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is because the cognition is established in accordance with the appearance of the form,

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi dbang gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi dbang gis ni ma yin te /
translated: not because of external objects.

original: de la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa sna tshogs 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa sna tshogs 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because desire and non-desire are mutually exclusive.

original: de ltar na rtogs pa 'di rang rig pa yin yang phyi rol las skyes pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin pas na don rig par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rtogs pa 'di rang rig pa yin yang phyi rol las skyes pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin pas na don rig par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, although this cognition is reflexive awareness, it is regarded as the awareness of an object because it is the effect of that, since it arises from the external object.

original: rnam pa dang @199b rtogs pa gnyi ga'ang don gyi 'bras bu de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul tha mi dad do //
analyzed: rnam pa dang @199b rtogs pa gnyi ga'ang don gyi 'bras bu de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul tha mi dad do //
translated: Both the aspect and the cognition are the effect of the object, and therefore valid knowledge and its effect do not have different objects.

original: de ltar phyi'i don khas blangs nas tshad ma la sogs ba smras kyi /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i don khas blangs nas tshad ma la sogs ba smras kyi /
translated: Thus, having accepted external objects, they say that valid knowledge and so on exist.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin sems pa na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin sems pa na /
translated: But when the ultimate nature is being contemplated,

original: don mi rigs par sngar bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don mi rigs par sngar bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
translated: the object is not tenable, as was previously established.

original: don rig blo de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ rang nyid rig pa sngon po la sogs pa de ltar rab tu snang ba'i shes pa sngon po de 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: don rig blo de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ; / rang nyid rig pa sngon po la sogs pa de ltar rab tu snang ba'i shes pa sngon po de 'dra ba'am /
translated: Because the cognition that is aware of the object is of the nature of that.

original: de las gzhan te sngon po ma yin ba de 'dra ba'am ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan te sngon po ma yin ba de 'dra ba'am ste /
translated: The cognition that is aware of itself as blue appears as blue, or it does not appear as blue but as something else.

original: sngon po med par rang nyid nang gi byed pa de ltar snang ba yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po med par rang nyid nang gi byed pa de ltar snang ba yang rung ba'o //
translated: It is also possible that the internal agent appears without the blue.

original: yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag phyi rol la med kyang shes pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par snang ba'i phyir don dang mi 'dra'i shes pa de snang ba ni don las gzhan 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag phyi rol la med kyang shes pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par snang ba'i phyir don dang mi 'dra'i shes pa de snang ba ni don las gzhan 'dra ba'o //
translated: Moreover, although the desirable and undesirable do not exist externally, consciousness appears as desirable and undesirable. Therefore, the appearance of consciousness that does not resemble its object is similar to the object.

original: don dang 'dra ba nyid med kyang 'on kyang shes pa de skyed pa'i rgyu'i don phyi rol de yang de'i don du 'dod ba yin te /
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba nyid med kyang 'on kyang shes pa de skyed pa'i rgyu'i don phyi rol de yang de'i don du 'dod ba yin te /
translated: Although it does not resemble the object, the external object that is the cause of the arising of that consciousness is asserted to be its object.

original: khas blangs pas gzhal bya ste yul du gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pas gzhal bya ste yul du gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Since it is accepted, it is posited as an object, that is, an object of comprehension.

original: gal te shes pa 'dra bar nges par mi 'dod na rgyu tsam gyis ji ltar shes pa des don gzung bar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa 'dra bar nges par mi 'dod na rgyu tsam gyis ji ltar shes pa des don gzung bar 'grub ce na /
translated: If it is not asserted that consciousness is ascertained as resembling its object, how is it established that consciousness apprehends its object merely through being its cause?

original: bden zhes bya ba smos te 'dra ba med pas na don gzung ba zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba de ni bden te don gzung ba zhes bya bar sgrub par byed pa med la /
analyzed: bden zhes bya ba smos te 'dra ba med pas na don gzung ba zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba de ni bden te don gzung ba zhes bya bar sgrub par byed pa med la /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIt is true‚Äù because if it does not resemble it, it would not be called ‚Äúapprehending its object.‚Äù That is true, but there is no proof that it is called ‚Äúapprehending its object.‚Äù

original: de la gnod par byed ba ni sngar bstan pa'i phyir dang 'og nas kyang ston par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de la gnod par byed ba ni sngar bstan pa'i phyir dang 'og nas kyang ston par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since this is taught above and will be taught below,

original: don gzung ba zhes bya ba 'di 'dra bdag la'ang shes pa med de /
analyzed: don gzung ba zhes bya ba 'di 'dra bdag la'ang shes pa med de /
translated: it is not the case that there is no cognition of this kind called ‚Äúapprehending objects.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rang nyid rig pa zhes bya bar tshad mas gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid rig pa zhes bya bar tshad mas gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is established by valid cognition that it is reflexive awareness. This is the meaning.

original: gal te yul kho na'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig nang du ste /
analyzed: gal te yul kho na'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig nang du ste /
translated: If the aspect of the object alone is determined,

original: blo la yongs su gcod de rtogs pa na yang rnam pa de rang gis rig par skye bas na yul dang rtogs ba dang tshad ma dag nye bar mtshon pa ste ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo la yongs su gcod de rtogs pa na yang rnam pa de rang gis rig par skye bas na yul dang rtogs ba dang tshad ma dag nye bar mtshon pa ste ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: that is, if it is cognized, then since the aspect arises as self-cognizing, the object, the cognition, and the valid cognition are indicated, that is, recognized.

original: de la yang phyi rol gyi don med kyang /
analyzed: de la yang phyi rol gyi don med kyang /
translated: Even though there is no external object,

original: tshad ma'i gzhal bya 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: tshad ma'i gzhal bya 'bras bu yi //
translated: the result of the valid cognition isüîΩthe positing of the object of valid cognition.

original: rnam gzhag log bas de bslad pas //üîΩgzung dang 'dzin dang nyams myong zhes //üîΩdbye ba rtogs pas mtshon de shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam gzhag log bas de bslad pas // gzung dang 'dzin dang nyams myong zhes // dbye ba rtogs pas mtshon de shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since that is distorted,üîΩit is indicated by the categories of apprehended, apprehender, and experience.üîΩIt is cognized.

original: gzung ba dang ni gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni gzhal bya'o //
translated: The apprehended and the object of comprehension.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'jal byed do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'jal byed do //
translated: The apprehender is the means of knowing.

original: rig ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rig ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The knower is the result.

original: de dag ni 'khrul bas ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'khrul bas ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du byas te /
translated: These are made in accordance with how things are seen through delusion.

original: 'khrul ba las gzhan du yang dag par na rang rig pa'i dngos po gcig cig la gzung ba @200a * //
analyzed: 'khrul ba las gzhan du yang dag par na rang rig pa'i dngos po gcig cig la gzung ba @200a * //
translated: Apart from delusion, in reality, there is only one thing, self-awareness.

original: dang 'dzin pa dang rig pa mtshan nyid tha dad par rtogs pa /
analyzed: dang 'dzin pa dang rig pa mtshan nyid tha dad par rtogs pa /
translated: The realization of the different characteristics of the apprehended, the apprehender, and the knower

original: ji ltar bden pa'i rnam pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar bden pa'i rnam pa yin //
translated: How could that be a true aspect?

original: de bden na shes pa gcig pa nyid ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bden na shes pa gcig pa nyid ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were true, the oneness of consciousness would be undermined.

original: shes pa de gcig nyid yin na gzhan rnam pa de'i gzhan de dum nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa de gcig nyid yin na gzhan rnam pa de'i gzhan de dum nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that consciousness were one, the other aspects would also be undermined.

original: gal te rnam pa rnams kyis dben pa'i shes pa gcig yod do zhen /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa rnams kyis dben pa'i shes pa gcig yod do zhen /
translated: If there were a single consciousness devoid of aspects,

original: de ni med do //
analyzed: de ni med do //
translated: that would not exist.

original: gcig gi bdag nyid ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because a single nature is not seen,

original: de nam yang myong ba med do //
analyzed: de nam yang myong ba med do //
translated: it is never experienced.

original: de lta bas na gcig pa nyid du gzhag pa'i rgyu tshad mas bdag nyid tha mi dad par mthong na gdod blo yis tha mi dad par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig pa nyid du gzhag pa'i rgyu tshad mas bdag nyid tha mi dad par mthong na gdod blo yis tha mi dad par rtogs kyi /
translated: Therefore, if the cause of positing identity were the perception of identity by a valid cognition, then the mind would understand identity.

original: gzhan du ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pas dben pa'i shes pa gcig pu nyid ni khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pas dben pa'i shes pa gcig pu nyid ni khas mi blang ngo //
translated: But since it is not, we do not accept that consciousness is alone, devoid of aspects.

original: de ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa smra ba yang mi gnas pas ngo bo nyid med par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa smra ba yang mi gnas pas ngo bo nyid med par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since neither the as- pect-possessor nor the aspectless is tenable, the theory of consciousness is untenable. Therefore, since it is established that consciousness is essenceless,

original: gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhen things are analyzed, they are not found.‚Äù

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu chos mthun pa mthong ba dang / yul mi gsal ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu la ltos nas 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu chos mthun pa mthong ba dang / yul mi gsal ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu la ltos nas 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: If error were dependent on external causes, such as seeing similar causes of error, unclear objects, and so forth,

original: dngul g-ya' dkar po yod pa dang 'dra ba mthong nas nya phyis la 'khrul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngul g-ya' dkar po yod pa dang 'dra ba mthong nas nya phyis la 'khrul pa lta bu'o //
translated: then it would be like seeing a white conch and mistaking it for a silver dish.

original: phyi'i rgyu med na ni yul med pa'i 'khrul pa med na /
analyzed: phyi'i rgyu med na ni yul med pa'i 'khrul pa med na /
translated: If there is no external cause, there is no error without an object.

original: shes pa rang rig pa gcig pu 'di la chos mthun pa mthong ba de /
analyzed: shes pa rang rig pa gcig pu 'di la chos mthun pa mthong ba de /
translated: The seeing of a similarity in this single consciousness that is reflexive awareness

original: shes pa gcig pu nyid gang la yang gzung ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang 'dra ba de dag tu gnas pa med pas /
analyzed: shes pa gcig pu nyid gang la yang gzung ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang 'dra ba de dag tu gnas pa med pas /
translated: is not the abiding of that single consciousness as something similar to those, such as the apprehended.

original: 'gro bas tha ngad pa der mthong ba med pa'i phyir tha dad par 'khrul pa mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro bas tha ngad pa der mthong ba med pa'i phyir tha dad par 'khrul pa mi srid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the world does not see that, the error of difference is impossible.

original: 'di yang yin mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di yang yin mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is also so, and so on.

original: gal te tshad ma la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba 'dri ba 'di ni sngar gsal zin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba 'dri ba 'di ni sngar gsal zin mod kyi /
translated: Although this question, such as with respect to valid knowledge, and so on, has already been clarified,

original: lan gzhan bstan pa'i phyir yang nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: lan gzhan bstan pa'i phyir yang nye bar bkod do //
translated: it is presented again in order to teach another reply.

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pas ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pas ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two moons, and so on, are the floaters, and so on.

original: sngon po dang / de shes pa dang / zla ba gnyis pa dang / de shes pa 'di dag las rnam pa gcig mi dmigs na gzhan dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang / de shes pa dang / zla ba gnyis pa dang / de shes pa 'di dag las rnam pa gcig mi dmigs na gzhan dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: From among these, the blue, its consciousness, the two moons, and its consciousness, if one aspect is not observed, the other is not observed.

original: de ltar lhan cig dmigs par nges pa de rang bzhin tha dad pa la rigs pa ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig dmigs par nges pa de rang bzhin tha dad pa la rigs pa ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of simultaneous observation is not reasonable for different natures, because there is no relation.

original: gal te gzugs dang snang bdag @200b 'brel pa med la lhan cig dmigs par nges pa yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang snang bdag @200b 'brel pa med la lhan cig dmigs par nges pa yang yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that form and light are not related, but there is still ascertainment of simultaneous observation,

original: gzugs dang snang ba dag ni gzugs shes pa de skyed pa la lhan cig byed pas nus pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod do //
analyzed: gzugs dang snang ba dag ni gzugs shes pa de skyed pa la lhan cig byed pas nus pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod do //
translated: form and light have a relation characterized by obtaining the ability to be co-producing causes of the arising of the consciousness of form.

original: snang bas mig gi dbang po'i nus pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir snang ba med na gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: snang bas mig gi dbang po'i nus pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir snang ba med na gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is a relation characterized by the arising of the potential of the eye faculty due to light, form is not observed in the absence of light.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu gzugs dmigs pa la rgyu snang ba mi 'khrul pa'i phyir lhan cig dmigs pa nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu gzugs dmigs pa la rgyu snang ba mi 'khrul pa'i phyir lhan cig dmigs pa nges so //
