translated: because in this way, it would be excluded by the words ‚Äúnon-existence in the contradictory,‚Äù

original: 'gal ba kho na la med par zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba kho na la med par zhes bya bar ro //
translated: for it would be non-existence only in the contradictory.

original: de lta na me yin pa'i phyir dro ba'o zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na me yin pa'i phyir dro ba'o zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, ‚Äúbecause of being fire‚Äù would not be a reason,

original: me dro ba dang 'gal ba grang ba'i reg pa kho na las ldog par 'gyur ba de lta na me dro ba dang 'dra bar reg pa btang snyoms pa las kyang ma log pa'i phyir de dang yang 'brel pa srid do //
analyzed: me dro ba dang 'gal ba grang ba'i reg pa kho na las ldog par 'gyur ba de lta na me dro ba dang 'dra bar reg pa btang snyoms pa las kyang ma log pa'i phyir de dang yang 'brel pa srid do //
translated: because it would be a reversal only from the contradictory of the hot, i.e., the cold touch, just as it is a reversal from the hot of fire. In that case, it would be possible to connect it with that, i.e., the cold touch, because it is not a reversal from the neutral touch, just as it is not a reversal from the hot of fire.

original: de lta na me yin pa'i phyir dro ba 'am reg pa btang snyoms pa gang 'grub ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na me yin pa'i phyir dro ba 'am reg pa btang snyoms pa gang 'grub ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, it would be uncertain whether ‚Äúbecause of being fire‚Äù establishes the hot or the neutral touch.

original: de lta bas na med pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de kho nal med pa kho na'o zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon dbang phyug sde zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de kho nal med pa kho na'o zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon dbang phyug sde zer ro //
translated: says the teacher Isvarasena.

original: de la de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: chos gzhan 'jug pas mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa nyams pa ni mi srid de /
analyzed: chos gzhan 'jug pas mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa nyams pa ni mi srid de /
translated: because it is impossible for the property of the subject, etc., to be impaired by the presence of another property.

original: bram ze'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba de'i rigs las skyes pa yod na dkar sham nyid dang mang du za ba'i chos gzhan dang ldan pas bram ze nyams pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bram ze'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba de'i rigs las skyes pa yod na dkar sham nyid dang mang du za ba'i chos gzhan dang ldan pas bram ze nyams pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For if there is one born of that caste who becomes a Brahmin by nature, it is impossible for him to be impaired as a Brahmin by possessing another property, such as whiteness and eating much.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pas mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba chos gzhan dang ldan pas kyang ji ltar nyams /
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pas mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba chos gzhan dang ldan pas kyang ji ltar nyams /
translated: So how can the property of the subject be impaired by possessing another property, even though it is the property of the similar instance?

original: phyogs kyang bsgrub par byar rung bar 'dod pas yul du byas na chos gzhan gyis de nyams pa med do //
analyzed: phyogs kyang bsgrub par byar rung bar 'dod pas yul du byas na chos gzhan gyis de nyams pa med do //
translated: And since the position is also accepted as suitable to be the probandum, when it is taken as the object, it is not impaired by another property.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid la gzhan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid la gzhan zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that which does not possess the probandum is called ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de la med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de la med pa yang yin no //
translated: And it does not exist in that.

original: 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa 'gog pa la yang grang ba'i reg pa kho na dro ba dang 'gal ba @206b ni ma yin gyi /üîΩgrang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa 'gog pa la yang grang ba'i reg pa kho na dro ba dang 'gal ba @206b ni ma yin gyi / grang ba yang ma yin /
translated: And in the case of the negation of the contradictory, the counter-correlate, it is not the case that only cold contact is contradictory to warm contact.

original: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa yang phan tshun spangs pa dang ldan pas 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de las kyang ldog pa nyid la skyon med do //
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa yang phan tshun spangs pa dang ldan pas 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir de las kyang ldog pa nyid la skyon med do //
translated: Because the contact that is neither cold nor warm is also contradictory, since it is associated with the mutual exclusion. Therefore, there is no fault in the mere exclusion of that.

original: grang ba'i reg pa kho na la gtan tshigs 'gog na ni skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa kho na la gtan tshigs 'gog na ni skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if only cold contact is the reason for the negation, then there would be a fault.

original: 'gal ba kho na zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba kho na zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly the contradictory‚Äù means only the non-coexistent.

original: de dang mthun pa'i phan tshun spangs pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i phan tshun spangs pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with the nature of mutual exclusion that is in accordance with that.

original: de las gzhan pa dang 'gal bdag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa des na med nyid la med ces mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di ma bsnan yang skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang 'gal bdag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa des na med nyid la med ces mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di ma bsnan yang skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the opposite of that is the discordant side, there is no fault in not adding this discordant side of nonexistence to nonexistence.

original: gal te khyed kyi phyogs la bsnan pas ci zhig ston ce na sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi phyogs la bsnan pas ci zhig ston ce na sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it is asked what is shown by adding to your position, it is said, ‚Äúin order to demonstrate the syllogism.‚Äù

original: pha rol gang dag 'brel ba khas mi len na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyi khyab pa smra bar bya dgos pa ltar 'dir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol gang dag 'brel ba khas mi len na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyi khyab pa smra bar bya dgos pa ltar 'dir ni ma yin te /
translated: If one does not accept a relationship, one must speak of the pervasion of mere seeing and not seeing, but that is not the case here.

original: 'di ltar khyab pa nges pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyab pa nges pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúbecause the pervasion is ascertained.‚Äù

original: gcig gis kyang sbyor bar 'gyur bas gnyi ga la sbyar bar mi bya ste dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang sbyor bar 'gyur bas gnyi ga la sbyar bar mi bya ste dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is applied by one, it should not be applied to both because there is no purpose.

original: gal te ji ltar ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis sbyor ba de ltar ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis sbyor ba de ltar ston par byed ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is the syllogism demonstrated by the words that have the characteristic of exclusion?‚Äù

original: med nyid la med par nges pa'i zhes bsnan pa smos pas ni /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba med na med pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med nyid la med par nges pa'i zhes bsnan pa smos pas ni / bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The addition of the words in the absence of the object to be established indicates that the mere absence of the probans is not the reason for the absence of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba kho na la yod pa nyid ces rjes su 'gro pa yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba kho na la yod pa nyid ces rjes su 'gro pa yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But rather, the presence of the probandum alone is the reason for the absence of the probans.

original: de ltar na ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar na ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so zhes rtogs so //
translated: Thus, one should understand that even by the method of difference, the pervasion is understood.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su 'gro bas ldog pa rtogs pa tsam zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su 'gro bas ldog pa rtogs pa tsam zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: Otherwise, the pervasion would be understood only by the method of agreement.

original: ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so zhes don gnyis pa ni rtogs par dka' ste /
analyzed: ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so zhes don gnyis pa ni rtogs par dka' ste /
translated: But it is difficult to understand that even by the method of difference, the pervasion is understood.

original: shugs kyi shugs la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shugs kyi shugs la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of the method of difference depends on the power of the method of agreement.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni yod pa yin la dngos po'i chos nyid yin dngos po thams cad las ldog par ni gal te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni yod pa yin la dngos po'i chos nyid yin dngos po thams cad las ldog par ni gal te /
translated: If audibility were a property of an entity, and if it were excluded from all entities,

original: mnyan par bya ba dang 'gal te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba dang 'gal te /
translated: then it would contradict audibility.

original: mnyan par bya ba dngos po thams cad las ldog na dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na mnyan par bya ba de rtag pa'am mi rtag pa gcig la 'jug par dogs pa nyid yin pas na rtag ba'am /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba dngos po thams cad las ldog na dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // des na mnyan par bya ba de rtag pa'am mi rtag pa gcig la 'jug par dogs pa nyid yin pas na rtag ba'am /
translated: because if the object of listening were to be excluded from all things, it would follow that it would be a non-thing.

original: mi rtag pa de dag la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa de dag la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is suspected that the object of listening is either permanent or impermanent, one doubts whether it is permanent or impermanent.

original: gal te de lta yin na ci'i phyir ldog pa can zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ci'i phyir ldog pa can zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, why is it called ‚Äúhaving an exclusion‚Äù?

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba tsam gyi ldog pa dang ldan par slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba tsam gyi ldog pa dang ldan par slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
translated: The master says that it has an exclusion merely by not seeing concomitance.

original: go bar byed pa'i ldog pa ni sngar @207a * //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i ldog pa ni sngar @207a * //
translated: The exclusion of the understood was previously

original: gong du rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag ni ngo bo dang / rgyu log na mi 'byung ba dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: gong du rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag ni ngo bo dang / rgyu log na mi 'byung ba dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan zin to //
translated: taught above, such as ‚ÄúThe essence and effect are not produced when the cause is reversed.‚Äù

original: ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be taught.üîΩAnd that non-existence is also

original: med pa de yang zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i ldog pa'o //
analyzed: med pa de yang zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i ldog pa'o //
translated: is the exclusion of the understood.

original: bsgrub par bya pa de yod pa kho na la gtan tshigs yod pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya pa de yod pa kho na la gtan tshigs yod pa ste /
translated: The reason exists only when the probandum exists,

original: 'brel bas mthong bas so //üîΩgzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni gsal byed de thub pa rkang mig gi mdo'i rnam 'grel byed pa slob dpon dpal chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas dang dus mnyam par byung pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel bas mthong bas so // gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni gsal byed de thub pa rkang mig gi mdo'i rnam 'grel byed pa slob dpon dpal chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas dang dus mnyam par byung pa'o //
translated: because of the relation, and because of the perception.

original: gang mi rigs par mthong na zhes bya ba bzang mi rung ba dang bgrod du mi rung bar mthong ba de nyid kyi tshe de spyod par mi byed de /üîΩde las ldog pa gsal byed de ni phyugs las kyang phyugs yin te /
analyzed: gang mi rigs par mthong na zhes bya ba bzang mi rung ba dang bgrod du mi rung bar mthong ba de nyid kyi tshe de spyod par mi byed de / de las ldog pa gsal byed de ni phyugs las kyang phyugs yin te /
translated: Others say that the one who sees what is improper,üîΩthe one who is not fit to be a teacher,üîΩthe one who is not fit to be a great man,üîΩthe one who is not fit to be a great man,

original: chen po yang chen po slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la smod pa ste /üîΩmi rigs par mthong nas bdag nyid mi rigs pa de nyid la 'jug pas smod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po yang chen po slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la smod pa ste / mi rigs par mthong nas bdag nyid mi rigs pa de nyid la 'jug pas smod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the one who is not fit to be a great man,üîΩthe one who is not fit to be a great man,

analyzed: de slob dpon nyid skyon chags pa ni ma yin gyi /

original: bdag nyid mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi shes pa ste /
translated: the one who is not fit to be a

original: rmongs pa nyid las gzhan ci zhig yin na /
analyzed: rmongs pa nyid las gzhan ci zhig yin na /
translated: What else could it be but delusion?

original: gsal byed de nyid don log pa ste /
analyzed: gsal byed de nyid don log pa ste /
translated: The very thing that is to be clarified is the opposite of the object.

original: med pa la tha snyad mi 'jug par smra ste /
analyzed: med pa la tha snyad mi 'jug par smra ste /
translated: One should not use a convention for a non-existent.

original: med pa ldog pa'i yul du mi rung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: med pa ldog pa'i yul du mi rung ngo zhes so //
translated: It is not suitable to have an object that is the opposite of non-existence.

original: gzhan la med pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa ste med pa las ldog pa mi rung ngo zhes ldog pa'i tha snyad nyid 'gog par byed pas na 'di bdag nyid ni med pa la dgag pa'i tha snyad byed la /
analyzed: gzhan la med pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa ste med pa las ldog pa mi rung ngo zhes ldog pa'i tha snyad nyid 'gog par byed pas na 'di bdag nyid ni med pa la dgag pa'i tha snyad byed la /
translated: The other is the negation of a convention. It is not suitable to have an opposite that is the opposite of non-existence. Since he negates the very convention of the opposite, he himself uses the convention of negation for non-existence.

original: gzhan la ni 'gog pa'i phyir rigs pa med par smra ba'i phyir gsal bar rgyal po'i bka' yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni 'gog pa'i phyir rigs pa med par smra ba'i phyir gsal bar rgyal po'i bka' yin no //
translated: Since he negates the other, he speaks without reason. It is clear that he is the king‚Äôs man.

original: med pa las gtan tshigs mi ldog pas ldog pa ni rtags med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa las gtan tshigs mi ldog pas ldog pa ni rtags med pa'o //
translated: Since the reason does not turn away from non-existence, the opposite is the absence of a reason.

original: de'i ni ldog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtags yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ni ldog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtags yod pa ste /
translated: Its opposite is the existence of a reason in the discordant class.

original: dngos po med pa dngos por ji ltar 'dod par byed /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos por ji ltar 'dod par byed /
translated: How could one assert that a non-existent thing is a thing?

original: log pa ni gtan tshigs med pa'o //
analyzed: log pa ni gtan tshigs med pa'o //
translated: The opposite is the absence of a reason.

original: de med na ni yod pa'i dngos po bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na ni yod pa'i dngos po bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that does not exist, an existent thing would be established.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni med pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na yod pa'i dngos por yang 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni med pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir na yod pa'i dngos por yang 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚Äúbecause a non-existent entity does not exist, an existent entity also does not exist.‚Äù

original: rab reb can lta bu'i spyod pa ni khog par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rab reb can lta bu'i spyod pa ni khog par mthong ba'o //
translated: The conduct of the blind is like that of the blind.

original: la la ni 'dir phyugs long ba ni rnam par bsgyings zhes 'don te /
analyzed: la la ni 'dir phyugs long ba ni rnam par bsgyings zhes 'don te /
translated: Some read here ‚Äúthe blind cow is strutting.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni phyugs long ba zhes bya bas ni shin tu mi shes par ston to //
analyzed: de lta na ni phyugs long ba zhes bya bas ni shin tu mi shes par ston to //
translated: In that case, ‚Äúthe blind cow‚Äù teaches extreme ignorance.

original: rnam par bsgyings zhes pas ni log pa'i nga rgyal can du brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par bsgyings zhes pas ni log pa'i nga rgyal can du brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúStrutting‚Äù expresses false pride.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs med @207b pa de las gtan tshigs ldog mi 'dod /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs med @207b pa de las gtan tshigs ldog mi 'dod /
translated: If you do not assert the exclusion of the reason from the dissimilar instances because the dissimilar instances do not exist,

original: 'o na de la gtan tshigs 'jug par cis mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'o na de la gtan tshigs 'jug par cis mi 'dod /
translated: then why do you not assert the application of the reason to the dissimilar instances?

original: de la 'jug pa'am ldog pa las phung po gzhan ni mi srid de //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'am ldog pa las phung po gzhan ni mi srid de //
translated: Application or exclusion is not possible for a third category.

original: 'jug pa de yang mi 'dod na khyod kyi dgag pa 'di kho bo'i ldog pa ji ltar 'gog par byed de ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa de yang mi 'dod na khyod kyi dgag pa 'di kho bo'i ldog pa ji ltar 'gog par byed de ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not assert that, then how does your negation ‚Äúthe dissimilar instances are excluded‚Äù exclude our exclusion? It does not!

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrub pa'am ni dgag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'am ni dgag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúAffirmation and negation‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po med pa 'dir ni dgag pa dang / sgrub pa gnyi ga mi srid pa'i phyir lkugs ba nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'dir ni dgag pa dang / sgrub pa gnyi ga mi srid pa'i phyir lkugs ba nyid 'thob bo //
translated: Since neither affirmation nor negation is possible in the case of a non-entity, you end up dumb.

original: gzhan yang yod rnams yod par dgag pa med med pa la yang yul med pas dgag pa mi 'jug pas na khyed kyi tshul 'dis 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba med pa'i don ni nyams pa ste tha snyad mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod rnams yod par dgag pa med med pa la yang yul med pas dgag pa mi 'jug pas na khyed kyi tshul 'dis 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba med pa'i don ni nyams pa ste tha snyad mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since the existent is not negated as existent and the non-existent is not negated as non-existent, the object of negation is not engaged. Therefore, by your method, the world is destroyed, the meaning of non-existence is lost, and convention becomes impossible.

original: gal te dngos po nyid ni dgag par mi nus la med pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid ni dgag par mi nus la med pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that an entity cannot be negated and that non-existence is not non-existence,

original: yul de la med ce na 'am dus de na med pa 'gog ce na /
analyzed: yul de la med ce na 'am dus de na med pa 'gog ce na /
translated: then is it that it does not exist in a certain place or that it does not exist at a certain time?

original: yul dang dus gang ltar yod pa de ni de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba ma yin la gang ltar yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang med pa dgag pa'i yul du mi srid pas 'gog mi byed /
analyzed: yul dang dus gang ltar yod pa de ni de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba ma yin la gang ltar yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang med pa dgag pa'i yul du mi srid pas 'gog mi byed /
translated: If it exists in a certain place or time, it exists as it is and so cannot be negated. If it does not exist in that way, then it is impossible for it to be the object of negation, and so it is not negated.

original: de lta bas na dgag pa'i yul ni yod pa dang med pas khyab la de gnyi ga la yang dgag pa'i tha snyad du mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dgag pa'i yul ni yod pa dang med pas khyab la de gnyi ga la yang dgag pa'i tha snyad du mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the object of negation is pervaded by existence and nonexistence, and since it is not suitable for both of those to be the referent of the term negation,

original: dgag pa'i tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: all terms of negation would be eliminated.

original: khyed kyi lugs ltar na ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs ltar na ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: If it is as you say, how is it?

original: gzhan du tha snyad chad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du tha snyad chad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since the term would be eliminated elsewhere,

original: sgra don la brten nas te dngos po ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: sgra don la brten nas te dngos po ma yin pa la'o //
translated: it is based on the meaning of the term, not on an entity.

original: dngos po nyid ni brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir sngar bzhin no //
translated: Since an entity itself cannot be expressed, it is as before.

original: dngos dang dngos med dag gi gzhi ste yul yin no //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med dag gi gzhi ste yul yin no //
translated: The basis, the object, of entity and nonentity.

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyi gzhi ni phyi rol min pa ste /
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyi gzhi ni phyi rol min pa ste /
translated: The basis of all terms of negation and affirmation is not external;

original: blo'i snang ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: it is asserted to be the appearance of the mind.

original: des ni chos can der 'brel par de yod par rtogs so //
analyzed: des ni chos can der 'brel par de yod par rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that it exists in relation to that phenomenon.

original: med pa'ang des stong par rtogs par lta'o //
analyzed: med pa'ang des stong par rtogs par lta'o //
translated: It is seen that nonexistence is also understood to be empty of that.

original: ci'i phyir blo'i rtogs pa la snang ba kho na dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir blo'i rtogs pa la snang ba kho na dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it that only what appears to cognition is asserted to be the object of negation and affirmation?

original: sgra'i 'jug pa yod pa ste sgras de kho na ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i 'jug pa yod pa ste sgras de kho na ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the application of words exists, because words teach just that.

original: sgra ston pa de nyid dag gi ste /
analyzed: sgra ston pa de nyid dag gi ste /
translated: That which is taught by words is

original: sgra'i tha snyad du 'dod do //
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad du 'dod do //
translated: asserted to be the object of verbal conventions.

original: blo'i snang ba las gzhan du tshig don dngos po yin na /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba las gzhan du tshig don dngos po yin na /
translated: If the object of a word were a real thing other than what appears to cognition,

original: chos gcig gi ni dgag pa ste /üîΩsgra la rtag pa'i chos gcig bkag pa ste sgra la rtag pa'i chos gcig bkag pas mig gi yul @208a * //
analyzed: chos gcig gi ni dgag pa ste / sgra la rtag pa'i chos gcig bkag pa ste sgra la rtag pa'i chos gcig bkag pas mig gi yul @208a * //
translated: then the negation of one property of one thingüîΩwould establish the negation of all objects of the eye, etc.

original: la sogs pa thams cad bkag pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa thams cad bkag pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The negation of one property of sound, such as permanence, would establish the negation of all objects of the eye, etc.

original: bsgrub pa ste mi rtag pa nyid gcig bsgrub par byas pas brtsal ba las byung ba 'am ma zin pa nyid la sogs pa kun gyis bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ste mi rtag pa nyid gcig bsgrub par byas pas brtsal ba las byung ba 'am ma zin pa nyid la sogs pa kun gyis bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: And the establishment of one property, such as impermanence, would establish all properties, such as being produced or being non-eternal,

original: de dag de'i bdag nyid du tha dad med phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de'i bdag nyid du tha dad med phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different in being of the nature of that.

original: gal te de dag rten sgra las tha dad do zhe na'ang du ma ste /
analyzed: gal te de dag rten sgra las tha dad do zhe na'ang du ma ste /
translated: If you say that they are different from the sound that is their basis, then they are multiple.

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po la dgag pa'am bsgrub pa byas pa ltar te sngon po la dgag pa'am bsgrub pa byas pas ser po la ma yin pa ltar chos can de la bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag sbyar bar byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po la dgag pa'am bsgrub pa byas pa ltar te sngon po la dgag pa'am bsgrub pa byas pas ser po la ma yin pa ltar chos can de la bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag sbyar bar byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a negation or an affirmation is made with respect to a different thing, that is, just as a negation or an affirmation of blue is not an affirmation or a negation of yellow, so too, the affirmation or negation of a property is not applied to that property possessor.

original: 'o na ji ltar dgag pa 'am bsgrub pa bya zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dgag pa 'am bsgrub pa bya zhe na ;
translated: Well then, how is an affirmation or negation made?

original: sna tshogs chos te ldog pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: sna tshogs chos te ldog pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The various properties are the different negations.

original: de'i gzhir gyur ba'i chos can gcig ni blo la snang ba chos du ma gzhi gcig gi ngo bo ltar snang ba la brten te'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhir gyur ba'i chos can gcig ni blo la snang ba chos du ma gzhi gcig gi ngo bo ltar snang ba la brten te'o //
translated: The single property possessor that is the basis of those appears to the mind as if it were the entity of a single basis for the many properties.

original: de la sgrub par 'dod ba'i ldog pa'i chos gcig bsgrub pa na chos gzhan dgag pa dang bsgrub pa med pas btang snyoms su byas nas ni /
analyzed: de la sgrub par 'dod ba'i ldog pa'i chos gcig bsgrub pa na chos gzhan dgag pa dang bsgrub pa med pas btang snyoms su byas nas ni /
translated: When one of the properties that are to be affirmed is affirmed, since the other properties are neither affirmed nor negated, they are ignored.

original: chos gcig sgrub pa byed pa yin /
analyzed: chos gcig sgrub pa byed pa yin /
translated: One property is affirmed.

original: dgag pa yang gzhan dag btang snyoms su byas nas dgag par 'dod pa de ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: dgag pa yang gzhan dag btang snyoms su byas nas dgag par 'dod pa de ni stong pa ste /
translated: The negation is also empty, since it is a negation of something else, which is left as it is.

original: de las gzhan pa btang snyoms can yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa btang snyoms can yin no //
translated: But the other, which is left as it is, is not empty.

original: gal te dngos po cha shas med pa la ji ltar chos so sor dbye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po cha shas med pa la ji ltar chos so sor dbye zhe na /
translated: If there are no partless things, how can there be a division of the dharmas?

original: tha snyad don de ni dngos min pa rtog blos sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: tha snyad don de ni dngos min pa rtog blos sbyar ba ste /
translated: The object of convention is not a thing, but is a conceptual construction.

original: rtog pa med pa'i snang ba ma yin pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i snang ba ma yin pa bzhin du'o //
translated: It is not a non-conceptual appearance.

original: rtog pa'i blos sbyar ba de'i phyir de kho na nyid ma brtags par rtogs pas byas pa'i chos kyi bye brag la brten nas chos tha dad par rtogs so //
analyzed: rtog pa'i blos sbyar ba de'i phyir de kho na nyid ma brtags par rtogs pas byas pa'i chos kyi bye brag la brten nas chos tha dad par rtogs so //
translated: Since it is a conceptual construction, the different dharmas are understood in dependence on the different particulars of the dharma, which are produced by the understanding of reality without analysis.

original: gal te don rnams la bdag nyid tha dad pa med na rtogs pas ji ltar du 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don rnams la bdag nyid tha dad pa med na rtogs pas ji ltar du 'dzin zhe na /
translated: If the objects do not have a different nature, how are they apprehended by the understanding?

original: thog med bag chags te 'khrul pa'i sa bo na las skyes pa'i blo 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i don ni mkhas pa rnams kyis dor bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: thog med bag chags te 'khrul pa'i sa bo na las skyes pa'i blo 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i don ni mkhas pa rnams kyis dor bar mi bya ste /
translated: The objects that are known in the world are not to be rejected by the wise, since they are produced by the mind that arises from beginningless predispositions, which are the seeds of error.

original: de la gnod pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnod pa mi bya'o //
translated: One should not deny them.

original: de la gnod pa byas na tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnod pa byas na tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you deny that, then all conventional expressions would be cut off.

original: phyi'i sa bon cung zad yod de /
analyzed: phyi'i sa bon cung zad yod de /
translated: There is some external seed,

original: de 'bras can te me gang sreg pas de'i 'bras can de /
analyzed: de 'bras can te me gang sreg pas de'i 'bras can de /
translated: and that which has the result of fire is the fire that burns, because it has that result.

original: me las gzhan thams cad la de'i 'bras bu med pas /
analyzed: me las gzhan thams cad la de'i 'bras bu med pas /
translated: Since all that is other than fire does not have that result,

original: me gcig las me ma yin pa de dang de rnams don tha dad do //
analyzed: me gcig las me ma yin pa de dang de rnams don tha dad do //
translated: from one fire, that which is not fire is different in meaning from those.

original: tha dad pa de dang de la brten nas nye par bslad pa yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa de dang de la brten nas nye par bslad pa yin /
translated: That difference is based on the near and the distant.

original: me de la yang me ma yin pa de dag las tha dad ba du ma bsgrub pas shes pa dang de dag @208b las tha dad pa kha cig bkag pas me de la tha dad pa kha cig nyams pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: me de la yang me ma yin pa de dag las tha dad ba du ma bsgrub pas shes pa dang de dag @208b las tha dad pa kha cig bkag pas me de la tha dad pa kha cig nyams pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: Also, in that fire, since many things that are not fire are established, it appears as if some of the differences in that fire are negated by the cognition of those differences and some are not negated.

original: tha dad pa mang po de dang don ldan pa min yang de dag don de'i bdag nyid kyis gcig tu 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa mang po de dang don ldan pa min yang de dag don de'i bdag nyid kyis gcig tu 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: Although that many differences do not have that meaning, they are connected as one by the identity of that meaning.

original: chos gang gis dgag pa'am bsgrub pa byas kyang don yul du byed do //
analyzed: chos gang gis dgag pa'am bsgrub pa byas kyang don yul du byed do //
translated: Therefore, even if a negation or an affirmation is made by some property, the meaning is taken as the object.

original: tha dad pa de dag rten dang 'brel pa dang / tha dad pa lta bur snang ba'i bye brag la ni rten pa de /
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag rten dang 'brel pa dang / tha dad pa lta bur snang ba'i bye brag la ni rten pa de /
translated: Those differences are related to the basis, and the differences that appear as if separate are the basis.

original: de'i bdag nyid la med pa'i phyir mi shes pa'i bslad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la med pa'i phyir mi shes pa'i bslad pa ste /
translated: Since they do not exist in the nature of that, they are the contamination of ignorance.

original: mi mkhas pa dag chos du ma /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa dag chos du ma /
translated: The unwise think that many phenomena

original: rten las tha dad pa nyid do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: rten las tha dad pa nyid do snyam pa'o //
translated: are separate from the basis.

original: mkhas pa dag gis ni de sgra'i don tsam nyid du rtogs pas bslad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis ni de sgra'i don tsam nyid du rtogs pas bslad pa ma yin no //
translated: The wise are not contaminated because they understand that to be merely the meaning of the term.

original: mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i mi dmigs pa dang / mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu zhes sbyar la phyis de dag la rtags zhes so sor yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i mi dmigs pa dang / mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu zhes sbyar la phyis de dag la rtags zhes so sor yang sbyar ro //
translated: The three characteristics are applied to the non-apprehension, the three characteristics are applied to the nature, and the three characteristics are applied to the result. Later, each of those is also applied to the reason.

original: de lta na rtags re re yang mtshan nyid gsum pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na rtags re re yang mtshan nyid gsum pa yin gyi /
translated: In that case, each reason has three characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid gsum dang rtags gsum dag go rims bzhin du ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum dang rtags gsum dag go rims bzhin du ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that the three characteristics and the three reasons are not in the same order.

original: gsum las nyung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum las nyung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not less than three.

original: gnyis ni dngos po bsgrub pa yin la de yang rang gi bdag nyid bsgrub pa dang bdag nyid ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: gnyis ni dngos po bsgrub pa yin la de yang rang gi bdag nyid bsgrub pa dang bdag nyid ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The first two are proofs of a positive object, and they are divided into proofs of a self and proofs of a non-self.

original: gcig ni dgag pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The last one is a proof of a negative object.

original: de la snga ma gnyis ni dngos po yang de yin la bsgrub pa yang de yin pas dngos po sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de la snga ma gnyis ni dngos po yang de yin la bsgrub pa yang de yin pas dngos po sgrub pa ste /
translated: Among them, the first two are both positive objects and proofs, and therefore they are proofs of a positive object.

original: dngos po nyid gtan tshigs yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po nyid gtan tshigs yin gyi /
translated: The object itself is the reason.

original: lung la grags pa tsam dang / rang rigs brtags pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung la grags pa tsam dang / rang rigs brtags pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not merely known from scripture, nor is it a mere examination of one‚Äôs own reasoning.

original: yang na dngos po'i tshul gyis dngos po bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dngos po'i tshul gyis dngos po bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Or, they are proofs of a positive object because they prove a positive object by the method of the positive object.

original: yod pa'i don gyis yod pa'i don gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: yod pa'i don gyis yod pa'i don gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin pas so //
translated: This is because the existent object is the proof of the object to be proven, which is also existent.

original: phyi ma gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: phyi ma gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: The last one is a negative reason.

original: ma yin pa dgag pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa dgag pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is a proof of a negative object, which is a negation of a non-existent object.

original: de yang dgag pa kho na'i gtan tshigs yin pas dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang dgag pa kho na'i gtan tshigs yin pas dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, since it is a logical argument for negation only, it is a logical argument for negation.

original: dgag pa kho nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa kho nas ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not only negation,

original: rang bzhin dgag pa la sogs pas bsgrub pas kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dgag pa la sogs pas bsgrub pas kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to establish by negation, such as the negation of intrinsic nature, and so on.

original: dgag pa kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not only negation,

original: yod pa bsgrub na rang bzhin gyi rtags su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa bsgrub na rang bzhin gyi rtags su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if existence is established, it would be a logical reason for intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du snga ma gnyis kyis kyang dgag pa bsgrub na mi dmigs pa nyid du @209a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma gnyis kyis kyang dgag pa bsgrub na mi dmigs pa nyid du @209a * //
translated: Similarly, the first two also establish negation, because they are non-apprehension.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po kho na bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po kho na bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they establish only entities.

original: gal te ci'i phyir gsum las lhag pa med ce na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir gsum las lhag pa med ce na /
translated: If one asks why there are no more than three,

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, If there is a relation of intrinsic nature, and so on.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa ni gsum po 'di kho na la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa ni gsum po 'di kho na la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is certain that only these three have a relation of intrinsic nature.

original: chos dang chos can nyid kyis tha dad pa ni blos yongs su brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos dang chos can nyid kyis tha dad pa ni blos yongs su brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: The difference between the property and the subject is imagined by the mind.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang byas pa nyid don kyang ni blos brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang byas pa nyid don kyang ni blos brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence and being produced are not also imputed by the mind,

original: gal te de dag kyang blos brtags pa yin na ni don la cung zad kyang mi rten pa'i phyir blo de rang dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang blos brtags pa yin na ni don la cung zad kyang mi rten pa'i phyir blo de rang dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: because if they were imputed by the mind, then because the mind would not rely on objects in the least, that mind would be random.

original: des ni don mi 'thob pa'i phyir blo bye brag rang dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩdngos kun rang bzhin gyis zhes bya bas ni rang gi ngo bos sam /
analyzed: des ni don mi 'thob pa'i phyir blo bye brag rang dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // dngos kun rang bzhin gyis zhes bya bas ni rang gi ngo bos sam /
translated: Because it would not obtain objects, it would be called a random mind.üîΩAll things are by nature,

original: rang gi rgyu las so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las so //
translated: which means by their own nature or from their own cause.

original: rang dngos ni rigs 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rang dngos ni rigs 'dra ba'o //
translated: Their own nature is a similar type.

original: gzhan gyi dngos kyi rigs mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos kyi rigs mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: Other natures are dissimilar types.

original: des na sgra'i don gyis tha dad par gnas la /
analyzed: des na sgra'i don gyis tha dad par gnas la /
translated: Therefore, they exist as different by the meaning of the term.

original: rtags dag kyang gzhan sel bas 'jug pa'i phyir ldog pa'i bye brag tha dad pa 'ga' zhig sgrub par byed kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: rtags dag kyang gzhan sel bas 'jug pa'i phyir ldog pa'i bye brag tha dad pa 'ga' zhig sgrub par byed kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: Since signs also engage through the exclusion of other, they establish some difference in the negation, but they do not establish their own nature,

original: sgrub par byed pa las gzhan pa'i ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa las gzhan pa'i ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the negation is different from that which is established.

original: sngon dmigs par rigs pa mi dmigs pa'i yul dpe la med pa'i tha snyad kyis khyab pa grub na /
analyzed: sngon dmigs par rigs pa mi dmigs pa'i yul dpe la med pa'i tha snyad kyis khyab pa grub na /
translated: If it is established that the object of non-apprehension is pervaded by the term non-existent,

original: phyis kyang yul de lta bu yod pa la sngon tha snyad grub pa'i rim pas med pa'i tha snyad mi 'khrul pas so //
analyzed: phyis kyang yul de lta bu yod pa la sngon tha snyad grub pa'i rim pas med pa'i tha snyad mi 'khrul pas so //
translated: then later on, too, the term non-existent will not be confused with regard to the existence of such an object, by the process of establishing the term.

original: gal te dpyod pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin rtags su gyur pas dngos po med pa sgrub par 'dod pa dag ste /
analyzed: gal te dpyod pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin rtags su gyur pas dngos po med pa sgrub par 'dod pa dag ste /
translated: If one asserts that the non-apprehension of the analyzer, etc. is a reason that is the nature of a negation, i.e., the absence of a consciousness that apprehends it, then non-existence is established.

original: ci'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi med pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi med pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the term non-existent itself is to be established, and not non-existence?

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy the reason of non-apprehension,‚Äù

original: dmigs pa med pa ste /üîΩde la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ste / de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa yang ngo //
translated: non-apprehension isüîΩthe absence of a consciousness that apprehends it.

original: de lta na shes pa med par sgrub de yang mi dmigs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir med pa yin pas mi dmigs pa gzhan la ltos la /
analyzed: de lta na shes pa med par sgrub de yang mi dmigs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir med pa yin pas mi dmigs pa gzhan la ltos la /
translated: In that case, the establishment of the absence of consciousness is also just non-apprehension, and therefore it is non-existent.

original: de yang gzhan la zhes bya ba'i rigs pa thug pa med par 'gyur bas rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gzhan la zhes bya ba'i rigs pa thug pa med par 'gyur bas rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since the reason ‚Äúbecause of the non-observation of other‚Äù would be endless, it would not be established.

original: gal te dgag par 'dod pa de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa mi dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dgag par 'dod pa de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa mi dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If the non-observation of the cognition that observes the object of negation is the non-observation of that object of negation,

original: de rang gis grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de rang gis grub po zhe na /
translated: then it is established by itself.

original: de bzhin du dgag par 'dod pa'i yod ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang @209b gis grub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rtags don med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgag par 'dod pa'i yod ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang @209b gis grub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rtags don med pa can yin no //
translated: In the same way, since the non-existence of the object of negation is established by itself, the sign of non-observation is pointless.

original: gal te 'di ltar sa phyogs la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan dmigs pa grub pas dgag par bya ba la dmigs pa med pa'i mi dmigs pa 'grub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub pas mi dmigs pa gzhan las ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar sa phyogs la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan dmigs pa grub pas dgag par bya ba la dmigs pa med pa'i mi dmigs pa 'grub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub pas mi dmigs pa gzhan las ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan
translated: If, in this way, the non-observation of the object of negation is established by the observation of another cognition that observes the place, then since the non-observation of the object of negation is established, the non-observation is established by direct perception. Therefore, it is not established by another non-observation. In the same way,

original: sa phyogs yod pa grub pas gzhan bum pa la sogs pa dgag par 'dod pa med pa yang cis na mi 'grub /
analyzed: sa phyogs yod pa grub pas gzhan bum pa la sogs pa dgag par 'dod pa med pa yang cis na mi 'grub /
translated: since the existence of the place is established, why is the non-existence of another, such as a pot, not established?

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya bas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya bas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa yod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù refers to the existence of the observation of the domain that is devoid of the object of negation.üîΩThe existence of the observation of the domain that is devoid of the object of negation is established by the evidence of the nonobservation of the essential nature of the cognition that observes that, which is a nonimplicative negation.

original: dgag par bya bas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa yod pa dgag par bya ba dang / de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i rtags grub pa nyid kyis med pa rnams te dngos po med pa dang / de la dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya bas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa yod pa dgag par bya ba dang / de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i rtags grub pa nyid kyis med pa rnams te dngos po med pa dang / de la dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The nonexistence of those is established by the nonobservation of the object, and the nonexistence of the cognition that observes that.

original: med pa de rnams grub bas na dngos po med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa de rnams grub bas na dngos po med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Since those nonexistences are established, the nonentity is not the probandum.

original: yul mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis yul can med pa'i shes pa deng sgra dang tha snyad rtogs par byed de sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yul mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis yul can med pa'i shes pa deng sgra dang tha snyad rtogs par byed de sgrub par byed do //
translated: The cognition that is the absence of the object, which is the evidence of the nonobservation of the object, is the means of understanding the term and the convention of nonexistence. It is the proof.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sngon dmigs par rigs pa'i sbrul gnas khang du mi dmigs pas mngon sum gyis sprul med pa'i tha snyad rtogs nas kyang ste /
analyzed: sngon dmigs par rigs pa'i sbrul gnas khang du mi dmigs pas mngon sum gyis sprul med pa'i tha snyad rtogs nas kyang ste /
translated: The absence of the snake is understood by the term and is realized by direct perception through the nonobservation of the snake in the house, where it would be reasonable for it to be observed if it were there.

original: yang sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos can la tha snyad kyi yul mi dmigs pa mthong ba na sngon rtogs pa'i dus bzhin du dmigs par rigs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos can la tha snyad kyi yul mi dmigs pa mthong ba na sngon rtogs pa'i dus bzhin du dmigs par rigs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, when one sees the non-observation of the conventional object in the subject that one wishes to establish, one applies the convention of non-existence because of the non-observation of the object as it was previously cognized.

original: dper na sngar ba lang dkar po la nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul can gyi ba lang gi tha snyad rtogs pa la ;
analyzed: dper na sngar ba lang dkar po la nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul can gyi ba lang gi tha snyad rtogs pa la ;
translated: For example, previously, when one cognizes the conventional object of a cow, such as a dewlap, hump, and so on, in a white cow,

original: phyir ba lang sngon po la lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul mthong pa na tha snyad mi 'grub pa'i blun po la 'di ba lang yin te /
analyzed: phyir ba lang sngon po la lkog shal la sogs pa'i yul mthong pa na tha snyad mi 'grub pa'i blun po la 'di ba lang yin te /
translated: later, when one sees the dewlap, hump, and so on, in a blue cow, one applies the convention of cow to the blue cow, even though one did not previously establish the convention.üîΩBut one does not apply the convention of cow to a horse, even though one has previously established the convention, because one does not see the dewlap, hump, and so on.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the application of the convention of non-existence is similar to the application of the convention of existence.

original: sngon mngon sum nyid kyis tha snyad grub pa la phyis yul bstan pas tha snyad grub pa de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa la dpe ma grub par rgol ba yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon mngon sum nyid kyis tha snyad grub pa la phyis yul bstan pas tha snyad grub pa de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa la dpe ma grub par rgol ba yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument that the example of the non-observation of appearance is not established is also refuted because the convention is established by the mere observation of the object, and later, the convention is established by the indication of the object.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa ni med pa rnams kyi med pa grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa dngos po log pa ni med pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa ni med pa rnams kyi med pa grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa dngos po log pa ni med pa yin la /
translated: then the cessation of an entity is non-existence.

original: mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa log pa yin na ji ltar med pa @210a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa log pa yin na ji ltar med pa @210a * //
translated: And if non-apprehension is the cessation of non-apprehension, how can it be non-existence?

original: zhes brjod / gang yang dgag par bya ba yod pa dmigs pa'i ste bltar rung ba'i dmigs pa log pas kyang ji ltar med pa 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes brjod / gang yang dgag par bya ba yod pa dmigs pa'i ste bltar rung ba'i dmigs pa log pas kyang ji ltar med pa 'grub pa yin te /
translated: And how can the non-existence of an object of apprehension be established by the cessation of the apprehension of an existent object of apprehension, an object of apprehension that is suitable to be seen?

original: bltar rung ba yod pa'i shes pa ldog pa mi srid do //
analyzed: bltar rung ba yod pa'i shes pa ldog pa mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for the consciousness of an existent object of apprehension to cease.

original: gal te shes pa log par khas blangs na yang de yod pa ldog par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te shes pa log par khas blangs na yang de yod pa ldog par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if you accept that consciousness ceases, the cessation of that consciousness does not establish the cessation of the object of apprehension.

original: 'bras bu de la dmigs pa'i shes pa log pas rgyu de'i yul gyis don log ba ni mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu de la dmigs pa'i shes pa log pas rgyu de'i yul gyis don log ba ni mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: The cessation of the consciousness that apprehends the effect does not establish the cessation of the object of the cause.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu can de lta bu zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba dang shes pa gcig pa la 'drer rung ba'i phyogs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa dang / dbang po dang / bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid kyi don rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu can de lta bu zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba dang shes pa gcig pa la 'drer rung ba'i phyogs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa dang / dbang po dang / bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid kyi don rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch an object‚Äù is the object of negation and the cognition that is suitable to be mixed with it, and the directions, appearances, mental activity, sense faculties, and objects that are suitable to be seen.

original: de dag la dgag par 'dod pa'i don dang / de'i shes pa dag yod pa zhes gdags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag la dgag par 'dod pa'i don dang / de'i shes pa dag yod pa zhes gdags pa yin gyi /
translated: The object of negation and its cognition are designated as existent.

original: bltar rung ba de na yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bltar rung ba de na yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not existent in the sense of being suitable to be seen.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa med par 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa med par 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, non-observation is established.

original: ci'i phyir yod pa gdags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa gdags she na /
translated: Why is existence designated?

original: rgyu mtha' dag tshang ba la dmigs pa'i yod pa ste shes pa dang / de'i yul dag dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yod pa der mi 'khrul te nges par dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtha' dag tshang ba la dmigs pa'i yod pa ste shes pa dang / de'i yul dag dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yod pa der mi 'khrul te nges par dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When all the causes are complete, the existence of the object and its cognition are designated as existent. They are not mistaken with regard to the existent that is the nature of the object of observation, because they definitely become just the observation of that.

original: gal te rgyu tshogs pa yang rgyur 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir 'bras bu dmigs pa mi skyed pa srid pa'i phyir 'khrul pa srid pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩ'bras bu'i dus na ste 'bras bu byed par nus pa thogs pa med pas phyogs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa dmigs pa'i dus na dgag par 'dod pa yang shes pa de nyid skyed par nus pa thogs pa med par phyogs dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i
analyzed: gal te rgyu tshogs pa yang rgyur 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir 'bras bu dmigs pa mi skyed pa srid pa'i phyir 'khrul pa srid pa ma yin nam zhe na / 'bras bu'i dus na ste 'bras bu byed par nus pa thogs pa med pas phyogs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa dmigs pa'i dus na dgag par 'dod pa yang shes pa de nyid skyed par nus pa thogs pa med par phyogs dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i
translated: But if the cause is the assemblage, since it depends on the cause, it is possible that the effect is not generated, and so error is possible?üîΩWhen the effect exists, since the effect is unobstructedly able to generate itself, at the time of the object of apprehension of the effect, the object of apprehension of the consciousness of the effect, such as the direction, is also unobstructedly able to generate that consciousness itself, since it is similar to the effect.

original: phyir / rang gi 'bras bu shes pa yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyir / rang gi 'bras bu shes pa yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the effect existed, then the object of apprehension of the consciousness of the effect, such as the direction, would be unobstructedly able to generate its effect, the consciousness.

original: da ltar 'bras bu med na de lta bu don rang gi shes pa skyed par nus pa thogs pa med pa can yang med par mi dmigs pas 'grub bo //üîΩgal te de na dgag par bya ba yod kyang rnal 'byor pa la sogs pa'i mthu'i bye brag gi byin gyi rlabs kyis rang gi shes pa mi skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar 'bras bu med na de lta bu don rang gi shes pa skyed par nus pa thogs pa med pa can yang med par mi dmigs pas 'grub bo //üîΩgal te de na dgag par bya ba yod kyang rnal 'byor pa la sogs pa'i mthu'i bye brag gi byin gyi rlabs kyis rang gi shes pa mi skyed do zhe na /
translated: But if the effect does not exist now, then since it is not observed to exist without being unobstructedly able to generate its effect, the consciousness, it is established that it does not exist.üîΩBut if the object of apprehension of the effect, such as the direction, exists, then the object of apprehension of the consciousness of the effect, such as the direction, would be unobstructedly able to generate its effect, the consciousness.üîΩBut if the object of apprehension of the effect, such as the direction, does not exist, then the object of apprehension of the consciousness of the effect, such as the direction, would not be unobstructedly able to generate its effect, the consciousness.üîΩBut if the object of apprehension of the effect, such as the direction, exists, then the object of apprehension of the consciousness of the effect, such as the direction, would be unobstructedly able to generate its effect, the consciousness.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is stated.

original: rang gi dmigs pa skyed par nus pa thogs pa med pa'i dus na ni rang gi shes pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin du grub zin pa'i phyir mthu'i yul las dbang po gzhan du bya bar nus te /
analyzed: rang gi dmigs pa skyed par nus pa thogs pa med pa'i dus na ni rang gi shes pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin du grub zin pa'i phyir mthu'i yul las dbang po gzhan du bya bar nus te /
translated: When the object is capable of producing its object, it is established as the nature of producing its consciousness. Therefore, it is not possible for the object to be transformed into a sense faculty.

original: nus pa thogs pa med par rang gi bdag nyid grub zin pa'i phyir de don @210b yod na rang gi shes pa skyed do //
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med par rang gi bdag nyid grub zin pa'i phyir de don @210b yod na rang gi shes pa skyed do //
translated: Because the object is established as the nature of unobstructed potential, if the object exists, it produces its consciousness.

original: gal te dus phyis yul lam dbang po byin gyi rlabs kyis 'dus byas na yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te dus phyis yul lam dbang po byin gyi rlabs kyis 'dus byas na yang ngo //
translated: If the object or sense faculty is transformed through the power of karma at a later time, it is the same.

original: de lta na yang nus pa thogs pa med pa'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang nus pa thogs pa med pa'i don ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it is not the case that the object is unobstructed potential.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyis bsgyur du rung ba ni nus pa thogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin ma thob ba yin gyi thob na ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la gags mi nus pas so //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyis bsgyur du rung ba ni nus pa thogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin ma thob ba yin gyi thob na ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la gags mi nus pas so //
translated: That which can be transformed through the power of karma is not the nature of unobstructed potential. If it were obtained, it would not be possible to obstruct the production of its result.

original: des na shes pa dang de'i yul dgag par bya ba'i don ni yod par gdags pas yod pa yin la /
analyzed: des na shes pa dang de'i yul dgag par bya ba'i don ni yod par gdags pas yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object that is to be refuted by consciousness exists because it is designated as existent.

original: de dag log pa ni mi dmigs pa'i med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag log pa ni mi dmigs pa'i med pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of those is the non-apprehension of non-existence.

original: de lta bas na dmigs pa yang med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dmigs pa yang med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the object is said to be non-existent.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni mtha'i tshogs pa ni 'bras bu 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni mtha'i tshogs pa ni 'bras bu 'khrul pa med de /
translated: By that alone means that the final collection is not mistaken with regard to the effect,

original: 'bras bu dang ldan pas bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ldan pas bstan pas so //
translated: because it is taught to possess the effect.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu med par yod pa yang srid bas dmigs pa med pa yul med pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i lan yang rab tu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu med par yod pa yang srid bas dmigs pa med pa yul med pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i lan yang rab tu brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is possible for a cause to exist without an effect, the non-establishment of the non-apprehension of the objectless is also fully stated as the answer to that.

original: rgyu mtshan can gzhan ni lkog shal la sogs pa ba lang gi rgyu mtshan log nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni le'u gsum pa las so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can gzhan ni lkog shal la sogs pa ba lang gi rgyu mtshan log nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni le'u gsum pa las so //
translated: The other reason is the reason for the cow, such as the dewlap, which is to be explained as ceased.

original: gzhan dag 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i rtags kyis dgag pa go bar 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i rtags kyis dgag pa go bar 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Others say contradictory means that the negation by a reason other than non-apprehension is understood to be the object of negation. In order to eliminate that,

original: ji srid cung zad dgag ba de thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji srid cung zad dgag ba de thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says as long as there is any negation, all of that....

original: dpyod pa pa gang dag lus dang blo thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba dag gis thams cad mkhyen ba dag 'dod chags dang bral ba dag 'gog par byed pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir yang 'gal ba ngag bshad do //üîΩyang rgyu yang ma yin la khyab par byed pa yang ma yin pa rang gi dmigs pa log pas kyang dgag par byed pa de bsal ba'i phyir rgyu dang khyab par byed pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dpyod pa pa gang dag lus dang blo thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba dag gis thams cad mkhyen ba dag 'dod chags dang bral ba dag 'gog par byed pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir yang 'gal ba ngag bshad do // yang rgyu yang ma yin la khyab par byed pa yang ma yin pa rang gi dmigs pa log pas kyang dgag par byed pa de bsal ba'i phyir rgyu dang khyab par byed pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: The analysis of the non-pervasion of the reason is the analysis of the reason that is not pervaded by the property of the thesis.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the thesis or in the example.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the property of the thesis is the analysis of the property of the thesis that is not established in the example.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject and the example is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject or in the example.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject and the thesis is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject or in the thesis.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the example and the thesis is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the example or in the thesis.

original: skad cig la dbyer med pas so zhes bya bas ni mtha'i tshogs pa ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir skyed pa ma yin par byar med de rang nyid grub pa'i phyir la /üîΩrang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur du rung na ni de mtha'i rang bzhin du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig la dbyer med pas so zhes bya bas ni mtha'i tshogs pa ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir skyed pa ma yin par byar med de rang nyid grub pa'i phyir la /üîΩrang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur du rung na ni de mtha'i rang bzhin du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject, the example, and the thesis is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject, the example, or the thesis.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject and the example by way of the three modes of non-establishment is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject or in the example by way of the three modes of non-establishment.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject and the thesis by way of the three modes of non-establishment is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject or in the thesis by way of the three modes of non-establishment.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the example and the thesis by way of the three modes of non-establishment is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the example or in the thesis by way of the three modes of non-establishment.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject, the example, and the thesis by way of the three modes of non-establishment is the analysis of the reason that is not established in the subject, the example, or the thesis by way of the three modes of non-establishment.üîΩThe analysis of the non-establishment of the reason in the subject, the example, and the thesis

original: mtha'i tshogs pa skad cig ni bsgyur du med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan du bsgyur ba cung zad kyang mi byed na ni gags su yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha'i tshogs pa skad cig ni bsgyur du med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan du bsgyur ba cung zad kyang mi byed na ni gags su yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the final collection of causes is momentary and cannot be changed, it does not act as an obstruction at all.

original: @211a * // rtags bzhi par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa de yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du 'dus par brjod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @211a * // rtags bzhi par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa de yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du 'dus par brjod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The fourth reason is included in the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature, because it is a non-apprehension of the object itself.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are only the non-apprehension of appearance.

original: 'dir med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúHere, non-existence, etc.‚Äù

original: bltar rung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de rnams dang 'gal ba dag dbang po dang shes pa dang / snang ba zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan nye ba ste bltar rung ba kho na dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ma grub pa dang /
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de rnams dang 'gal ba dag dbang po dang shes pa dang / snang ba zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan nye ba ste bltar rung ba kho na dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ma grub pa dang /
translated: The causes and effects that are suitable to appear are incompatible with the other causes of apprehension, such as the sense faculties, consciousness, and light, which are called the causes of appearance. It should be understood that non-establishment of cause and effect, etc.,

original: 'gal bar grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gal bar grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: and establishment of incompatibility occur only in those that are suitable to appear.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni bltar mi rung ba'o ;
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni bltar mi rung ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù are those that are not suitable to appear.

original: / de dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: / de dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase they have the nature of cause and effect is supplied.

original: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase they have the nature of a relation is supplied.

original: 'gal ba med pa zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa zhes sbyar te /
translated: The phrase they are not contradictory is supplied.

original: gzhan med pa ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan med pa ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase they are not other is supplied.

original: de dag mi 'grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag mi 'grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase they are not established is supplied.

original: blta bya ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blta bya ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of seeing is a pot, etc.

original: mthong ba med pa'i rgyu ni dbang po'am yid la byed pa'am snang ba dag ma tshang na /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa'i rgyu ni dbang po'am yid la byed pa'am snang ba dag ma tshang na /
translated: The cause of not seeing is the incompleteness of any one of the three: the sense faculty, the attention, or the light.

original: dgag bar 'dod pa'i don bskal pa'o //
analyzed: dgag bar 'dod pa'i don bskal pa'o //
translated: The object of negation is a thing that is to be negated.

original: de dag mi srid pa ni rgyu de dag tshang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag mi srid pa ni rgyu de dag tshang ba'o //
translated: The impossibility of those is the completeness of those causes.

original: de lta bu'i yod pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pas ni dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur gyi blta bya'i mthong ba med pa'i rgyu gang yang rung ba yod pa mi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yod pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pas ni dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur gyi blta bya'i mthong ba med pa'i rgyu gang yang rung ba yod pa mi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of such existent things causes the understanding of non-existence, but not the non-apprehension of the existence of any one of the causes of not seeing the object of seeing.

original: mtha'i skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is the final moment, it is direct perception. This means that if it were so, there would be the observation of a contradiction in nature.

original: nus pa thogs pa'i rgyu gang yod pa'i phyir grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa'i rgyu gang yod pa'i phyir grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: Because there is an obstructing cause of the ability, there is no cold sensation.

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the cause of understanding is not understood.

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir bshad pa'i rim pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yang gzhan du bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir bshad pa'i rim pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yang gzhan du bshad mod kyi /
translated: The ten types are due to the distinction of application. Although the observation of the pervasion by contradiction of the order explained here is explained elsewhere,

original: 'dir ma bshad de le'u gsum pa las skabs su bab pa na ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ma bshad de le'u gsum pa las skabs su bab pa na ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not explained here because it will be taught when the occasion arises in the third chapter.

original: 'gal 'bras la yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang 'bras bu rtags dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'gal 'bras la yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang 'bras bu rtags dag la yang ngo //
translated: The word also in the phrase ‚Äúin the case of contradictory effects‚Äù refers to the observation of the effect of a contradictory cause and the effect as a reason.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa gang gis kyang ma dmigs pa de ji ltar mi rigs ba las med pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa gang gis kyang ma dmigs pa de ji ltar mi rigs ba las med pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not perceived by any of the three times, how can it be non-existent?

original: thams cad ces bya ba dus gsum pa'i skyes bu thams cad kya dmigs pa @211b log pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa 'dir rtags ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba dus gsum pa'i skyes bu thams cad kya dmigs pa @211b log pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa 'dir rtags ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to all persons of the three times. The non-perception of appearance is not a reason here,

original: de lta bu'i rtags ni rgol ba bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi phyir rgol ba gnyi gas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtags ni rgol ba bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi phyir rgol ba gnyi gas mi rtogs so //
translated: because such a reason is not understood by either the proponent himself or the opponent.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pas 'dir bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa nyid gang 'gog pa'i tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pas 'dir bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa nyid gang 'gog pa'i tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, non-perception is not a valid means of knowledge here to refute the mere cessation of one‚Äôs own perception.

original: bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa ma yin pa bskal pa na yod pa ni mi dmigs kyang yod pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa ma yin pa bskal pa na yod pa ni mi dmigs kyang yod pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if one‚Äôs own perception does not exist and is non-existent, it is not non-existent.

original: gal te yod pa de la yang mngon sum 'jug go //üîΩde lta ma yin yang rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yod pa de la yang mngon sum 'jug go // de lta ma yin yang rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: If it exists, direct perception engages it.üîΩEven if it does not exist in that way, inference engages it.

original: de lta ma yin yang lung 'jug ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin yang lung 'jug ste /
translated: Even if it does not exist in that way, scripture engages it.

original: rig byed las ston par 'gyur na gang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rig byed las ston par 'gyur na gang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it were taught in the Vedas, it would not exist because those who are free from attachment and so on do not do that.

original: ma yin te re zhig bstan bcos te lung ni skyes bu'i don sgrub pa'i thabs cung zad la brten nas 'jug ste /üîΩskyes bu la mkho ba ma yin pa ni yang dag par ma 'brel par 'gyur bas chad ma ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin te re zhig bstan bcos te lung ni skyes bu'i don sgrub pa'i thabs cung zad la brten nas 'jug ste / skyes bu la mkho ba ma yin pa ni yang dag par ma 'brel par 'gyur bas chad ma ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: That is not so. First, treatises or scriptures are engaged for the sake of the means of accomplishing a human goal.

original: 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not necessary for a human is not connected to the treatise because it is not related to the purpose.

original: skyes bu'i don bsgrub pa de la yang de'i skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i don ma yin pa mang ber nges par ston pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don bsgrub pa de la yang de'i skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i don ma yin pa mang ber nges par ston pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not necessary to teach what is not related to the purpose of accomplishing a human goal.
