original: ji ltar gling stong ba na yod ba'i 'bras bu dang / me tog la sogs pa so sor nges pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gling stong ba na yod ba'i 'bras bu dang / me tog la sogs pa so sor nges pa ste /
translated: Just as one does not gather fruit and flowers that exist on an empty island, one should not teach what is not related to the purpose.

original: gzhan dang ma 'brel pa'i bdag nyid gang dag dang ; skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi 'jug pa dag tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang ma 'brel pa'i bdag nyid gang dag dang ; skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi 'jug pa dag tha dad pa ste /
translated: The mind of a person engages in specific objects.

original: 'dod pa sna tshogs pa de ltar 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig tu nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa sna tshogs pa de ltar 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig tu nges pa med pa ste /
translated: The reason for engaging in the various desires is not ascertained as one.

original: sngon goms pa dang / yul gyi dbang dang / grogs po dang 'bad pa dag la sogs pa sna tshogs par nges pa med pas de dag gis don bsgrub pa'i thabs kyang mi mthun pa cung zad tsam yang med do //
analyzed: sngon goms pa dang / yul gyi dbang dang / grogs po dang 'bad pa dag la sogs pa sna tshogs par nges pa med pas de dag gis don bsgrub pa'i thabs kyang mi mthun pa cung zad tsam yang med do //
translated: Since there is no certainty in the various things such as prior habituation, the power of the object, friends, and exertion, there is not even the slightest disagreement about the means of accomplishing the purpose.

original: de lta bu'i don rnams dus dang yul gyi rnam bar gzhag pas tha dad pa dag skabs su bab par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don rnams dus dang yul gyi rnam bar gzhag pas tha dad pa dag skabs su bab par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Such purposes, which are different due to the arrangement of time and place, are not appropriate in the present context.

original: de dag ni skabs su mi dgos pa'i phyir ram yang na de dag gi rdzas kyi bye brag so sor nges par bstan par mi nus pa'o//
analyzed: de dag ni skabs su mi dgos pa'i phyir ram yang na de dag gi rdzas kyi bye brag so sor nges par bstan par mi nus pa'o//
translated: Because they are not necessary in the present context, or else their specific substances cannot be individually ascertained and taught.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni bstan bcos kyis bstan pa'i yul du mi byed pa'i phyir bstan bcos log bas med par mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni bstan bcos kyis bstan pa'i yul du mi byed pa'i phyir bstan bcos log bas med par mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since they are not made the object of teaching in the treatise, they are not established as nonexistent due to the treatise being incorrect.

original: don so sor nges ba mtha' yas bde rnams ni bskal pa yin pas rang gi don shes pa la nye bar 'jog par nus pa ma yin pas mngon sum gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa na @212a * //üîΩyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don so sor nges ba mtha' yas bde rnams ni bskal pa yin pas rang gi don shes pa la nye bar 'jog par nus pa ma yin pas mngon sum gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa na @212a * // yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is possible to posit the knowledge of one‚Äôs own meaning.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mngon sum log kyang med pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mngon sum log kyang med pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates that even if direct perception is refuted, nonexistence is not established,

original: yul du mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes snga ma ltar sbyar ba ston to //
analyzed: yul du mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes snga ma ltar sbyar ba ston to //
translated: because it does not take the object as its object.

original: 'byung ba la tshad ma med do zhes mi 'gegs kyi 'on kyang tshad ma srid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba la tshad ma med do zhes mi 'gegs kyi 'on kyang tshad ma srid do //
translated: It is not refuted that there is no valid knowledge in regard to the elements, but rather that valid knowledge is possible.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma mthong ba'i phyir spang bar mi 'os so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma mthong ba'i phyir spang bar mi 'os so zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is not appropriate to reject it because valid knowledge is seen.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag bar mi nus pa des na dgag par bya ba 'dir tshu rol mthong ba'i mthong ba ni rang bzhin gyi don nam 'brel pa'i don dag gis mthong ba zin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag bar mi nus pa des na dgag par bya ba 'dir tshu rol mthong ba'i mthong ba ni rang bzhin gyi don nam 'brel pa'i don dag gis mthong ba zin pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it is not possible to refute it merely by not seeing it, the seeing of those who see only a part here in this refutation is not the seeing of the object of nature or the object of relation.

original: thams cad nges par mi nus pa'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba na nges par 'byung bar 'gyur yang rgyu mthong ba tsam gyis nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa na 'byung ba'i shes par byed pa ma grub po //
analyzed: thams cad nges par mi nus pa'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba na nges par 'byung bar 'gyur yang rgyu mthong ba tsam gyis nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa na 'byung ba'i shes par byed pa ma grub po //
translated: Because it is not certain that all effects arise from all causes, when an effect arises from a cause, it is certain to arise, but it is not certain that it arises merely from seeing the cause. Therefore, the effect that will arise in the future is not established as an object of knowledge.

original: des na mthong ba 'di tsam gyis 'bras bu de ma 'ongs pa na 'byung ba med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na mthong ba 'di tsam gyis 'bras bu de ma 'ongs pa na 'byung ba med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the effect that will arise in the future does not exist due to merely seeing this much.

original: sngar ma mthong ba gang dag gi yang brgyud de phyis 'bras bu 'byung ba gsal bar 'gyur ba mthong bas so //
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba gang dag gi yang brgyud de phyis 'bras bu 'byung ba gsal bar 'gyur ba mthong bas so //
translated: Because it is seen that the effect that will arise later in a continuum is manifest, even though it was not seen before.

original: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pas med pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pas med pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, nonexistence is not established by the absence of direct perception and inference.

original: lung gi sgra yang med pa go bar mi byed do zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: lung gi sgra yang med pa go bar mi byed do zhes sbyar te /
translated: The term scripture also does not make nonexistence understood.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la sgra ni dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du nges par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la sgra ni dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du nges par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because sound does not definitely engage in accordance with things.

original: brjod par 'dod pa de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa de ma thag pa ste /
translated: The immediately preceding object of expression.

original: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin connection with‚Äù is ‚Äúrelated to.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dod pa dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If one engages in desire just as it is,

original: skyes bu 'dod pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then one should say, ‚ÄúA person who desires all things . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ji lta ba bzhin gyi don mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni chags pa dang g-yo ba la sogs ba nyes pa zad par bsdu'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin gyi don mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni chags pa dang g-yo ba la sogs ba nyes pa zad par bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äújust as it is‚Äù and so on include the faults of attachment, agitation, and so on.

original: gal te skyes bu de lta bu'i bye brag shes par nus na 'di lta bu'i skyes bu tshig 'di yis don phyin ci ma log par ston to zhes kho bo yang 'dod ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu de lta bu'i bye brag shes par nus na 'di lta bu'i skyes bu tshig 'di yis don phyin ci ma log par ston to zhes kho bo yang 'dod ba nyid do //
translated: If one is able to know the distinctions of such a person, then I also accept that such a person, by these words, teaches the meaning without error.

original: de lta bas na rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis lung de la 'jug par 'dod pas lung yid ches par bya ba yin nam ma yin rtog par byed la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis lung de la 'jug par 'dod pas lung yid ches par bya ba yin nam ma yin rtog par byed la /
translated: Therefore, those who proceed with analysis, who wish to engage with that scripture, analyze whether that scripture is credible or not.

original: brtags nas rnam par dag pa'i lung la 'jug par byed pa ni don med pa'i ngal ba dang mi 'dod pa gzhan dang phrad pas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: brtags nas rnam par dag pa'i lung la 'jug par byed pa ni don med pa'i ngal ba dang mi 'dod pa gzhan dang phrad pas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Having examined, one should enter into the pure scriptures, so that one will not be afflicted by useless fatigue and by the contact with other undesirable things.

original: lung gis rang gi rang bzhin brtags pas stong ste /
analyzed: lung gis rang gi rang bzhin brtags pas stong ste /
translated: The scriptures are empty of the nature that is imagined by them.

original: lung de'i skyes bu brtags te 'jug par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: lung de'i skyes bu brtags te 'jug par byed pa na'o //
translated: When one examines the person who is the author of those scriptures and enters into them.

original: nyes pa @212b zad pa la sogs pa de lta bu ni sems kyi chos yin pas rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i phyir shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa @212b zad pa la sogs pa de lta bu ni sems kyi chos yin pas rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i phyir shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Such faults as being exhausted are mental phenomena, and so cannot be known because they are naturally secluded.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rtags med do //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rtags med do //
translated: Because they are beyond the senses, there is no natural sign.

original: rang las skyes bzhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bras bu'i rtags med par ston to //
analyzed: rang las skyes bzhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bras bu'i rtags med par ston to //
translated: By ‚Äúthere is no effect sign, etc.‚Äù he shows that there is no effect sign.

original: bsam pa sngon du btang ste zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi tha snyad kyi skyes bu 'dod pas 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam pa sngon du btang ste zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi tha snyad kyi skyes bu 'dod pas 'jug go //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a thought beforehand‚Äù means that one enters into the person who is the author of the conventions of body and speech, desiring him.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba dang chags pa can rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba dang chags pa can rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the detached and the attached.

original: bsam pa sna tshogs pa ste dgos pa'i dbang gis chags pa dang bral ba dag kyang chags pa can ltar g-yo la /
analyzed: bsam pa sna tshogs pa ste dgos pa'i dbang gis chags pa dang bral ba dag kyang chags pa can ltar g-yo la /
translated: Various thoughts are the various thoughts of the mind.üîΩ

original: chags pa can dag kyang cig shos ltar g-yos pas so //
analyzed: chags pa can dag kyang cig shos ltar g-yos pas so //
translated: and various intentions, because of the power of the need, even those free from attachment are like those with attachment, and those with attachment are like the other.

original: de ltar na yid ches pas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i lung gi tshad ma nyid bsal to //
analyzed: de ltar na yid ches pas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i lung gi tshad ma nyid bsal to //
translated: Thus, the validity of scripture called ‚Äúteaching by one who is trustworthy‚Äù is refuted.

original: yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi lung rig byed tshad mar 'dod pa dgag par bzhed nas /
analyzed: yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi lung rig byed tshad mar 'dod pa dgag par bzhed nas /
translated: Moreover, wishing to refute the assertion that the Veda is a valid means of knowledge because it is not made by a person,

original: gal te skyes bu la brten pa'i ngag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu la brten pa'i ngag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf speech depends on a person . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: skyes bu lung phog par ni brda bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu lung phog par ni brda bstan pa'o //
translated: The person is the one to whom the scripture is imparted; the sign is the teaching.

original: de la ltos pa yang yin gyi sgra tsam gyis ni ma yin no //üîΩgang yang rig byed ni rtag pa nyid du 'dod na rtag tu dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de la ltos pa yang yin gyi sgra tsam gyis ni ma yin no // gang yang rig byed ni rtag pa nyid du 'dod na rtag tu dmigs pa'am /
translated: It depends on that, not on mere sound.

original: yang na mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: yang na mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the Veda is asserted to be permanent, it would be perceived at all times, or it would not be perceived at all.

original: de lta yang ma yin te res 'ga' bar dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te res 'ga' bar dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa nyid med do //
translated: But that is not the case, because it is perceived only occasionally. Therefore it is not permanent.

original: gal te rtag tu yod pa nyid yin mod kyi dmigs par rigs pa'i gnas skabs na ni dmigs la de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag tu yod pa nyid yin mod kyi dmigs par rigs pa'i gnas skabs na ni dmigs la de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is always existent, but is perceived when it is in a state that is suitable to be perceived, and is not perceived when it is in a state that is not suitable to be perceived,

original: dmigs pa'i tshe dmigs par rigs pa'i bdag nyid 'thob la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshe dmigs par rigs pa'i bdag nyid 'thob la /
translated: then when it is perceived, it acquires the nature of being suitable to be perceived.

original: dmigs par mi rigs pa de'i bdag nyid btang ngo //
analyzed: dmigs par mi rigs pa de'i bdag nyid btang ngo //
translated: It abandons the nature of being unsuitable to be perceived.

original: mi dmigs pa de'i tshe ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de'i tshe ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: When it is not perceived, it acquires the nature of being unsuitable to be perceived.

original: de ltar 'thob pa dang gtong ba dag las rang bzhin gzhan skye ba dang nyams pa zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin gyi de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'thob pa dang gtong ba dag las rang bzhin gzhan skye ba dang nyams pa zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin gyi de dag nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that something different from the nature of the self arises or is lost through acquisition and abandonment.

original: de'i phyir rig byed mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //üîΩgal te rtag na res 'ga' dmigs pa med par thob par 'gyur bas mi rtag pa log na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed mi rtag pa nyid du grub po // gal te rtag na res 'ga' dmigs pa med par thob par 'gyur bas mi rtag pa log na /
translated: Therefore, it is established that the Vedas are impermanent.

original: res 'ga' dmigs pa ldog par ston to //
analyzed: res 'ga' dmigs pa ldog par ston to //
translated: If they were permanent, they would be perceived at all times, and the claim that they are sometimes perceived and sometimes not perceived would be contradicted.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not perceived because they depend on the cooperating conditions,

original: lhan cig byed ba des rig byed rtag pa'i phyir bdag nyid bogs byar med pa de la cung zad kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: lhan cig byed ba des rig byed rtag pa'i phyir bdag nyid bogs byar med pa de la cung zad kyang mi byed do //
translated: Since the self is not enhanced by the cooperating conditions, it does not do anything at all.

original: gal te rig byed las gzhan pa'i khyad par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed las gzhan pa'i khyad par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it produces a difference from the perceptible,

original: rig byed las khyad par gzhan @213a * //
analyzed: rig byed las khyad par gzhan @213a * //
translated: then it does not make the slightest difference to the perceptible.

original: ba zhig byed pa ni rig byed de dang khyad par gzhan de 'brel pa mi rigs pa'i phyir rig byed la ci yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: ba zhig byed pa ni rig byed de dang khyad par gzhan de 'brel pa mi rigs pa'i phyir rig byed la ci yang khyad par med do //
translated: It is not reasonable that a difference from the perceptible is connected with that perceptible, because it is not reasonable that a difference from that perceptible is connected with that difference.

original: gal te 'brel pa med par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa med par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it known that they are not connected?,‚Äù

original: de dang 'brel pa yang phan pas yin na rig byed rtag pa'i phyir phan pa byed pa ma yin pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir khyad par phan par bya ba ma yin pa dag ci zhig 'brel /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa yang phan pas yin na rig byed rtag pa'i phyir phan pa byed pa ma yin pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir khyad par phan par bya ba ma yin pa dag ci zhig 'brel /
translated: the connection is for the purpose of benefit. Since the perceptible is permanent, it does not benefit. And for that very reason, what is the connection between the perceptible and that which is not benefited?

original: rtag pa de'i bdag nyid kyis phan pa ni mi nus so //
analyzed: rtag pa de'i bdag nyid kyis phan pa ni mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible for that permanent self to benefit.

original: rig byed de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyis phan par byed na yang rig byed kyis phan pa byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig byed de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyis phan par byed na yang rig byed kyis phan pa byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If another person who is different from the object of knowledge benefits it, then it is not the object of knowledge that benefits it.

original: de'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa mtshungs so ;
analyzed: de'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa mtshungs so ;
translated: Therefore, it would not be a specific object of knowledge.

original: / gal te phan pa de'i phan pa rig byed kyis byas so zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te phan pa de'i phan pa rig byed kyis byas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the benefit is the benefit of the object of knowledge,

original: de la yang rig byed bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang rig byed bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: then the object of knowledge does not benefit itself.

original: rtag pa'i phyir de las gzhan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir de las gzhan par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is different from that, it is permanent.

original: de la yang phan pa dang don gzhan pa brtag par bya dgos pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang phan pa dang don gzhan pa brtag par bya dgos pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is different from that, then you must investigate whether it is different from the benefit, and so on, and so there would be an infinite regress.

original: gang zhig res 'ga' ba skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de ni skyes bus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig res 'ga' ba skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de ni skyes bus byas pa yin te /
translated: That which is sometimes generated in accordance with the desire of a person is created by a person.

original: de'i phyir sgra ni res 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyes bus byas par ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra ni res 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyes bus byas par ston te /
translated: Therefore, sometimes, etc. shows that sound is created by a person.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is definitely concomitant with the activity of a person.

original: skyes bus byas par 'dod pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bus byas par 'dod pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: like a treatise composed by a person.

original: rig byed kyang res 'ga' ba nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: rig byed kyang res 'ga' ba nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: The proof is stated: ‚ÄúBecause the Vedas also sometimes follow the desires of a person.‚Äù

original: skyes bus brdar byas pa las gzhan du na yang sgra rnams don dang med na mi 'byung ba med pas rang las gzhan pa'i don du bas me rtogs pa lta bu ni med do //
analyzed: skyes bus brdar byas pa las gzhan du na yang sgra rnams don dang med na mi 'byung ba med pas rang las gzhan pa'i don du bas me rtogs pa lta bu ni med do //
translated: Apart from being created by the convention of a person, since words do not have a meaning that is not shared, there is no understanding of a specific meaning, like the word fire.

original: da ni sgra dang don rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa lung gi tshang mar 'dod pa brtag pa'i phyir sgra yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni sgra dang don rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa lung gi tshang mar 'dod pa brtag pa'i phyir sgra yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Now, in order to analyze the assertion that words and meanings are related by nature through scripture, he says, ‚ÄúIf the existence of the word . . .‚Äù

original: gal te don med na sgra mi 'byung ba'i phyir sgra yod pa nyid kyis don gyi bye brag dang 'brel to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don med na sgra mi 'byung ba'i phyir sgra yod pa nyid kyis don gyi bye brag dang 'brel to zhe na /
translated: If the meaning does not exist, since the word does not occur, the existence of the word is related to the particular meaning.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: sgra'i yod pa nyid tsam ni don thams cad kyi 'brel pa de bye brag med pa'i phyir bye brag gi don mtshon par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i yod pa nyid tsam ni don thams cad kyi 'brel pa de bye brag med pa'i phyir bye brag gi don mtshon par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the mere existence of the word is related to all meanings without distinction, a particular meaning will not be indicated.

original: gal te dpyod pa pa dag /
analyzed: gal te dpyod pa pa dag /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say:

original: ji ltar dbang rnams don gyis na //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang rnams don gyis na //
translated: Just as the sense faculties are related to their objects

original: rung bas thog ma med nas 'brel //
analyzed: rung bas thog ma med nas 'brel //
translated: through suitability from beginningless time,

original: de bzhin sgra rnams don rnams kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin sgra rnams don rnams kyis //
translated: so are words related to their referents

original: rung bas thog ma med nas 'brel //üîΩzhes byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: rung bas thog ma med nas 'brel // zhes byas pa yin pas /
translated: through suitability from beginningless time.

original: gal te dbang po dang don bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te dbang po dang don bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If it is like that, then why is it said that it is like the sense faculties and objects?

original: gal te dbang po'i don las ji ltar skye @213b zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i don las ji ltar skye @213b zhe na ;
translated: If it is asked how it arises from the object of the sense faculty,

original: don de las phan pa byas pa'i dbang po ni rang gi shes pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po de lta bu'i don las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: don de las phan pa byas pa'i dbang po ni rang gi shes pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po de lta bu'i don las skyes pa'o //
translated: the sense faculty that has benefited from that object generates its own consciousness, so it arises from the object of that kind of sense faculty.

original: de las ma skyes na ni yul gzhan med kyang rang gi yul las shes pa skyed pa ltar rang gi yul med kyang rang gi shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ma skyes na ni yul gzhan med kyang rang gi yul las shes pa skyed pa ltar rang gi yul med kyang rang gi shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not arise from that, then even without another object, just as it generates consciousness from its own object, it would generate its own consciousness even without its own object.

original: ci'i phyir rang gi yul de phan pa byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi yul de phan pa byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that own object a benefit?üîΩTo demonstrate that it cannot be refuted in direct perception,

original: mngon sum la bsnyon par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum la bsnyon par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: 'di la dngos po'i rang bzhin lan 'debs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di la dngos po'i rang bzhin lan 'debs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe nature of things is not the answer.‚Äù

original: de med par zhes bya ba rig byed rtag pa'i phyir don las skye ba de med pas so //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba rig byed rtag pa'i phyir don las skye ba de med pas so //
translated: The nature of things is not the answer, because the Vedas are eternal, and the meaning of the Vedas is not derived from things.

original: sgra'ang don 'di'i sgra 'di zhes bya bar mi 'grub la /
analyzed: sgra'ang don 'di'i sgra 'di zhes bya bar mi 'grub la /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of a word is not established as the sound of that word.

original: don kyang sgra la nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don kyang sgra la nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the word established as the meaning.

original: gal te ming gi sgra gang yang don las skye ba med ba'i phyir sgra thams cad kyis don brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ming gi sgra gang yang don las skye ba med ba'i phyir sgra thams cad kyis don brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the sound of a word is not derived from the meaning, then all words would not express a meaning.

original: rab tu sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni 'di'i ming 'di'o zhes sam 'di'i sgra 'di'o zhes brda rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir sgra de ni don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni 'di'i ming 'di'o zhes sam 'di'i sgra 'di'o zhes brda rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir sgra de ni don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe word is applied,‚Äù because the word is applied to the meaning by the convention ‚Äúthis is its name‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is its sound.‚Äù

original: lus kyi rig byed bzhin te kho bo mdzub mo 'greng ba na don 'dir go bar gyis shig ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rig byed bzhin te kho bo mdzub mo 'greng ba na don 'dir go bar gyis shig ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The word is applied to the meaning, just as a bodily gesture is applied to the meaning. For example, one raises a finger to indicate that one understands the meaning.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyal po rtags la sogs pa rtags mtshan gzhan dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyal po rtags la sogs pa rtags mtshan gzhan dag gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to other signs, such as the king‚Äôs flag.

original: brda'i dus kyis don de las 'ongs pa ma yin pa ni brngam byas pa'o //
analyzed: brda'i dus kyis don de las 'ongs pa ma yin pa ni brngam byas pa'o //
translated: The meaning does not come from that which is the sign, because it is not made.

original: yang na de las 'ongs pa ma yin pa ni brjod par 'dod pa de las ma 'ongs ba ste /
analyzed: yang na de las 'ongs pa ma yin pa ni brjod par 'dod pa de las ma 'ongs ba ste /
translated: Or, it does not come from that, because it does not come from what is intended to be expressed.

original: brjod par 'dod pa las ma skyes pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa las ma skyes pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound is not produced from what is intended to be expressed.

original: des brdar ma byas pa'i sgra'i don go bar mi nus te /
analyzed: des brdar ma byas pa'i sgra'i don go bar mi nus te /
translated: One cannot understand the meaning of a sound that is not used as a sign.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni skyes bu la sogs pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni skyes bu la sogs pas so //
translated: Space, etc., are not used as signs by beings, etc.

original: gal te sgra rnams kyi ngo bo don gad las skyes pas de de la nges pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa byed pa'i nus pa las 'de'o de'o zhes go bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams kyi ngo bo don gad las skyes pas de de la nges pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa byed pa'i nus pa las 'de'o de'o zhes go bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If the nature of sounds is produced from the meaning, then it is not ascertained in that, but rather it is understood that it is from the capacity to produce consciousness.

original: nus pa de yang don yod na yod la med na med pa dag gi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin de dag gis don dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nus pa de yang don yod na yod la med na med pa dag gi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin de dag gis don dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: That capacity exists when the meaning exists and does not exist when it does not exist. The nature of those is related to the meaning by those natures.

original: gzhan du don med kyang nus pa yod na ni 'brel par mi nus pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid mi gtong ste /
analyzed: gzhan du don med kyang nus pa yod na ni 'brel par mi nus pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid mi gtong ste /
translated: Otherwise, if the capacity exists even when the meaning does not exist, it cannot be related, because it does not relinquish its nature as an effect.

original: 'bras bu gzhan du ba la sogs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan du ba la sogs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The characteristics of the effect, such as smoke, are also different.

original: don de las zhes bya ba ni sgra las gzhan pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: don de las zhes bya ba ni sgra las gzhan pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: From that object means from the power other than the word.

original: de las don shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las don shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of the object arises from that.

original: don dang sgra'i 'brel pa yang mi 'grub ste /üîΩsgra las gzhan pa'i nus pas don go bar byed @214a * //
analyzed: don dang sgra'i 'brel pa yang mi 'grub ste / sgra las gzhan pa'i nus pas don go bar byed @214a * //
translated: The connection between the object and the word is also not established,

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is understood through the power other than the word.

original: ma 'brel ba go bar byed pa ma yin ba de'i phyir don thams cad kyi dus thams cad du go bar byed pa gang na nges ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid ni rang gi rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa can gyi skyed par byed pa'i dngos po snang
analyzed: ma 'brel ba go bar byed pa ma yin ba de'i phyir don thams cad kyi dus thams cad du go bar byed pa gang na nges ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid ni rang gi rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa can gyi skyed par byed pa'i dngos po snang
translated: That which does not connect does not convey the meaning. Therefore, the nature of conveying all objects at all times is the nature of its own cause, which is the nature of the producer.

original: bar byed de go bar byed do //
analyzed: bar byed de go bar byed do //
translated: It appears and conveys the meaning.

original: mar me gzugs las byung ba ma yin yang gsal bar nus pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mar me gzugs las byung ba ma yin yang gsal bar nus pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lamp does not arise from form, but it has the power to illuminate. This is the meaning.

original: gal te ji ltar rang bzhin gyi sa gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar rang bzhin gyi sa gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how the nature does not illuminate,

original: 'brel ba yod pa dang med pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba yod pa dang med pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the word is not understood from the word itself, because the word is not related to the meaning, because the word is related to the meaning, because the word is related to the meaning and because the word is not related to the meaning.

original: de dran pa las sgra dang rtags dag gis rang gi don gyis yul rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de dran pa las sgra dang rtags dag gis rang gi don gyis yul rtogs par byed do //
translated: The meaning is understood from the word through memory of the relation between the word and the meaning.

original: mang po mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig la don mang po mthong ba ste go'i sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: mang po mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig la don mang po mthong ba ste go'i sgra lta bu'o //
translated: The word is seen to have many meanings, for example, the word go is seen to have many meanings.

original: de la yang don gcig tu blta bar mi nus te rtogs par mi nus so //üîΩyang dang yang ste don gzhan dang gzhan mthong na yang de dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: de la yang don gcig tu blta bar mi nus te rtogs par mi nus so // yang dang yang ste don gzhan dang gzhan mthong na yang de dag kyang yin te /
translated: It is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one, because it is not possible to understand it as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.

original: khyad par gzhan mthong nas yang sgra de don gzhan du sbyor bar byed pa ni phyin ci log yin te /üîΩsgra'i don snga ma las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan mthong nas yang sgra de don gzhan du sbyor bar byed pa ni phyin ci log yin te / sgra'i don snga ma las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i don la de ltar the tshom za ba nyid srid do //üîΩde ltar don du ma la yang ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i don la de ltar the tshom za ba nyid srid do //üîΩde ltar don du ma la yang ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: When the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.üîΩWhen the word is seen to have many meanings, it is not possible to see the meaning of the word go as one.

original: brda'i dus na ji ltar mthong ba'i don ni rtogs la mthong ba gzhan du gyur pa ni sgra de nyid don gzhan la brdar byas pa'o //
analyzed: brda'i dus na ji ltar mthong ba'i don ni rtogs la mthong ba gzhan du gyur pa ni sgra de nyid don gzhan la brdar byas pa'o //
translated: At the time of the convention, the meaning that is seen is understood. The transformation of seeing is the convention of that sound for another meaning.

original: de ltar na don gzhan de yang 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir sgra don du ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na don gzhan de yang 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir sgra don du ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, that other meaning is also grasped, so the sound is endowed with many meanings.

original: de nyid dper brjod pa ni ji ltar ka li zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid dper brjod pa ni ji ltar ka li zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The example of that is stated as ‚Äújust as kali,‚Äù and so on.

original: brda'i dbang gis 'jug pa de'i phyir brda'i 'brel pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid la ltos nas so //
analyzed: brda'i dbang gis 'jug pa de'i phyir brda'i 'brel pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid la ltos nas so //
translated: Because of engaging by the power of the convention, the connection of the convention is seen and not seen.

original: don gags mi byed pa'i phyir don ni kho bo sgra 'dis brjod par mi bya'o zhes mi spong bas so //
analyzed: don gags mi byed pa'i phyir don ni kho bo sgra 'dis brjod par mi bya'o zhes mi spong bas so //
translated: Because the meaning does not obstruct, the meaning is not rejected, thinking, ‚ÄúI will not express this meaning with this sound.‚Äù

original: 'khrugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don sna tshogs 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don sna tshogs 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It would be confused means the various meanings would change.

original: dpyod pa pa 'di dag ni skyes bu thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod pas thams cad mkhyen pa med par rig byed kyi don phyin ci ma log par bdag nyid kyis kyang ma rtogs la /
analyzed: dpyod pa pa 'di dag ni skyes bu thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod pas thams cad mkhyen pa med par rig byed kyi don phyin ci ma log par bdag nyid kyis kyang ma rtogs la /
translated: Since the Mima·πÉsakas assert that all beings possess attachment and so on, they do not understand the meaning of the Vedas unmistakenly by themselves, for they do not possess omniscience.

original: gzhan gyis lung phog ste bshad pas kyang mi rtogs te de yad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis lung phog ste bshad pas kyang mi rtogs te de yad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They also do not understand the meaning of the Vedas through the explanations of others, for they are possessed by attachment and so on.

original: rig byed nyid kyang bram ze'i don ni 'dir yin te 'di ma yin no zhes zer bas de nyid kyis kyang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: rig byed nyid kyang bram ze'i don ni 'dir yin te 'di ma yin no zhes zer bas de nyid kyis kyang mi rtogs so //
translated: They also do not understand the meaning of the Vedas through the Vedas themselves, for they say, The meaning of the Vedas is this, not that.

original: de ltar na brda'i dbang gis don sna tshogs @214b la de la 'gog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na brda'i dbang gis don sna tshogs @214b la de la 'gog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since there is no refutation of the various meanings of the Vedas due to the power of convention,üîΩthose who desire high status should make fire offerings.

original: mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg sbyin zhes bya ba rig byed kyi tshogs 'di sgra'i nus pa ni 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg sbyin zhes bya ba rig byed kyi tshogs 'di sgra'i nus pa ni 'di lta bu ste /
translated: The power of the words of the Vedas is like this.

original: me ni aag ni ste skad kyi dbyings las aa ge ga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: me ni aag ni ste skad kyi dbyings las aa ge ga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Fire is Agni, from the verbal root ga, to go, and so on.

original: de ltar na khyi yang 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na khyi yang 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i sgras bstan to //
translated: Thus, since a dog also goes, it is indicated by the word goer.

original: sbyin sreg ni ho tra ste /
analyzed: sbyin sreg ni ho tra ste /
translated: Homa is hotra.

original: skad kyi dbyings las ho ni dan aa dan zhes 'dren pa na aa da na'i bza' ba ste /
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings las ho ni dan aa dan zhes 'dren pa na aa da na'i bza' ba ste /
translated: In the analysis of the word hotra, ho is adana, which means eating.

original: sha yang bza' ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sha yang bza' ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since meat is also eaten,

original: aa da ni sgras bstan to //
analyzed: aa da ni sgras bstan to //
translated: it is indicated by the word adana.üîΩJyotishtoma is jyotishtoma.

original: sbyin ni dzoo ha y'a da de 'dir ho'i sbra snga ma dang 'dra bas bza'o zhes bya bar 'dren pas na khyi sha za zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin ni dzoo ha y'a da de 'dir ho'i sbra snga ma dang 'dra bas bza'o zhes bya bar 'dren pas na khyi sha za zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the former ho is like the former ho, it is drawn as ‚Äúeating,‚Äù thus it is said to be ‚Äúeating dog meat.‚Äù

original: gal te 'jig rten la grags pa ste sgra'i nus pa ji lta ba bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten la grags pa ste sgra'i nus pa ji lta ba bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is known in the world, it is not exactly the power of the word.

original: sgra'i don khyi sha bza' zhes bya ba yang yin pas don du ma yin pa las cig shos bor te grags pa kho na btus pa de ji lta bu grags pa'i don yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni mi snang ste
analyzed: sgra'i don khyi sha bza' zhes bya ba yang yin pas don du ma yin pa las cig shos bor te grags pa kho na btus pa de ji lta bu grags pa'i don yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni mi snang ste
translated: Since the meaning of the word is also ‚Äúeating dog meat,‚Äù the other is omitted from among the many meanings and only the known one is taken, but it is not known how the known meaning is the meaning and the other is not.

original: / dbang pos mi gsod do //
analyzed: / dbang pos mi gsod do //
translated: One should not kill a brahmin.

original: 'on kyang grags pa kho na 'di'i don yin no zhes bya ba de shes pa dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i skyes bu 'ga' yod dam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang grags pa kho na 'di'i don yin no zhes bya ba de shes pa dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i skyes bu 'ga' yod dam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But the meaning of this is that there is some omniscient person who sees the meaning of the supersensible state of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang sgra'i nus pa sna tshogs pa las grags pa 'di kho na'o zhes mngon sum gyis ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra'i nus pa sna tshogs pa las grags pa 'di kho na'o zhes mngon sum gyis ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: Moreover, it is not established by direct perception that this is the only usage of the word, because of the various potencies of words.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang mngon sum gnyis tshad mar 'dod pa'i phyogs bsal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang mngon sum gnyis tshad mar 'dod pa'i phyogs bsal lo //
translated: Therefore, the position that both words and direct perception are valid cognitions is refuted.

original: rig byed gcig tshad mar 'dod pa ni shin tu yang bsal lo //
analyzed: rig byed gcig tshad mar 'dod pa ni shin tu yang bsal lo //
translated: The position that one of the Vedas is a valid cognition is also refuted.

original: gal te gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa sgra dang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gsum du smra ba yang bsal te /
analyzed: gal te gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa sgra dang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gsum du smra ba yang bsal te /
translated: If one says that the Vedas are a valid cognition, then the position of Kumarila and others who advocate three means of valid cognition, namely, direct perception, inference, and verbal testimony, is also refuted.

original: rig byed ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la dgongs pa yin la /
analyzed: rig byed ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la dgongs pa yin la /
translated: The Vedas are intended for the purpose of extremely hidden objects.

original: me'i sbyin sreg bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'jig rten gyi grags pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i rtags kyang yod pa ma yin pas dbang po las 'das pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: me'i sbyin sreg bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'jig rten gyi grags pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i rtags kyang yod pa ma yin pas dbang po las 'das pa'i don yin no //
translated: There is no reason to suppose that the meaning of a word is beyond the senses.

original: gal te de ltar sgra'i don ma grags par smra ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sgra'i don ma grags par smra ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that no one would use a word whose meaning is not well known,

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis mtho ris kyi sgra ni 'dod pa'i dga' ba yin par bshad de lha'i don du grags pa bor ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis mtho ris kyi sgra ni 'dod pa'i dga' ba yin par bshad de lha'i don du grags pa bor ro //
translated: then why does Prince AjƒÅta≈õatru say that the sound of the heavens is the joy of desire? He has forgotten the meaning of the word ‚Äúheaven.‚Äù

original: au pa si'i sgra'i blugs gzar ram srub shing du bshad de /
analyzed: au pa si'i sgra'i blugs gzar ram srub shing du bshad de /
translated: Why does UpƒÅli say that the ladle or the churning stick is the sound of the heavens?

original: brgya byin gyis chung ma grags pa bor ro //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis chung ma grags pa bor ro //
translated: He has forgotten the meaning of the word ‚Äúheaven.‚Äù

original: me la sbyin sreg sbyin zhes bya ba'i sgra gzhan yang de bzhin du'o //üîΩgrags pa kho na 'di'i don yin @215a * //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg sbyin zhes bya ba'i sgra gzhan yang de bzhin du'o // grags pa kho na 'di'i don yin @215a * //
translated: The expression ‚Äúmake an offering to the fire‚Äù is similar.

original: no zhes sgrub par yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: no zhes sgrub par yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: You cannot prove that the meaning of a word is well known.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrang las ma grub nus ma yin //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rang las ma grub nus ma yin //
translated: Why is that?üîΩYou cannot prove something that is not established for you.

original: des dpyod pa pa khyod rang la grags pa kho na'i don yin par ma grub ste /
analyzed: des dpyod pa pa khyod rang la grags pa kho na'i don yin par ma grub ste /
translated: You cannot prove that the meaning of a word is well known to you.

original: mtho ris la sogs pa khyed ma grags ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs pa khyed ma grags ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because you apply the term ‚Äúheaven‚Äù and so on to what is not renowned.

original: la la ni sgra don rab tu ma grub phyir zhes 'don te /
analyzed: la la ni sgra don rab tu ma grub phyir zhes 'don te /
translated: Some editions read ‚Äúbecause the meaning of the term is not established.‚Äù

original: des ni sgra dang don dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel pa rab tu ma grub ba'i phyir zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni sgra dang don dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel pa rab tu ma grub ba'i phyir zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This means that the relationship between the term and the thing is not established.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa ni snga ma ltar na ni khyod gzhan yang ma grags pa'i don sbyor ro zhes so //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa ni snga ma ltar na ni khyod gzhan yang ma grags pa'i don sbyor ro zhes so //
translated: The objection is the same as before: ‚ÄúYou apply the meaning of the term to what is not renowned.‚Äù

original: phyi ma ltar na ni rig byed rtag pa nyid kyi phyir de'i bdag nyid ni dngos por mi byed la /
analyzed: phyi ma ltar na ni rig byed rtag pa nyid kyi phyir de'i bdag nyid ni dngos por mi byed la /
translated: In the latter case, because the Veda is permanent, it does not make things into its nature.

original: de las tha dad ni de dang 'brel pa med do zhes sngar bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad ni de dang 'brel pa med do zhes sngar bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: If it is different from that, it is not related to that. This is as explained earlier.

original: mi'i brjod pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu ste /üîΩde yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: mi'i brjod pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu ste / de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe expression of humans‚Äù refers to a person.üîΩMoreover, it refers to the expression of one who possesses attachment and so on.

original: de yang ni 'dod chags pa dang ldan pa'i brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ni 'dod chags pa dang ldan pa'i brjod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it refers to the expression of one who is attached.

original: de dag las ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o grags pa des ni rig byed kyi don yang rtogs bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag las ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o grags pa des ni rig byed kyi don yang rtogs bar 'dod do //
translated: And by that very fame, he also wishes to understand the meaning of the Vedas.

original: mi'i grags pa de nyid las gcig par tshad ma ma yin par sdang ba dang / rig byed kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir tshad mar smra bar 'dod pa can nam ci ste rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi'i grags pa de nyid las gcig par tshad ma ma yin par sdang ba dang / rig byed kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir tshad mar smra bar 'dod pa can nam ci ste rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the point of claiming that fame is not a valid cognition with regard to human affairs, and that it is a valid cognition for understanding the meaning of the Vedas? It is contradictory to your own words.

original: gal te grags pa mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gal te grags pa mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If you do not accept fame,

original: gal te grags pa btang na ni rig byed kyi don brtag pa'i rgyu mtshan te thabs med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te grags pa btang na ni rig byed kyi don brtag pa'i rgyu mtshan te thabs med par 'gyur la /
translated: if you abandon fame, there would be no reason or means to investigate the meaning of the Vedas.

original: gal te grags pa bzung na yang /
analyzed: gal te grags pa bzung na yang /
translated: If you accept fame,

original: grags pa'ang skyes bu'i yin pas tshad ma ma yin phyir /
analyzed: grags pa'ang skyes bu'i yin pas tshad ma ma yin phyir /
translated: since fame also belongs to a person, it is not a valid cognition.

original: ci'i rgyus ni grags pa de 'dzin byed //
analyzed: ci'i rgyus ni grags pa de 'dzin byed //
translated: For what reason do you accept that fame?

original: gzhan yang grags pa bzung na sgra don nges par bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang grags pa bzung na sgra don nges par bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, if you accept fame,

original: skyes bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sbangs na shin tu lkog tu gyur pan don dngos su mthong ba'i grags par brda byed pa med pa'i phyir yid gnyis kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sbangs na shin tu lkog tu gyur pan don dngos su mthong ba'i grags par brda byed pa med pa'i phyir yid gnyis kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: If one refutes omniscience of a person, then because there is no communication of a sign that actually sees the meaning of the very hidden, there is only doubt.

original: gal te grags pa gang la rigs pa'i gnod pa med pa de'i don gzung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grags pa gang la rigs pa'i gnod pa med pa de'i don gzung ngo zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúOne should accept the meaning of whatever is renowned that is not undermined by reasoning,‚Äù

original: rigs pa'i rtsod pa med pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i rtsod pa med pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then one should say, ‚ÄúThere is no undermining by reasoning.‚Äù

original: skyes bu g-yon can dag bslu ba'i thabs brda dka' ba smra ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu g-yon can dag bslu ba'i thabs brda dka' ba smra ba ste /
translated: Crafty people speak difficult signs that deceive others.

original: skyon med pa'i bram ze mo la 'di ltar lkog tu sus kyang ma mthong ba na nyes pa med ces smra ba ste /
analyzed: skyon med pa'i bram ze mo la 'di ltar lkog tu sus kyang ma mthong ba na nyes pa med ces smra ba ste /
translated: For example, a faultless brahmin woman says, ‚ÄúIf no one sees this in secret, there is no fault.‚Äù

original: de la rigs pa gang yang gnod pa mi byed de /
analyzed: de la rigs pa gang yang gnod pa mi byed de /
translated: In that case, no reasoning at all undermines her.

original: lkog tu @215b mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang rtags kyang med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu @215b mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang rtags kyang med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because direct perception does not engage in secret and there are no signs.

original: lung de'i don ni shin tu bskal ba yin te mngon sum pa dang lkog tu gyur pa dag ni lung gcig pu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung de'i don ni shin tu bskal ba yin te mngon sum pa dang lkog tu gyur pa dag ni lung gcig pu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of that scriptural passage is very far-fetched, because the manifest and the obscure are not the meaning of a single scriptural passage.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i skyes bu nyid med na lung gi don spyad pa 'dis rigs pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i skyes bu nyid med na lung gi don spyad pa 'dis rigs pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: If there were no omniscient person, it would be impossible to understand the meaning of the scriptural passage by this method.

original: gal te rig byed kyi dum bu phyogs gzhan gyis gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi dum bu phyogs gzhan gyis gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that another part of the Veda makes clear,

original: de yang sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma ltar the tshom nyid byed do //
analyzed: de yang sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma ltar the tshom nyid byed do //
translated: then, because that also is just sound, it creates doubt just as before.

original: de lta bas na mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to conclude,

original: sgra bdag nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgra bdag nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe sound ‚ÄòI‚Äô is not capable, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don ston pa'i sgra ni skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir don ston pa'i sgra ni skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the sound that reveals the meaning is dependent on a person,

original: gal te kho bos ci zhig shes rig byed las de skad bstan to zhes smras kyang rgyal dpog pa bdag nyid kyis me la sbyin sreg bya ba'i don grags pa kho na yin par smra bas bstan pa yin la rig byed nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te kho bos ci zhig shes rig byed las de skad bstan to zhes smras kyang rgyal dpog pa bdag nyid kyis me la sbyin sreg bya ba'i don grags pa kho na yin par smra bas bstan pa yin la rig byed nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if we say that we teach what we know, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas say that the purpose of fire sacrifice is well known, and they say that it is taught, but it is not taught by the Vedas.

original: dper na skyes bu 'ga' la lam dris pa na /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu 'ga' la lam dris pa na /
translated: For example, if someone asks about a path,

original: 'di skad ces sdong du ma 'di na re lam 'di yin no zhes zer zhes smra ba dang / gnyis pa kho bos rang lam 'di yin no zhes smra'o zhes zer ba dag gi khyad par rtogs te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces sdong du ma 'di na re lam 'di yin no zhes zer zhes smra ba dang / gnyis pa kho bos rang lam 'di yin no zhes smra'o zhes zer ba dag gi khyad par rtogs te /
translated: one might say, ‚ÄúThis tree says that this is the path,‚Äù or one might say, ‚ÄúI myself say that this is the path.‚Äù The difference between these two is understood.

original: de dag rang nyid las ston par khyad par med kyi /
analyzed: de dag rang nyid las ston par khyad par med kyi /
translated: There is no difference between them in that they are teachers.

original: cig shos sdong dum ston pa ni mi rigs par brjod par zad do //
analyzed: cig shos sdong dum ston pa ni mi rigs par brjod par zad do //
translated: However, the one who points to the tree is said to be unreasonable.

original: gal te brda la ltos pa med na don kun tu ni rigs pa las so //
analyzed: gal te brda la ltos pa med na don kun tu ni rigs pa las so //
translated: If it does not depend on convention, then all objects are known from reasoning.

original: mi sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i don //
analyzed: mi sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i don //
translated: The purpose of fire sacrifice and so on

original: gcig pu nges pa 'di ga las //
analyzed: gcig pu nges pa 'di ga las //
translated: is not ascertained as being one.

original: de lta bas na brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig las gzhan gang gis dbang po las 'das shes zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig las gzhan gang gis dbang po las 'das shes zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúby something other than the words that are intended to express it.‚Äù

original: gal te brda'i phyogs la ji ltar don nges she na skyes bus sgra 'dis 'di brjod par bya'o zhes 'dod pa'i don nges par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gal te brda'i phyogs la ji ltar don nges she na skyes bus sgra 'dis 'di brjod par bya'o zhes 'dod pa'i don nges par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: If it is asked how there is ascertainment of the meaning in the position of the sign, the cause of ascertaining the intended meaning is the person who says, ‚ÄúThis is expressed by this word.‚Äù

original: brda yis ni nges pa de gsal bar byed de tha snyad kyi dus su go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brda yis ni nges pa de gsal bar byed de tha snyad kyi dus su go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The sign clarifies that ascertainment, which is the understanding at the time of the convention.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis sgra'i don nges par ston to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis sgra'i don nges par ston to zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the meaning of the word is ascertained by nature,

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i yul dang 'gro lding ba dag tso ra zhes bya ba'i sgra gcig nyid chom rkun dang bza' ba lta bur sbyor ba de yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i yul dang 'gro lding ba dag tso ra zhes bya ba'i sgra gcig nyid chom rkun dang bza' ba lta bur sbyor ba de yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the statement ‚Äúin another place‚Äù would not exist, such as in the land of the ƒÅryas and in Dravi·∏ça, where the single word tsora is used for ‚Äúthief‚Äù and ‚Äúfood.‚Äù

original: gal te brda yis rang bzhin gyis 'brel ba de gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brda yis rang bzhin gyis 'brel ba de gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the sign clarifies that natural connection,

original: yang brda ni sna tshogs su 'jug pa'i phyir don gcig tu ris pa ga las te me'i sbyin sreg lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang brda ni sna tshogs su 'jug pa'i phyir don gcig tu ris pa ga las te me'i sbyin sreg lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, since a sign is applied in various ways, how can it be restricted to a single meaning? For example, the fire sacrifice.

original: gal te brda ji lta ba bzhin nges pa yang de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brda ji lta ba bzhin nges pa yang de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the restriction is just like the sign,

original: gang la @216a * //
analyzed: gang la @216a * //
translated: then what is the restrictionüîΩin the case of a sign that is applied by the wish of a person?

original: rang dags te brda gang la skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa de la de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i nges pa la yang nges pa zhes bya ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rang dags te brda gang la skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa de la de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i nges pa la yang nges pa zhes bya ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the restriction in the case of a restriction that is applied by the wish of a person?

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: brda yis gsal bar byed na ni //
analyzed: brda yis gsal bar byed na ni //
translated: if you clarify by means of a sign,

original: khyi sha bza' zhes bya ba ltar //
analyzed: khyi sha bza' zhes bya ba ltar //
translated: then just as in the case of ‚Äúeat dog meat,‚Äù

original: mi 'dod pa nyid kyang gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyid kyang gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: you would also clarify what is not desired.

original: yang kha cig lung gi tshig gi phyogs gcig nges par mi slu bar grub pas tshig de'i lhag ma rnams kyang de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang kha cig lung gi tshig gi phyogs gcig nges par mi slu bar grub pas tshig de'i lhag ma rnams kyang de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, some say that since one part of the words of scripture is established as nondeceptive, the remainder of those words is also nondeceptive because it is a part of that.

original: nges par mi slu ba'i lung gi mtshan nyid du smra'o //
analyzed: nges par mi slu ba'i lung gi mtshan nyid du smra'o //
translated: Therefore, they say that the definition of scripture is nondeceptive.

original: de ni rigs te zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don tsam ni yod pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de ni rigs te zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don tsam ni yod pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: That is correct means that the mere meaning of the term exists.

original: 'dod pas sgra sbyor bar nus pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa dag phyi'i don dang mi mthun par tha snyad byed pa yang mthong ba'i phyir lung gi mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pas sgra sbyor bar nus pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa dag phyi'i don dang mi mthun par tha snyad byed pa yang mthong ba'i phyir lung gi mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: Since one can employ a term according to one‚Äôs wish, one sees that worldly people employ conventions that do not accord with external objects.

original: mngon sum log pa ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum log pa ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: The negation of direct perception is the non-observation of what can be seen.

original: thams cad nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: Everything means entities.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus so //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus so //
translated: Everywhere means place and time.

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi dmigs pas cung zad dgag pa mi 'grub bam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi dmigs pas cung zad dgag pa mi 'grub bam zhe na /
translated: If non-observation is merely non-seeing, how can it establish the negation of anything?

original: 'jug pa'i sngon du blo 'gro'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sngon du blo 'gro'i phyir //
translated: Because the mind precedes engagement,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i sngon du de dmigs pa 'gro ba'i phyir dmigs pa med pa tsam de ni rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa'i tha snyad mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i sngon du de dmigs pa 'gro ba'i phyir dmigs pa med pa tsam de ni rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa'i tha snyad mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: Because the perception of that precedes the application of the convention of existence, the mere non-perception of that is not the cause for the application of the convention of non-existence.

original: 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can no //
translated: It has the effect of cessation.

original: gzhan ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The other is the non-perception of appearance.

original: de ni med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'o //
translated: That is the cause for the application of the convention of non-existence.

original: yod na mthong bar rigs pa mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan te de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na mthong bar rigs pa mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan te de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-perception of what should be perceived if it exists is the reason for the convention of non-existence, because of seeing that.

original: rang gi rgyu yod pas zhes bya bar sbyar te ;
analyzed: rang gi rgyu yod pas zhes bya bar sbyar te ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the existence of its cause‚Äù should be supplied.

original: rang ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: rang ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: ‚ÄúIts‚Äù refers to the convention of non-existence.

original: de'i rgyu ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts cause‚Äù is the non-perception of appearance.

original: de yod pa yang yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de yod pa yang yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog par byed do //
translated: The existence of that also causes the cessation of the convention of existence.

original: bzlog pa'i rgyu med pa zhes sbyar te bzlog pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i rgyu med pa zhes sbyar te bzlog pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the absence of the cause of the opposite‚Äù should be supplied. The opposite is the convention of existence.

original: de ni rgyu ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Its cause is perception.

original: de med pa ni mi dmigs pa tsam mo //
analyzed: de med pa ni mi dmigs pa tsam mo //
translated: The absence of that is mere non-perception.

original: de yang yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pas so //
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pas so //
translated: Moreover, since the convention of existence is refuted,

original: med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pas ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la the tshom za la /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pas ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la the tshom za la /
translated: one doubts the non-perception of the non-appearing,

original: gzhan snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni the tshom las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni the tshom las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: and one reverses doubt with regard to the non-perception of the appearing other.

original: 'di gnyis 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: These two have different effects.

original: dang po nyid ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The first is the non-perception of the appearing.

original: de ldog pa mthong ba @216b 'dir ro //
analyzed: de ldog pa mthong ba @216b 'dir ro //
translated: Here, one sees the cessation of that.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni gtan tshigs de'i bdag nyid de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni gtan tshigs de'i bdag nyid de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of the reason, which is the property to be established.

original: de tsam ste rtags yod pa tsam dang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam ste rtags yod pa tsam dang ngo //
translated: That much is the mere existence of the reason.

original: rjes su 'brel pa ni rtags yod pa tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yod pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa ni rtags yod pa tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yod pa tsam ste /
translated: The relation is the mere existence of the property to be established by the mere existence of the reason.

original: de las gzhan la mi ltos pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan la mi ltos pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature that does not depend on anything else.

original: gal te bye brag la mi ltos pa dper na mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te bye brag la mi ltos pa dper na mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: If it does not depend on particulars, like impermanence,

original: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: for example, because it exists,üîΩthen it is a reason that is contradictory with the property to be established.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba yang rgyu med pa can ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i don 'phel mod kyi /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba yang rgyu med pa can ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i don 'phel mod kyi /
translated: And since what is called existent is not causeless, the meaning of cause is indeed extended.

original: de ni don gyis 'phangs kyi sgra yis ma brjod pa'i phyir bye brag la mi ltos pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni don gyis 'phangs kyi sgra yis ma brjod pa'i phyir bye brag la mi ltos pa zhes brjod do //
translated: But since that is implied by the meaning, not by the word, it is said to not rely on a specific case.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba gzhan ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba gzhan ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Another classification of natural reasons is that which arises immediately upon effort, and so on.

original: tshad ma dag gis rang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: tshad ma dag gis rang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can 'jug pa'am /
translated: The so-called property to be established by the valid cognitions is that which engages in refuting the similar class,

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag go //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag go //
translated: or it is direct perception and non-observation.

original: khyab pa dang chos can la brten pa dag tshad mas ma des pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rtags des bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa dang chos can la brten pa dag tshad mas ma des pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rtags des bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion and the property possessor, which are not ascertained by valid cognition, are not understood to be established by that reason which has the nature of being unestablished.

original: gal te rtags kyi don rang nyid kyis go bar byed pa nyid ma yin nam tshad mas nges pa ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gal te rtags kyi don rang nyid kyis go bar byed pa nyid ma yin nam tshad mas nges pa ci dgos she na /
translated: If the meaning of the reason is not itself understood, what need is there to ascertain it by valid cognition?

original: gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is: because it illuminates.

original: gsal ba de'i mtshan nyid tshad mas ma mthong bar ni mar me rang gi don bum pa gsal bar rtogs par byed pa med do //
analyzed: gsal ba de'i mtshan nyid tshad mas ma mthong bar ni mar me rang gi don bum pa gsal bar rtogs par byed pa med do //
translated: Without seeing the nature of that illumination by means of valid cognition, the lamp does not illuminate its own object, the pot.

original: de bzhin du rtags kyang rang nyid go bar nus pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtags kyang rang nyid go bar nus pa yin mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, although the evidence is capable of being understood by itself,

original: 'brel pa dang phyogs kyi chos tshad mas ma nges pa ni rtags can go bar mi byed do //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang phyogs kyi chos tshad mas ma nges pa ni rtags can go bar mi byed do //
translated: if the relation and the property of the subject are not ascertained by valid cognition, the evidence does not cause understanding of the thesis.

original: tshad mas 'brel pa nges ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad mas 'brel pa nges ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because the relation is ascertained by valid cognition,

original: nges pa'i khyab bya go byed de //
analyzed: nges pa'i khyab bya go byed de //
translated: the pervaded, which is ascertained, is what is to be understood.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩphyogs nges par bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // phyogs nges par bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: This is what is said.üîΩThe subject is not indicated.

original: mi bstan pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mi bstan pa kho na ste /
translated: It is not indicated at all.

original: rtags kyi 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i dus su ni /
analyzed: rtags kyi 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i dus su ni /
translated: At the time of not understanding the relation of the evidence,

original: phyogs bstan pas go bar mi nus la /
analyzed: phyogs bstan pas go bar mi nus la /
translated: it cannot be understood by indicating the subject.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid dang khyab pa nges pas ni phyogs rtogs zin pa'i phyir yang phyogs bstan pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid dang khyab pa nges pas ni phyogs rtogs zin pa'i phyir yang phyogs bstan pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the property of the subject and the pervasion are ascertained, it is also pointless to indicate the subject, since the subject is already understood.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel par tshad mas ma des na ni /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel par tshad mas ma des na ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not established by valid knowledge that the self and the aggregates are related by way of their own characteristics.üîΩ

original: bsgrub par bya ba de log pas rtags de'i ldog pa yang nges ba med do //üîΩde'i phyir tshad mas 'brel pa zhes bya bar nges par @217a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de log pas rtags de'i ldog pa yang nges ba med do // de'i phyir tshad mas 'brel pa zhes bya bar nges par @217a * //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of the reason is not ascertained by the exclusion of the probandum.

original: rab tu bsgrubs nas ldog pa nges par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrubs nas ldog pa nges par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having established the so-called relation by means of a valid cognition, the exclusion should be stated.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by mere non-perception,

original: de tsam dang ldan pa la yang go bar byed pa ma yin pa gzugs khyad par med ba zhes bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam dang ldan pa la yang go bar byed pa ma yin pa gzugs khyad par med ba zhes bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when possessing that much, there is the perception of what does not serve as an indicator, called form without distinction.üîΩNature and connection

original: rang bzhin dang ni rjes 'brel nyid //üîΩces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni rjes 'brel nyid // ces bya ba ni /
translated: Nature and subsequent attainment.üîΩüîΩ

original: rang gi rgyu las de ltar skyes pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las de ltar skyes pa'am /
translated: It means that which arises from its own cause in that way,

original: yang na rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or it means that which has its own nature.üîΩThus, phenomena that depend

original: 'di ltar ltos pa'i chos rnams ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos pa'i chos rnams ni //
translated: In this way, phenomena that are dependentüîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang zhig 'byung ba rgyu gzhan la ltos pa de ni nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang zhig 'byung ba rgyu gzhan la ltos pa de ni nges pa med pa ste /
translated: And so on. That which arises depending on other causes is uncertain.

original: dper na gos grub pa la dmar po nyid bzhin no //üîΩchos 'byung ba rnams kyang 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sbyor ba 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: dper na gos grub pa la dmar po nyid bzhin no // chos 'byung ba rnams kyang 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sbyor ba 'phen par byed do //
translated: For example, it is like the redness of a cloth that is already produced.üîΩAnd because the destruction of things depends on another cause.

original: dngos po 'jig pa rang gi rgyu las gzhan la ltos pa med pa nges par 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa rang gi rgyu las gzhan la ltos pa med pa nges par 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument is as follows: ‚ÄúThe destruction of things that do not depend on another cause for their destruction is certain.

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: But the destruction of things such as pots depends on another cause.

original: bum pa la sogs pa de dag gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad na rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa de dag gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad na rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If pots and so on did not come into contact with a cause of destruction, they would be permanent.
